review.title: Wonderful hotel great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel amenities were suited to needs. Room comfort was excellent, heated pool enclosed in courtyard was nice sized and enjoyable. Breakfast offered til 10am. Nice selection to get one's day started early for sightseeing, includes wafflemaker. 
Local transportation is readily available and easily accessible for travel to all favorite sights or neighborhoods. 
Room had single king sized bed, it was roomy, comfortable, overlooked street. Have to admit noise was a factor, head phones solved the problem.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a perfect location.
review.reviewText: Great spot. Extremely useful front desk staff. Location perfect.

review.title: Nice hotel 10 minute bus ride #47 to Fisherman's W
review.reviewText:
Nice staff, clean, comfortable bed, keurig coffee pot in room. 

No drapes in room only vertical blinds. Glaring pool lights in room but slept ok due to all the walking and pooped out at night. 

Would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice and confortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located, waking distance to everywhere. Nice and quiet, the employees very nice and polite.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Our experience was nice.  Staff was nice!  Parking was great!
review.positiveRemarks: That it had hot water. Easy access from the parking lot.
review.locationRemarks: Location was near to where we needed to go.  Location was also close to everything.....union square, fisherman's wharf, shopping, etc.

review.reviewText: If you don't ask you don't get. Like refrigerator.

review.title: Good location, short walk to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice friendly staff, great size pool, a short walk to the main front

review.title: The hotel was nice, we had plenty of space.
review.reviewText: Our neighbors tv was too loud, or the walls are too thin...unable to sleep well.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and breakfasts.
review.negativeRemarks: Insulation or noise proof the walls.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, restaurants, att Park, tours, Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Doesn't look like in the pictures
review.reviewText: Old , smelling rooms, bugs. We changed 2 rooms but all are smelling. Rooms to the street very noisy. Beakfast ok. Room service bad first day ok after.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
While the hotel has a good location some aspects of the hotel need to be addressed. The lobby was okay, but the overall condition was disappointing. The service elevators were unreliable and very slow. The breakfast / dining area was in very poor condition and not very well serviced. The quality and standard of the food was below average.
I would not recommend this hotel to my friends
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the lobby staff
review.negativeRemarks: An upgrade of the facilities throughout the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Good morning walk to Fishermans Wharf area.

review.reviewText: Hotel photos in Expedia are very misleading.  In their photos rooms appear much larger, with balconies that overlook a pool, with well appointed furniture and big windows with drapes.  None was true of the room I was given. The establishment is a motor lodge rather than a hotel.  Rooms are accessed from outside rather than from inside the building.  The room was very dark because of the very small window with no drapes.  The fixture overhead was very dim.  My room was n the fifth floor.  The elevator only went to the 4 th floor.  I had to drag my luggage up a narrow flight of stairs around the back of the building to the fifth floor.  There was no alarm clock and had very thin walls with no sound proofing.  I could hear the couple next door engaging in coitus.  There were black hairs n the shower.  I humored the next morning when an employee was carefully monitoring the guests for the very cheap breakfast of only carb and no protein options.  I have never been so misled by a hotel description n Expedia.  Expedia was not successful in getting the motor lodge to refund the two nights I did not use.  I will be disputing the charges with the credit card company.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Confusing layout and not convenient for guests
review.reviewText: I didn't expect a fabulous experience but I did expect a better then Motel 6 experience for the price. The layout of the hotel rooms and floors is atrocious. There is no easy way to get down to the lobby from your room - all room entrances are from the outside and its a maze to get to your car or to the lobby. They also didn't have a basic amenity such as a toothbrush for guests that happen to forget one. For the rate of pay I would have expected at least that.I have to give them kudos for the crisp apple at the complimentary breakfast though.
review.positiveRemarks: The apple and coffee in the room. I was though very pleased with the bed/mattress quality.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary toothbrushes. There is nothing they can do about the poor layout of the rooms to lobby access.

review.title: Great view from our room. Right on the beach.
review.reviewText: Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Loved being able to build a fire on the beach.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to Fisherman's Warf. We found lots of good food nearby.

review.title: tourist stuff
review.reviewText:
Perfect hotel for the "tourist" attractions.  It's possible to find parking on the street but difficult.  Our children loved the heated pool.
 We highly recommend this hotel
The front desk lady was a complete nightmare!!! Not friendly what so ever. The need a nicer person, she was very rude and condescending.
Navigating hotel and parking a challenge. Breakfast environment cramped, noisy, and uncomfortable. Limited food choices most of which are cold.
review.locationRemarks: 10 min walk to Ghirardelli square.

review.reviewText: The hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Had a late check in at 12:30am and it was easy and quickly done
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean, Breakfast was decent and the location was perfect

review.title: Staff
review.reviewText: The Staff is amazing specially Rosario kind enough to let me check in earlier.
hotel was clean and breakfast was good.  i would stay there again if i had business in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: front desk staff at checkin was brusk

review.title: San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: We've stayed in the hotel for a night and that was very nice experience. They let us check-in earlier, there's a parking on-site, room was clean, the only thing is a smell but I think it's the building itself. The breakfast was OK, location is close to attractions.

review.title: Exelent
review.reviewText: It was a exelent hotel a good low price but worth every penny it was an exelent condition overall I was in love with this hotel in

Hotel was in good location, clean, and staff was very good.  However, I would say the rating of 3.5 was high.  I would put it in the 2.5 range, compared to other hotels I have stayed in with a 3-star rating.

Many tourist locations could be reached in walks of 30 minutes or less, and daily parking rates were more reasonable than other hotels I looked at.

Based on the cost/value, I found it reasonable and would stay in this facility again if travelling to San Francisco for personal travel.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access by walking to a number of tourist attractions (Fisherman's Wharf, Coit Tower, Lombardo Street, Chinatown).

review.title: Great view, clean room, AMAZING STAFF!
review.reviewText: After reading reviews on 30 different hotels in my price range (under 160 a night) without any luck, I finally found this gem. Experience from beginning to end was flawless. Available parking as soon as we pulled up which in SF is not easy to find... Walk in the lobby doors and immediately was greeted by the most WONDERFUL employee I've EVER encountered at any business (I'm not exaggerating by saying this). Stacy made my friend and I feel like we were coming home to visit mom who hadn't seen us in a year. She explained everything to us so throughly and we felt like we could ask her 100 questions without her being bothered by us. Her energy was so refreshing and it was great to have our first interaction with someone a postive one after being on the road for 5 hours. I could seriously write a book about how much I adored this woman. Just know, this hotel is clean, smells good, no bugs, no dirty sheets, comfy beds, big shower, beautiful view of the Golden Gate Bridge, very nice pool area, great working a/c in the room, and QUIET at night! the free breakfast was basically all breads (muffins, bagels, literally sliced bread, croissants, waffle mix to make your own waffle, cinnamon buns without the sauce) a bucket of apples and not ripe bananas, small cereal bar with regular milk, orange and apple juice, and coffee. not a great selection but it's free so whatever. Honestly, the hotel was perfect. don't understand why it doesn't have a higher rating. ALSO, FREE WIFI!!!!
Great hotel in a perfect area, hotel staff were super nice.

review.title: Much better than expected
review.reviewText: The experience at this hotel was beyond my expectations. The hotel staff was extremely professional and friendly. If I had to book a hotel again I will book the hotel and also recommend it to my friends. It is clean and has excellent breakfast. It is very comfortable And has a great pool. It is close to the Fisherman's Wharf walkable distance about 10 minutes. It also provides coffee and tea with in the room.

review.title: Fabulous location
review.reviewText: Fabulous location, great staff, quiet lovely view of courtyard & pool, great breakfast, best coffee I had

The elevator made me extremely nervous as a scraping sound would happen every time.

Other than that, it was a good hotel. The breakfast could use an upgrade in food selection though
Was put on 5th floor.  Elevator broken to 5th floor.  Had to carry luggage up one flight.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix broken elevator.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Very clean. Awesome knowledgeable staff. Perfect location! However elevator was out and layout was very confusing. Would definitely stay here again

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText:
I got an amazing deal on Expedia through their app (I believe I saved a bit more than 10%) Due to it being in San Francisco, the rates were a bit high, though that comes with being in the city.  Also Bay-to-Breakers was coming up, which could have been the raised cost for the room(s). 

The rooms were convenient, a bit small, though convenient. I was most impressed with the bathroom, very nice shower. However I did not like how when the bathroom door opened it was unable to be opened all the way as one of the two double beds was close to the door and prohibited it from being opened all the way.  No in room refrigerator.  Had an amazing view of the bay including the Golden Gate Bridge.  There was not very many things to do within walking distance, though just a short Uber or cab ride (a necessity in SF) was an easy route.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was very friendly and the showers were new and nice
review.negativeRemarks: The outside doors leading to the rooms looked a little worn.
review.locationRemarks: It was a bachelor party so.....I'm forbidden to tell of events that occurred.  Hahaha

review.title: Great choice especially if you need to park a car.
review.reviewText: Nice breakfast , helpful staff, good choice at reasonable rates

review.title: Not nice , everybody was rude
review.reviewText: I will never ever go there again . No recommend to another people , they did not even help us to carry our stuff

review.title: Everting fair not bad not good.
review.reviewText: Parking no explanation to charge that not fair for customer and no receipt at checkout time.
The room was clean and comfortable, it is close to everything and only a small Uber ride to most activities

review.title: Pretty Good Stay
review.reviewText: Super comfy beds. Bathroom too small (tiny angle shower). No space to leave your toiletries bag in it. Basic furniture kept clean. housecoats supplied. However, window and blind have not been cleaned/dusted for a couple of years would be my guess. I had a view of the Golden gate if you could see through the filthy window, after fighting to open the dust covered blinds. Location was pretty good, for walking to everything. I was told 'Polk' (the street behind) had al kinds of places to eat. That was false info. Very noisy location if you want to have your window open. Was not warm enough while I was there to use the pool. Had they had a hot tub, I would have made great use of that!
review.positiveRemarks: Most comfortable bed I have slept on in a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room.
review.locationRemarks: I chose this hotel as it was in the middle of all the attractions I wanted to see. Super close to Ghiradelli square, cable cars, bus and Lombard.

review.title: Clean hotel but room was outdated
review.reviewText: The elevator to the top floor where we stayed was broken. We stayed for three nights and it was never repaired. The door to our room was not in good working order. We had to force it to close every time. We forgot to do that once and a drunk patron barged in by mistake just by pushing the door in and asked for directions to the exit! My children got frightened and I had to tell this lady to leave immediately. The room was warm and even by leaving the air conditioning unit on all day while we were gone it still couldn't cool the room to a comfortable temperature.

review.title: Good location, average ammenities
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location and is clean and meets all expectations of comfort. I didn't like the extra fee for a second person in a room with a king size bed or the hidden parking fee of 36.00. Also, the elevator wasn't working when we were there and we were on the fourth floor and our cards stopped working and we were locked out of our room at one point. Overall, nice hotel, great location but over priced for the overall experience.

review.title: Too many local tourist areas but the hotel facilit
review.reviewText: The hotel would be nice if the rooms were redone. They really smelled musty and old. The beds were comfortable though. The rooms were small and cramped feeling. I would not go back. On the plus side the staff was nice, the location was great for almost anything you wanted to say, and it has parking which you don't have to pay for.
review.negativeRemarks: Redo rooms

review.title: Decent location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very confusing. Had to take two different elevators to get to our room. The second day we were there the elevator broke. Stayed for 4 days and the sheets were never changed. The only good thing was the location and the great staff. Stacie is awesome!

review.title: Failing wi-fi and rude staff.
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel, which does not merit a 3.5 star rating at all.  It is more like a 2-star hotel/motel.  They claim to have wi-fi, but the entire time of our stay it would drop in and out about every 15-20 seconds (on the 4th floor).  Even when it DID work, we got speeds so slow it took about 3-5 minutes to load a web page.  When we complained about it to the front desk, they simply denied that there were any problems with the wi-fi.  Even after complaining at the end of our trip, they didn't check once, but denied any problems existed.  We even offered to show them what was happening...

Then they scheduled a shuttle to take us to the airport, which started taking us to the WRONG airport.  When we informed the driver of this, he dropped us off in the middle of San Francisco at 6am with all our luggage.  We then had to look around for a taxi and pay even more to get to the airport.  We could have missed our flight, or ended up at the wrong airport, but luckily neither of those things happened.  But, I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.  The service is shoddy, and the staff is just awful.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was relatively clean.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to improve on almost everything.  The staff is rude and their wi-fi is terrible on the higher floors.  They are inconsiderate and don't care
review.locationRemarks: There are a variety of things to do nearby, if you don't mind a long walk.

review.title: broken promises
review.reviewText: place had very distinct odor in the hallways that was not natural,rooms were very small,they tried to move me from 1 room to another same size room for $37 more and the room they switched us to was not ready. Only after protesting did they reduce rates.Breakfast was good..
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: stop cutting corners to save $$$,cheaper parking rates
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Not totally set up for a handicapped person
review.reviewText: the hotel was nice and clean and the staff was excellent. But as a handicapped person it wasnt accessible in all areas of the hotel. It wasnt posted how to get into the dining area for breakfast. The staff were unaware of how to get a wheel chair into that area.

review.title: Very Basic Hotel
review.reviewText: Did not like outside entrances to some rooms. Common areas iare very outdated. Rooms were basic and elevators were in poor condition. They took forever. Do not plan to use this hotel again. If this is a 3 star I will be sticking with 4.

Only one elevator, so save time and take the stairs! Otherwise good location, some rooms (4th floor) with Golden Gate Bridge views. Layout is a quadrangle with a heated pool right in the centre. 20 minute downhill walk to Fishermans Wharf and 39 minute stroll into the Marina district. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Felt like a beach resort right in town
review.reviewText: First off, you can't get a cheap hotel in SF, so don't think about doing better somewhere else.  We got an awesome rate around 150 a night and had two queen beds with plenty of space, a big tv, safe, nice bathroom, very cool view of the courtyard, excellent soap and shampoo etc.  And now for the good stuff:  In the courtyard there is a heated pool open until 9 pm all the time, there is a totally decked out gym with a steam sauna that's brand new and rocks, the breakfast buffet has like six pastries, yogurts, hardboiled eggs, muffins, toast your own toast, great coffee, juices, and a WAFFLE MACHINE!!!  Yes. As if this were not enough, there is a lobby area with internet and computers and leather couches and tv to just hang out, and omg the BEST dimsum restaurant EVER downstairs called "dim sum club," and we're extremely difficult to please in that department.  So, why didn't I give five stars, a hundred percent maximum rating to this great little hotel?  The one tiny downside (for me) was that our room was very mildewy smelling and I am asthmatic.  I had to use my inhaler two nights in a row, just to sleep.  And I got a row of horrible, bright pink bites on my wrist and finger the first night, which I have come to learn are bedbug bites.  I want so much to say that everything was perfect.  And I think it would be, if they would replace carpets.  And I will venture to say that probably not all rooms are like ours - most guests looked very happy and unbitten.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, good shower & soaps, plenty of space, cool courtyard, great pool and sauna, great gym, fantastic breakfast, dimsum downstairs
review.negativeRemarks:
Our room was so musty I needed an inhaler.  The window could be opened but only on one side, so no draft.
Parking was 33 dollars a night/day.
review.locationRemarks: It's a block off Polk street in Russian Hill. There are restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops and more.  Plus Northbeach, Marina, the Wharf and more

review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located. Have good amenities. The swimming pool is warm and enjoyable.
The breakfast is well assorted and delicious with very friendly staff.
I am giving 3 stars mainly because of the front desk as they made us wait for the check-in. Our room wasn't available when we arrived at 3:30PM. We had to wait with our exhausted kids. It wasn't fun.
The checkout was not of a good experience neither. I had to wait for a long time to get my luggage from the locker without even getting any assistance.
I would have given a better review if it wasn't for the front desk incompetence.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Overall good place to stay. Close location to Wharf.  Nice gym. Buffet was ok. Would be nice if they served scrambled eggs and some type of meat. Pool was clean.  Walls are thin.  Guest next door had TV blaring all night and into morning.

review.title: Nice Hotel with friendly sraff
review.reviewText: Arrived early Saturday morning and was greeted by Israel at the Check-in counter. He was very friendly and helpful. He was able to have one of the 2 rooms we had reserved ready for us to use until the 2nd room became available at check-in time. The rooms were very clean and hotel is in a good location.
review.positiveRemarks: The complimentary breakfast was great and helped us start the day energized.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Lombard st. We mostly took advantage of bublic trasportation to get around with the hotel being on and near major cross streets.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived @ noon & check in time was 4:00.  The helpful desk clerk got us into our room without any hassle.  The room was clean, well stocked with toiletries, the crisp white towels were a great touch.  The pool was open and looked inviting, although we didn't have time to enjoy, it was available! The front desk was helpful in pointing out our point of interests on the map & helped arrange transpotation to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price, cleaniness,  The hotel offered a complementary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to a lot of places.    Two separate friends had picked us up from the hotel and commented on the great location .

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the pier.
review.reviewText: Walked to the pier and restaurants.  Room was spacious for family of five.  Breakfast was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and room.
review.negativeRemarks: Welcome folder with information on hotel and area, transport etc.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to pier and restaurants, shops.  Bus stop nearby.

review.title: Mixed feelings
review.reviewText:
I go both ways on this place. Overall, I felt it met our needs as we were a family of 4 and our suite had a lot of space. The pool was warm and the kids enjoyed that. The continental breakfast was pretty good. Our view was mostly ugly rooftop but did have the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance. It was really quiet. Our 2 year old was likely the loudest noise anyone had to deal with. So that's the good stuff. 
The amenities are beyond basic. Bathroom had shampoo, conditioner, and body wash available. They were low quality and stripped my hair and skin. A few towels were available, no wash cloths. Coffee maker made disgusting coffee. The second bed in our room was actually a foam modular couch that was oversized so you couldn't put a sheet on it very easily - and it was pretty stained so you needed one. It was hard too so very uncomfortable. Kids slept on it but I wouldn't put a discerning adult on it. Parking is available for $33 per night and it's not easily accessible from the rooms. The elevator makes levels 3-5 available but you have to walk outside to get to levels 1 and 2. Probably weird quirky San Francisco stuff, but annoying nonetheless. 

Overall nothing completely offensive and I'm being a tad nitpicky, but I'd choose another place next time. For the price, there are better options.

review.title: Nice Location, comfortable beds
review.reviewText:
Nice location, short bus ride to Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, etc.   Beds very comfortable but room a little noisy if facing Van Ness St.  Temperature control was not optimal but fine.  Pool was kept very warm which was nice.  Breakfast has a lot to choose from.

We liked the water with fruit in the lobby every day.

We ate at House of Prime Rib just down the block, it was amazing.  Also at at a hamburger place a couple blocks away that was really good, called "Roam".
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfortable beds, nice breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Could add sausage or scrambled eggs to breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard Street, Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz. House of Prime Rib, hamburger place "Roam" was good.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Easy walking distance to water, shopping and restaurants. Nice beds and shower. Very friendly and accommodating staff.

review.title: Not what you would expect from even a 3-star hotel
review.reviewText:
Quite pricy, loud if you are on the "wrong side" and therefore close to the street.
The bedsheets are a joke and you will end-up sleeping without a cover which is extremely unhygenic.
The light in the small bathroom was a real hassle, you have to constantly move in order for it to stay on. No way you can sit in the light:-)
There is only one single elevator. It moves very slow and is always busy because all guests use it that are on second, third or fourth floor. It also (must) be used by the staff which means you always wait for several minutes until it arrives and slowly takes you donw/up.
We were on a honeymoon and therefore asked for a double bed upon arrival, due to some trade fair this was not possible, nor was an upgrade possible.I strongly doubt business people would insist on the "kingsize bed" if travelling with business associates.
Smokers are forced to sign a $300 fine agreement if they are "caught" smoking not only in the rooms (understandable) but also on the premises.
Later I read so many negative comment on the breakfast that we never even tried the free breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Within walking distance to two good breakfast diners
review.negativeRemarks: Room, Lighting in bathroom, Elevator waiting, bedsheets, no king/queen bed in double rooms,
review.locationRemarks: nothing really nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel, everything in semi-walking distance
review.reviewText: Really friendly staff, nice clean rooms, nice breakfast, easy parking... Defiantly would stay there again.. :)

review.title: Noisy with thin walls.
review.reviewText: Noisy with very thin walls.  You can hear everything. No water pressure.
review.positiveRemarks: Not really anything
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators take forever.
review.locationRemarks: Its not close to much

review.title: 15 minutes from Alcatraz wharf by taxi
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, good breakfast, pools lovely, kids loved it. Room was spacious, no microwave, small fridge.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Building is old and dilapidated looking; especially the elevator and stairwells, breakfast is cheap and disappointing-no eggs or bacon here just refrigerator fare. Clearly corners are cut in breakfast. The staff was excellent and very pleasant, the bed super comfortable, but the room dreary. It was an OK stay. For very little money more I can choose other options which I will do next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed, staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, carpeting in room.
review.locationRemarks: Fine, great food nearby.

review.title: Good value and location for the money
review.reviewText: Very clean, extremely friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are small, but mine had an outdoor terrace/balcony with a sliver of a view of the GG Bridge so that was nice. A bit of a hipsterish neighborhood, but had some decent restaurants nearby. I'd stay there again.
If looking for a business hotel experience it is NOT. Musty smell

review.title: Extremely nice staff, helped me a lot thanks
review.reviewText: Front desk receptionist was extremrly friendly and got me checked in quickly. Was my anniversary and set the room up with heart towel and wine bottle. Very nice area close to fisherman's wharf overall great hotel
Great staff, and great location. Noisy, but can't be helped. Overall good hotel for the price.

review.title: Hotel meet average expectations with some upsets
review.reviewText:
Pros
- nice size room 
- clean room

Cons
- shower had slow drain which caused back up of water. Disgusting. 
- even with "do not disturb" sign, housekeeping knocked twice.  First time at 8:30 am and again at 10:30 am. Checkout is noon. I guess they wanted us out. 
- breakfast scones were stale
- loud people in the patio kept us up at night. 
- when I called front desk at 11:00 pm to complain about loud people at the patio area, staff seemed irritated. 
- no discount or compensation offered for inconveniences

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent at assisting us with plans and informing us of all transportation options.

review.title: if you like noise
review.reviewText: not clean loud rude staff I cleaned myself to keep any something clean
review.positiveRemarks: not much at all
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: walkable

review.title: Need microwave in rm. w/children w/special needs
review.reviewText: Was great experience.  Close enough to walk to Lombard street and Fishermen's wharf if you bring good walking shoes.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking was included.
review.negativeRemarks: smell of room was musky.
review.locationRemarks: Good bus access.

review.title: Noisy and unrestful
review.reviewText: It's in a decent location, but the rooms are such that you can hear everything from the other rooms and it's hard to have a decent rest. If you do stay here, bring your own earplugs.

review.title: Good value and great staff!
review.reviewText:
The staff was terrific and very helpful!  Stacey in particular was a great resource for scheduling a cab to SFO
after our stay.  The continental breakfast had an excellent variety of things to eat.  The room was comfortable
and the cleaning staff did a great job each day.
review.positiveRemarks: The location as far as proximity to things to see (Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, etc.), and the staff were very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't be improved, but dVVis right on Van Ness, which is a busy street.  Lots of traffic noise at night, especially with a street-facing room.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to Fisherman's Wharf and short walks to other attractions like North Shore.

review.title: Business in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I cannot say enough about the quality of this hotel. From arrival, the staff was 5 star. The room was spacious and clean, the breakfast was huge bonus and the parking was safe and close to our room. This hotel definately enhanced our staff. Kudos!

review.title: Central, good location.
review.reviewText: Central and easy to walk everywhere if you don't mind the hills

review.title: This hotel was not as advertised
review.reviewText: The lobby odor was offensive. Hotel staff gave confusing directions just to find the elevators. All rooms faced an open entrance. I have a fear of heights & had a panic attack before I reached my room. The Expedia pictures looked nothing like the room.  Carpets smelled moldy. Hotel is extremely run down. Breakfast area was just filthy. Could not check out fast enough.
review.positiveRemarks: I have no words.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't know where to begin.
review.locationRemarks: We walked 2 blocks at night to closest caf & did not feel safe.

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, Desk clerk demanded to see both ID at check in, which was difficult do to the NO parking in front of the Hotel.
Also, the Hotel lists that they are located down in fisherman's wharf which is NOT TRUE. They are actually located about 2 miles away. Our room was adjacent to a heavily traffic street, the room has single pane windows which DO NOT block out the sound of traffic. My wife and I were awaken to the local trash trucks operating at 6am.
If I could give negative star rating I would rate this Hotel at a negative 5.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing
review.negativeRemarks: stop lying to the public and list the place for $59.00 a night like it should be.

review.title: Great hotel, close to tpt, a bit noisy at night
review.reviewText: da Vinci Villa was a great hotel. Easy access via 'Muni' (bus) to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square etc.  We walked to Lombard St in 10 minutes. Street behind (parallel) had fabulous restaurants and cafes. Small convenience store straight across the road. Laundry facilities on site were helpful. Only fault to mention was the traffic noise through the hotel windows at night. I guess that was a trade-off with the great view of the Golden Gate Bridge from our window and easy access to public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Only fault to mention was the traffic noise through the hotel windows at night. It was so loud it felt like we'd left the windows open.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access via 'Muni' (bus) to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square etc.  We walked to Lombard St in 10 minutes. Street behind (parallel) had fabulous res

review.reviewText:
Staff was great.  

The furniture was lacking, the chair leg was not stable, there was nowhere to put your suitcase. 

Overall it was a nice place to stay with a family. Truly appreciate the ability to have more than 4 people in a room!  Hotel is on the busline so you have easy access to everything.

review.title: inexpensive room close to public transportation.
review.reviewText:
Decent 4 night stay in a well priced hotel that included breakfast. a convenient Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel. We had a great time in lovely San Francisco.  
The highlight was the Vantigo tours that we recommend to everyone - a very personalized tour  with only 6 people in the van all ages - thanks to Eric the driver, his kindness, efficiency and love for his city. Very cool... 
Also Polk st, located behind the hotel had a lot to offer from dining to shopping or just walking around - Steep streets were challenging -
review.positiveRemarks: The cleaning & breakfast staff were all very friendly and responsive. and the price...
review.negativeRemarks: Slight noise issue -  Adjoining room door is not a good sound barrier. these type of rooms should be given to parties who request them.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to Polk st. with restaurants & shops, close to bus stops, safe neighborhood .

review.title: Lovely hotel close to many tourist opportunities.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, seemed to enjoy their jobs and were helpful answering questions and making sure everything was OK.  The breakfast was fabulous, many choices available both healthy and un.  Wait staff in the dining room was wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: Most everything.
review.negativeRemarks: There was an annoying machine in the room that we were unable to figure out.   Maintenance had to be called and it was explained to us that it was an
review.locationRemarks: The Pier was close as was the California science center which was fabulous!

review.title: Really Nice Hotel near Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Their complimentary breakfast was really good. And the staff are really hospitable. The location is also good close to Fishermans Wharf. I was happy with our stay.

review.title: Close to bus lines, easy to transport
review.reviewText: Had difficulty with the pay per view but the staff went out of their way to help, and followed the day after to make sure everything was correct
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very nice and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Building is old
review.locationRemarks: Did not go around

review.reviewText: Great Location and staff thought rooms were a bit dingy and more of a motel than hotel

Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was quite musty and in a very noisy position.  We could hear and feel the washing machine on at silly o'clock every day !  We were unable to access our room 3 days in a row as lock was broken and each time an engineer "mended" it to the point where one day even the cleaners couldn't get in !?  The breakfast was ok - the staff were extremely busy keeping all the supplies topped up. The only problem was that there were not enough tables each morning.  I read on other reviews that breakfast used to be served in the attached Chinese restaurant so maybe the room we used was temporary?  Only reason I wouldn't recommend this hotel is that it was on the limit of where you could stay and still be able to walk if you have kids or walking diffuculties.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast room
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance just about for Fishermans Wharf.  Long uphill walk to top of Lombard Street and Cable car museum.

review.title: First time in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, great location and value for money. Highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Great location. Run down and not very clean
review.reviewText: The hotel is a trip back to '80s or 70's . No central AC and cleanliness was questionable at best.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good. Wifi was solid!
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to fisherman's wharf and trolly

review.reviewText: Beautiful pool and great room for the price, we lived it

review.title: Not far from Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Chose this hotel after looking at the reviews others had left. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly, room was clean, swimming pool was small but a decent size. Breakfast was included which was nice, would have been nicer if they varied the range of choice. Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39 were only about 30 minutes walk away. Lots of places to eat nearby.

review.title: Great location but room was outdated and gross.
review.reviewText: Definitely not a clean place. The bathroom's shower floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a few stays and the windows were old and didn't block out any noise. The beds were comfortable but the overall cleanliness of the room was dismal.

review.title: A dirty Motel advertised at a ridiculous rate.
review.reviewText: Where do I begin? I have stayed at many different hotels for budget purposes but never have I had such a poor experience. Not only do they nickel and dime you, they do not honor the rate advertised on expedia. DONT even bother asking for a manager they apparently are never there and to this day have never returned my request to speak to them. The Room carpets smell and we had to buy fabreeze just to sleep, the smell was so terrible. They apparently are running low on towels since they told us there were none available yet they charged me extra fee's for having an extra guest. The free "breakfast" is a even dirtier adjacent restaurant where the staff smokes cigarettes on a bench right outside the door. They are less than helpful, for example I asked if they had any more creamer and she pointed to a table set up in a corner where i just came from walked over shook it in the air and put it down and walked away laughing. The sad thing is when I walked over to fill my cup it was still empty. After some phone calls to expedia I was able to check out the next day (forced to stay the night) and check into the HYATT which was HALF THE PRICE. DO NOT BOOK HERE EVER.
review.positiveRemarks: NOTHING.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING. GO THERE EXPEDIA
review.locationRemarks: There are surrounding brand hotels that are cheaper and in way better shape.

review.title: Da Vinci Experience
review.reviewText:
Excellant experience. Didn;t know area or anything about hotel. Easy to get public transportation and figure out connections. Hotel has a very nice pool area that wasn't mentioned. Hotel staff very knowledgeable / friendly.
Would say only bad thing was the elevator was slow and there was only one. Rate stay 4.5 out of 5

review.title: Clean Hotel walking distance to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Nice location, on a busy SF street.  Be prepared for car noise.  Rooms where clean and beds comfortable (pillows too soft for our liking).  Sauna was nice once it was turned on.  Included breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean, included breakfast and had a sauna.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows, more protein at breakfast double pain windows for noise.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: area was easy to find.
review.reviewText: nohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhohhhhhnoooooooI do not want to add anything to this section.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds comfortable..very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: free parking and hotel shuttle would be nice.  Breakfast was ok.  I thought should have been better for the cost.
review.locationRemarks: Was fairly close to fishermans warf and lots to do there.

review.reviewText: Hotel was not 3 star by a long shot. Door lock was broken shower was dirty

review.title: Hotel fro HELL
review.reviewText:
Initially the first receptionist was rude, the room was said to be a "quadruple room" but was too small for a family of five. We were charged >$500 per night (au) and unfortunately we had paid for three nights (approx. $1560 - Non Refundable) .
The room was on a busy street corner on the 2nd floor (1st floor really),we had to ask for fridge, we had to pay $30 per night for unsecured parking and we had to keep on asking for more bath towels... Everyday  not at all happy.

review.title: More motel than hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location on Van Ness near the Marina / Cow Hollow neighborhood (1 mi) and Polk St. bars.  Looks more like a motel than a hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Ambience

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: Great experience for us! We got to San Francisco and walked into our original hotel and room - it was old, rundown, and filthy. Frazzled and rushed we looked for other hotels in the area. Da Vinci did NOT disappoint! They got us a room right away and let us check in early since it was available. Great location, friendly staff, big breakfast buffet, very clean and comfortable rooms. My husband and I both loved the smell of the toiletries, shower and towels were very clean. Wonderful bed and pillows, we slept like babies :)  Coffee and tea available in the lobby 24/7 which was a nice treat. Also, we brought leftovers back one day only to realize we had no refrigerator, we called the front desk and they delivered one to our room right away. We can wait to make it back to SF and stay again!!
Front desk staff was amazing, Angel was a superstar.  The housekeeping staff was also great and very accommodating to my schedule.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: Close to Waterfront and other attractions.  Walk one block over to Polk street for an amazing walkable neighborhood.

review.reviewText: Breakfast was in a Dim Sum restaurant downstairs!!!

review.title: Friendly Staff At Tattered Facility
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel is friendly and helpful. The negatives are the somewhat rundown condition of the facility. The layout is confusing--getting from the room to the lobby is often a maze-like sequence of stairs, slow elevators, and passageways marked by unclear signs and walls in need of painting. The continental breakfast was utilitarian, as they are often wont  to be. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The big pluses are location and price.

review.title: * Great stay *
review.reviewText: We were warmly welcomed by Israel and Mogie whom were extremely professional and kind and did everything they could to help us enjoy our stay to this fabulous city. They upgraded our room and the hotel even sent us a bottle of champagne and fruit to help friends and I celebrate our big 5-0!  Their beds were very comfy and warm, everything clean and orderly. Breakfast was perfect and the two young girls running it were amazing and did their job well. Hotel was very conveniently located for what we had planned. I def recommend Da vinci hotel to all. Namaste!  Lm story

review.title: It's a motel not a boutique hotel
review.reviewText:
Great, friendly and extremely helpful staff.
Location is great as well. 
Rooms are outdated and mine had a very deep smell of old French fries mixed with an old carpet floor. 
The continental breakfast is just awful and the cafeteria where it's served it's just a mess thanks in part to the type of guests this property attracts.

review.title: Ok hotel, was expecting more
review.reviewText: Great location. Convenient to coffee and food. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Managers and housekeeping staff greeted me in the hallways. However, I was underwhelmed by the room itself based on the price and the 4-star Trip Advisor rating. The shower was dirty and things I expected to be clean were dingy. Despite having multiple signs indicating towels left on the floor would be laundered, housekeeping kept removing my hung towels and not replacing them. By the end of my stay I was out of towels and washcloths. Walls were paper thin. Both Friday and Saturday night there was a dance party in both rooms beside me - I Shazammed the songs they were playing at 3-4am. Fortunately, by Sunday night, they had left and I was able to sleep a little better. The bed and pillows were comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to cleanliness of the room. It had been cleaned, but was done poorly.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Quick walk up or down hill to good coffee, delis, and restaurants.

review.title: Better than I expected
review.reviewText: Clean, updated, has white linens, our room had no outside noise as it was not facing the main street. No more than 10 minutes from most tourist attractions. Located in nice neighborhood, 2 streets away from Lombard St. Pictures don't do it justice, much nicer in person. Has a gym and very nice swimming pool area. Staff and breakfast were ok. Beware of parking fee of $30/night. Expedia rep told me the original price quoted to me had parking included, after reading my confirmation email I noticed parking was not included. I called Expedia right away and they were able to refund me the parking fee. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: If only the room would cool down I'd recommend it
review.reviewText: The first room they took us to had a portable room air conditioner standing basically In doorway.  Second room was nice, big, but hot.  This air conditioner was in the wall, but couldn't cool off the room.  I will say, it was unusually hot for Frisco.  The bath was a good size, but a pedestal sink (where do I put my toothbrush and comb).  The shower curtain wasn't quite long enough for stand up shower.  But, I will say "ON THE POSITIVE SIDE" room 403 had a beautiful view of a San Francisco hill.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The janitor who helped with our bags was awesome.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from our room, the staff and they did have a free continental breakfast.  The waffle was delish.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were dingy, but clean.  The air conditioner needs to be in wall and big enough to cool room.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great for fishermans wharf, Lombard St and Coit Tower.  A lot of cute restaurants in area.

review.title: On a mission to San Francisco to watch the Giants!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and our friends were on our way to see the Giants everything that went wrong on this trip did. Everything, but our hotel! Easy check in, Polite and super nice front desk, and our room was beautiful! just like the pictures!

review.title: Nice hotel, conveniently located
review.reviewText:
First, this is not a hotel it is a Travel Lodge.  Though easy to find, centrally located, and rooms were clean, being on the fifth floor, this top floor was hard to navigate for use of amenities including Continental Breakfast...which was nothing to write home to mom about.
Had a pleasant time but it is not a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Way-finding.

review.title: Central to just about everything.
review.reviewText: Hot and tired when we arrived but the staff made the check in hassle free and painless. Was in our room, resting up very quickly ready to take on SF. Very central location with Fisherman's Wharf just down the road.

Great location and was our best price we could find for area. Had view of Golden Gate Bridge which was very nice every day. Single elevator which we usually took stairs instead of waiting. Breakfast was included and what was expected for a continental breakfast.  Very nice pool although we never used it. We would stay again.

review.title: k's road trip
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, 10 mins to Fisherman's Wharf. pool very good for the kids. Easy to find, park behind - expensive though $30 dollars a day. 
Poor breakfast, Chinese ladies that run it not very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants nearby, easy to get to Golden gate Bridge by car. Fisherman Wharf - seals on pier 39, cable car to travel on, shops.

review.reviewText: The nicest cheap room in sf. Cheap being a relative term

review.title: Not comfort.
review.reviewText: The air-condition is noisy. Also, one of the light is not working. Therefore, it is dark.
review.positiveRemarks: None
review.negativeRemarks: It is not comfort and the rate is high.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Walking distance(15-30 min) to many sites as well as to buses..  Staff is nice and helpful. Breakfast is adequate, gets you going for the day.  They are right above a dim sum restaurant(which doubles as the breakfast area) so you do get some of the smells by the elevator/stairs not by the rooms.  Overall a good place.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText: Good breakfast, safe parking and close to Ghirardelli, Lombard and Fisherman's wharf. No microwave and fridge but overall it was okey.

review.title: disappointed after doing so much research
review.reviewText: The hotel neglects to mention the fact that they charge $30/night for parking up front.  I'm sure it was in some fine print somewhere, but it isn't the price that they quote.  We were on the fifth floor which was difficult to find as if going through a maze.
review.positiveRemarks: lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Portable air conditioner is SO loud
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf if you are in good shape for hiking hills!

review.reviewText: Out of respect and courtesy to the management I would rather say nothing and hope I get a second chance to experience the comfort of the Di Vinci Villa

review.title: Very expensive but poor quality
review.reviewText: The room was very expensive and not very comfortable. The room smelt, the bathroom too small, no bathtub and little space in the sink. Too much light and sound bad isolated. No refrigerator in the room....Very bad breakfast: for example, the orange juice, supposedly a "Minute Maid" is was water with orange color.
Good location, friendly staff, clean room. Had a good time.

review.title: An upscale motel
review.reviewText:
Pros: nice breakfast, towels, robes, and bed sheets. Close to restaurants and to Lombard street.
Cones: one of the front desk employees was rude, whenever I was trying to say something he was interrupting and acting like he was a big shot. Also, there are two different elevators, and it was pretty confusing which one to take when going to my room or parking.
It wz ok kind of... But not as shown on the picture

review.title: Excellent Location, Reasonable Price
review.reviewText:
The location of this Hotel is very close to all the major tourist attractions. The Staff was friendly, and the rooms were clean.

However the lobby to get to your room is very very dated and makes the Hotel seem more like a Motel.

Given that the price was reasonable, we accepted this downside.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Reasonable Price, Friendly Staff
review.negativeRemarks:
The lobby to access the rooms... Strong kitchen smell...

Improve the selection of food for the complimentary breakfest

review.title: Not recommended.
review.reviewText:
Noise from the street and in between the floors is terrible.  Shower wasn't clean .
The only good thing was , coffee in the lobby.
I'm not coming back .

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location. The staff was great and very friendly. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Good value for the price.

review.title: Good Find!
review.reviewText: Great location; close to the Russian Hill stores and Fisherman's Wharf.  The hotel staff were friendly and great at helping us navigate the transit system!  The pool was clean, heated and had plenty of seating.  There were plenty of in room amenities (shampoo, coffees, etc.) and it was a large space for our family of four.  We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room accommodations, pool and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The air conditioning is an inside unit and was very loud.  We slept with the small window open! Breakfast buffet was limited; should add eggs & bacon!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, Russian Hill shopping and restaurants.  Bus Stop and Cable Car access nearby.

review.reviewText: Complimentary breakfast was not what we've had at other hotels. Needs bacon or sausage, cereal and yogurt is just not enough. It gets very busy and we had a wait only to find there weren't many options for breakfast.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very well situated for us. It was a longer but do-able walk to the Fisherman's wharf area, but it was also close to the bus lines which we wound up using every day. We stayed here for 5 nights.

The staff were great and friendly! As a matter of fact, a shout out to almost ALL the San Franciscans that we encountered - they were ALL helpful and friendly. Not at all like SoCal folks!

The hotel itself is older and therefore has its limitations. For instance, since it was originally built in the days of no air conditioning, the owners have installed portable AC units in every room. These are rather noisy when running as a fan, but get noisier yet when they kick into cooling mode. The rooms do not have any light blocking curtains installed, but rely rather on blinds which do not quite do the job. Between the AC units and the light coming in from their hall lights which are on all night, it was a chore to get a full nights sleep.

Free breakfast is included, but it is definitely lacking in variety. The only protein served is cold, hard-boiled eggs! And the only thing warm, other than toast, is their waffles which you make yourself. Plan on waiting in line 10-15 minutes before you get a chance to make your waffle on busy mornings. 

But all that said, the combination of price and location make this a decent hotel to stay in. If I were to return I would check on hotels even closer to Fisherman's Wharf though because of easier access to the bus system.

review.title: It's nice but expensive for the hotel condition
review.reviewText:
I was not so happy when i arrived. The hotel is old, and the room small.
I have to say that it is clean, but when I booked for it, in my mind it was a different level.

review.title: Nice location in Russian hill.
review.reviewText: We have stayed here at least 5 times. We like the location. Our room seemed to be the last one cleaned each day, just about the time we wanted to rest. The pillows are difficult to sleep on.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location. Quiet and can easily find restaurants nearby.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Great location. Awesome breakfast!! Really good buffet at the restaurant next door. Room wasn't cleaned one day, though, after front desk assured it would be. And another day, they forgot to bring clean towels. Overall, though, a positive experience. It was a busy weekend, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Recommended.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText:
The hotel needs a facelift. Elevator is unbearably slow. Everyone trudging up and down stairs!
Breakfast is a mob of people. Food terrible.  Room was nice, clean but noisy from street traffic. Good location.

review.title: Great location, Great Price, Very Clean
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for 3 nights in the beginning of August. Room was very clean, and the location is excellent, very close to Lombard st and Chestnut. 

Set out like a quadrangle, facing inwards gives you great views of the pool.

The only small issue we had was with adding a cot to the room. Most of the staff were lovely, however a more senior member of the team was very rude, and while i was getting some water from the reception, was overheard very loudly complaining and abusing our party to a colleague. Overall a great experience at this hotel, if let down a little by an unprofessional employee.

Would happily stay here again, the compl. breakfast was a nice touch and was the perfect base for our SF holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Breakfast, clean rooms, free wifi and pool
review.locationRemarks: Try Chestnut street for the tacos and shopping

review.title: You Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText: Trying to find a reasonably priced hotel (although still not inexpensive) with two double beds in SF was difficult  This hotel location was ideal - close to Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street.  The property is dated although they tried to update it. Our room was a corner but cramped, so relatively quiet, but it overlooked the parking deck (no view) , had no air conditioner (very stuffy) and accessible only from an exterior door (very motel-like).  The property is a maze and strangely configured. Complimentary breakfast in the Dim Sum restaurant next door was disappointing and the same everyday - primarily a bunch of bread (white, wheat, plain bagel), hard boiled eggs, mushy canned pineapple.  The healthiest things were yogurt and bananas.  You could stand in line to make a Belgian waffle to have something hot.  Go early or the coffee and juice will be watered down. Luckily we weren't in the room much - didn't really want to be.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - close to Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Powell and Hyde Streetcar, Lombard Street. We did a lot of walking. Staff was pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning in the room and the continental breakfast could have healthier options - more fresh fruit.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Lombard Street, Maritime Museum, Aquatic Park, Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf and Powell and Hyde Street Car.

review.reviewText: Very nice room except room a little warm but once you open window it's cools down

review.title: Nice but too noisy
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable except for the noise from the street and the attached rooms.

review.title: Sparce and small rooms
review.reviewText: Tiny room with limited space to put your belongings. Not even a shelf in the bathroom. The pool was not family friendly - limited shallow area with no spa. Breakfast area too cramped with limited seating. Even though there were renovations the appearance was just shabby. Nice staff.

review.title: Central
review.reviewText: Walking distance to marina, union st. Fishemans wharf China town. Quiet

review.title: Great central location, walk to many sights.
review.reviewText: From other reviews I read, I expected this hotel to be less updated than is was.  Unfortunately for my seven year old, the pool was being repainted for most of our stay.  However, the location more than made up for the lack of swimming.  Polk street, just parallel to Van Ness, is lined with shops and restaurants and Pier 39 and cable cars were an easy 10 minute walk away.  Public transport, especially buses were easy to find and use from this spot.  We traveled the city end-to-end with our City Pass.  I did not find it particularly noisy facing Van Ness Ave. even on the weekend, and I am a fairly light sleeper.  There were ear plugs available if needed though.  Overall, I would recommend this hotel.  It was very family friendly, the breakfast buffet was great and the location was ideal.

review.title: Reasonable hotel for San Francisco
review.reviewText: We arrived around 10:00am and were able to check our luggage while we went out to sight see.  Once we returned, check in was quick.  The front desk staff was friendly.  They keep a bowl apples and bananas in the lobby and a Keurig coffee maker..  There are also tablets available for use in the lobby.  We had a fairly large room on the fourth floor with two queen beds. No refrigerator or microwave.  There was a Keurig in the room and free WiFi.  The bathroom was adequate.  No vanity which was somewhat annoying.  Everything was very clean.  There seemed to be a face cloth shortage because we had to request them most days.  Our room did not have blackout curtains.  That did not stop us from getting a good night's sleep because the beds were very comfortable.  The room had air conditioning but we did not need because it was cool outside.  While we were there, the pool was being resurfaced, so did not get a chance to use which was a bummer.  Complementary breakfast was good but after awhile you might want some meat (boiled eggs only).  Public transportation, restaurants, corner grocery stores are conveniently located. There is a Chinese restaurant on site.  The hotel is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.  Overall had a nice stay
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to public transportation and restaurants.  Close to some tourist attractions.  Clean.  Comfortable beds.  Able to leave our luggage.
review.negativeRemarks: There was  facecloth shortage and we had to request most days.  Would have been nice to have a refrigerator and microwave.
review.locationRemarks: There were restaurants within walking distance.  Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard street were within walking distance.

review.title: Nice, quirky (in a good way) European-style hotel
review.reviewText: The best, most helpful and patient front desk staff I've encountered! As a tourist, I really needed directions/recommendations for getting around the city, and they were amazing! The complimentary continental breakfast was large and satisfying - a great value for families. I heard a lot of foreign languages spoken during breakfast, mostly European. Even though the guest room doors were outside, they faced the interior pool/courtyard, so only guests with keys could get onto the floors. People off the street could not, so it felt safe.
review.positiveRemarks: The modern, Italian decor was approachable and stylish. Bathroom had Grohe and Toto fixtures, nice bath products and the spa robes were a nice touch!
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have mini fridges in the rooms for restaurant leftovers. Our room smelled perfumy, like carpet or air freshener had been used.
review.locationRemarks: Moderate walk to west end of fisherman's wharf. Short walk to trendy restaurants. Beautiful, safe area, but must take cabs or buses to most places.

review.title: Dated decor. Nice staff.
review.reviewText: Great location. Dated decor. Nice staff. Great location. Dated decor. Nice staff.

review.title: Great Location Walking distance to most attraction
review.reviewText: Great location close to the waterfront,restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Terrible room
review.reviewText: Noisy, garage view, no air conditioner. You can hear people trespassing the room and they can hear bedroom inside too.

review.title: Inexpensive hotel for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Adequate hotel, excellent and knowledgeable staff. Breakfast is free at the next-door cafe and has a wide variety of selections. Parking is less expensive for a vehicle than other hotels. Only 5th floor has a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We had a king bed which was comfortable. I wouldn't want to stay here if there was heavy rain as the corridors are mostly outdoor. But we stayed here for location, parking availability, and price. So we would probably stay here again, for the same reasons. Front desk was very helpful; they told us about daily passes for public transit which included the cable cars. We enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff especially the front desk was courteous, friendly, and very knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: Outer appearance
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Fishermans' Wharf, Lombard Street, Palace of Fine Arts, Golden Gate Bridge and Park, Fort Mason, Union Square, museums

review.title: Good hotel but not great
review.reviewText:
Pros: good location, free breakfast (bread, waffle, coffee, & tea), good staff 
Cons: found a used hairbrush with hair beside the portable air con, pool was closed without prior notice, expensive ($30) parking and there were no adequate space for all hotel guests, portable air conditioning

review.title: Parking sold out?
review.reviewText: Parking sold out?  Staff recommended parking at Pier 39?  Really?  Oh boy...staff also offered closer parking, but unfortunately was also sold out.  Hmmm, you are left to figure it out on your own.  Good luck!
review.positiveRemarks: What I liked about the hotel was the location.  Hotel was just a few blocks from Ghiradelli square.  We also liked the size of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel could improve by adding microwaves and mini fridges to rooms.  Better lighting and mirrors.

review.title: Cozy hotel with strategic location
review.reviewText:
Overall, this hotel is a neat little place for you travelers who want a comfortable yet inexpensive stay in the City. A good bang for your buck. We stayed here on our honeymoon, and while it's not a 5-star hotel, this really is a cozy stay so you can spend your money and time in the city. 

Pros:
Location!: A walkable distance to fisherman's wharf (about 5 blocks), this hotel also rests on Van Ness avenue--accessible to both buses and taxis to get to the rest of the city. It's location is ideal because you get the san francisco experience without being high profile. Though on a busy road, the hotel is safe and pretty quiet (wall are medium thickness--can hear some noise from other rooms). If you like walks, it's very close to some neat cafes and restaurants with amazing atmosphere. 

Other comforts: Great beds and maid service. Refrigerators on request (don't forget that like we did). Flatscreen TV and a Keurig coffee machine (surcharged of course). 

Cons: 
     The building is old, which makes the outside look weary, and the elevator is slow. However, the inside is much nicer, and we found the old look made our stay safer because the building doesn't attract attention. Just like the rest of the city, parking is expensive. We bused into the city and took buses our entire stay with little difficulty. The Continental breakfast is actually inside a chinese restaurant, making it a bit crowded in the mornings. It lacks a good view, which wasn't important to us, but may be for you
review.positiveRemarks: Price (really good for the quality), Location (convenient and safe), Room quality, Staff/maid service, Free internet, breakfast, fridge. We loved it!
review.negativeRemarks: Someday, the building could use a renovation, and the lounge downstairs would be a nicer place for the breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Wharf/Pier 39, Short Bus ride to civic center/union square, Golden Gate park, and more. Good eats: Loving cup ice cream, Basik cafe, Helmand Palace.

review.title: Below average
review.reviewText:
Needs improvement 
Parking issue
Not clean 
Noisy room from walls and roof

review.title: Not my 1st choice
review.reviewText: Well let's start off with they don't have enough parking for all their guest so me and some guest had to park blocks away and were told it's a choice if we would like to cancel our reservations as if on the 4th of July we could find another hotel !! The hotel is outdated and not very nice. There isn't any counter space and only a couple of towels plus an overwhelming air fresher scent made is mediocre. The continental breakfest consisted of hard boiled eggs, bagels, bread -and banana. Overall , for the price, it's a no go!!

review.title: Not Worth The Price
review.reviewText: Arrived at hotel 15 minutes before check in time. Room wasn't ready yet of course but was ready at 4:00. Was told there was no parking and all parking was full. Was also told parking was very limited at the hotel and it was first come first serve (which the internet did not even say and if check in isn't until 4:00......hello). Numerous people not happy that night as we had to drive the surrounding neighborhood to find a parking spot (7 blocks away). Finally got to room, looked out window, and what do we see......the hotels neon sign literally right next to our window (and they only have wooden blinds). It was like sleeping with car lights shining through your window all night. We don't even get this in Vegas. Very disappointed as we paid a little under $350 (parking would have been another $30) for this. To add to it we also had someone knock on our door at 1:30 in the morning (wrong room). The room was clean and very small. Just enough room to walk around beds and barely enough room to sit on the toilet. If you choose to stay here, definitely bring a white noise machine as the streets are busy all night. Their free breakfast offers nothing hot except for oatmeal packets, oh and you can make your own waffle if you want to wait in that line. Mostly just breads (literally sliced sourdough), one pastry, boiled egg, bagel, etc. If I am paying $350 for a room, the breakfast should at least be better. Overall not worth what you get for the high price you pay.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean
review.negativeRemarks: Hot breakfast for the price you pay for the hotel. Parking (there was none). Room darkening blinds for the neon sign shining through your window.
review.locationRemarks: Really isn't anything in the vicinity of the hotel. About a half mile walk to the pier because don't want to lose your street parking space by driving

review.title: Nice hotel with cool staff and close to Lombard St
review.reviewText:
Our stay was great. We had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and could jog to Fisherman's Wharf within 10 minutes.

The drawback of staying on the side with the view is that Van Ness is a very loud and busy street. We woke up every morning to loud, annoying traffic noise.

Parking sucks. It's $30 per night and not guaranteed unless you get to the hotel before 5 or 6pm.

Breakfast in the dim sum place next to the hotel was ok. Waffles. OJ. Bread. Danishes. The staff were terrible. Not attentive at all and quite slow/lazy.

All in all, the location and value for the hotel was good. For my friend's birthday, they left a fruit basket and bottle of champagne in the room for us. That was very nice of them.

This one lady in the front is super helpful. She was very nice and quite knowledgable about where to go in San Fran.

review.title: Perfect at its price
review.reviewText: Da Vinci villa exceeded my expectations. For under $200 including parking in sf I had the bar set pretty low, but when we got there the lobby was pretty, staff that checked us in was super nice, and parking was just around the corner. The room itself was very clean and comfortable and cute. The location was perfect, about a 5-10 minute walk from ghiradelli square. We only stayed a night but would definitely go back again.

Great hotel at a great price! Very close to a lot of lovely restaurants and bars, and I didn't find the neighborhood to be too noisy at night when trying to sleep. The pool area is really nice and I was sad I didn't bring my suit! They also have a lot of parking available at a very reasonable rate for SF.

review.title: Convienent
review.reviewText: This is set up similar to a motel and the one elevator for four floors was exceptionally slow. With that said if you want a basic room in a safe and very convienent location then this place is for you. They also offer a free breakfast with rolls, bagels, toast and waffles and coffe, juice, hot chocolate which is a great help when traveling on a budget. I enjoyed my stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff and decent rooms with wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: The slow elevator needs work?
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby and you can walk to a lot.

review.title: Brilliant hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is really good and the staff are so friendly . Great location. Would definitely return .

review.title: Great Location for Shopping and Restaurants
review.reviewText: I was at a conference and I wanted a hotel that my wife and puppy could stay at and walk to shopping and restaurants. Da Vinci Villa fits the bill. Perfect! One small complaint is that the restaurant next to the hotel closes early and the breakfast was not great. It didn't matter because there were so many other choices in the immediate area.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is perfect for shopping and restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Union St. shops and restaurants are only a couple of blocks away. The wharf is a 10-15 minute walk.

review.title: Visit to san Francisco
review.reviewText: Really good hotel , staff sper nice , rooms very good , breakfast great , The 30 follajes parking fee , Too much ! The hotel in not cheap , so I think could be free or 10 dollars buy 30 ? Anyway , san Francisco is expensive and liked to stayed there,

review.title: Not bad for the price overall, but paper-thin wall
review.reviewText:
At this point, $180/night almost qualifies as a "discount hotel" in San Francisco; and as far as discount hotels go, Da Vinci Villa isn't a bad one.

I always deploy the "do not disturb" sign, and I didn't have any special requests, so I can't comment on the helpfulness of the staff -- but just based on my checkin and checkout, I'd say that the staff here are extremely friendly.

As the review title suggests, my biggest complaint here is the total lack of noise insulation. To be fair, I've yet to find a quiet hotel room in San Francisco, but this one is worse than average -- you can hear *everything* in the neighboring rooms and the room above.
review.positiveRemarks: Surroundings seemed nice, pretty quiet. I didn't spend much time in the area, but walking to and from my ubers, it made a good impression.

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Limited parking. Had to park at a garage not too far from hotel. Cheaper than parking at hotel. Fortunately we were leaving our car parked so it was fine. If you were using your car throughout the trip, this would be a hassle.

review.title: Great Hotel!!
review.reviewText: This hotel had an amazing staff.  We got there early and they were nice enough to get us in to our room.  The area is nice and close to so much in San Fran.  We completely enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.  The room was nice nothing amazing but we werent there for long but to just sleep.  Love it and would recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: location

review.title: Good value hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Hotel delivered what was expected for the price. Rooms were basic but comfortable. Was in a good location within walking distance of fishermans wharf. Offers secure onsite parking at a reasonable price with a reasonable breakfast included.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Decor is a little outdated
review.locationRemarks: Great location near to fishermans wharf and close to a range of restaurants. Could see the Golden Gate Bridge from the room

review.title: We had a pretty good view of the Golden Gate.
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable.  The fan in bathroom did not function well and bring your own blow dryer it was a real piece of crap. Staff was very friendly and helpful with my questions on getting around on the Muni system. They kept our room clean. Continental breakfast was great. ..could use a little more protein but overall lots of other choices. I would recommend eating at the Dim Sum for dinner. Dumplings were very good.

review.title: Clean and convenient
review.reviewText: The staff went above and beyond expectations.  The room was comfortable and reasonably priced with great proximity to Fisherman's Wharf.
overall is good except the smell of the room. it is very heavy and not pleasant.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Looks great nice view walking to everything, breakfast was excellent
Room could be more cleaner specially sofa

review.title: A little dark
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and helpful and location is near the pier however I found the room too dark and gloomy. It was clean but needs more light!
It was good clean and comfortable. Beds were made with the same sheets. When covers were pulled back tissues that had been used the day before were still there.

review.title: A good option for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Staff was great. The overall experience was good. Affordable for traveling to San Francisco with children

review.title: Great location for trip to SF!
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco, and it was amazing...the da Vinci Villa is a great choice for travelers looking to be close to everything.  First off, the hotel is exactly what we needed: clean, convenient and affordable (for San Francisco).  Parking was available in the hotel lot which was nice, and for $30/night you really can't beat that.  I know it's first come, first serve, but it seemed like there were quite a few spots available.  The location was ideal because we were able to walk to lots of places like Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Downtown, etc. and there are tons of places to eat and drink right by the hotel. If you're looking for a good place to stay on a smaller budget, this is a good choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Comfortable Beds, Parking
review.negativeRemarks: Better breakfast options
review.locationRemarks: Great location, was able to walk to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz Tours, Coit Tower and downtown.  Plenty of Bars/Restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great Location for walking around
review.reviewText:
Easy access to Fishermann's Wharf, shops and dining and Lombard St.  We also walked to Union Square and the Ball Park to catch a game and took the bus back without issue.  
The Staff was Very helpful and accommodating at the front desk.
Our room was clean, but a little small and overlooked the parking garage :(
Neat pool in the centre of the hotel, but it was way to chilly for swimming during our visit.
Breakfast was included in the attached restaurant, which was a pleasant surprise for us.

review.title: Family stay in San Fran
review.reviewText:
Great location,  lovely swimming pool that we enjoyed after a long day walking the streets. Nice rooms but couch was a little hard to sleep on for the kids.  
Nice having fresh fruit available at reception.
