We found the staff to be excellent and very eager to look after the needs of the guests. And, the breakfast provided was top notch for continental.  Room was very clean and well maintained.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf area, excellent staff, good breakfast, clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: Common areas could be upgraded a bit; elevator worked fine but it is very slow.
review.locationRemarks: Location is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, and, a short cab ride to China Town. Golden Gate Bridge , wine tour pick-up at the door.

review.title: Price was great for location
review.reviewText: We initially checked in and out room has some issues...lack out electrical outlets, TV didn't work. I called front desk and they said they were sold out. Walked down and they switched our rooms. Breakfast was awful. Elevator too slow.
Great location. Close to fisherman's warf   Was able to walk down there and back.

review.title: Excelent hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel, excelent location, great staff, wonderful view! The bathroom was too small!

review.title: Nice Villa Great location.
review.reviewText: I booked this Villa last minute at a great price in the heart of the city of SF.  just miles from everything you would want to see there.  China town, fishermans wharf, Lombard St., Union square, pier 39, street trolleys.  The gentlemen at the front desk was extremely helpful and polite.  He also set up a city tour and trip to Sonoma, CA for a wine tasting tour last minute.  I rate 5 star for brand new luxury hotel, 4 star for a older once a 5 but still overall a nice "luxury " hotel ,3 star is just a older run of the mill (nothing special ) just a little pop what you would expect clean hotel.  The rooms are very large and clean.  Only things I would have liked to have but did not would be another elevator, microwave, mini fridge, bath tub (did have nice stand up shower) bigger flat screen (room is rather large and the distance from beds to the tv makes it hard to see) hot tub ( does have nice pool and surrounding area) overall great comfortable place to stay in a great location and wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying there to  anyone.  If your expecting Trump Towers plaza and have big dollars to spend this is not it.  If you are a working middle class that needs a large, nice, clean ordinary hotel for decent price $180 per/nt which is what I thought after hours of searching every hotel site I know of a good price for the location and that it was a 3 star.  I've seen dumps for more. But the "luxury" 4&5 star Hotels run $3-$400+ per/nt anyhow if the price is right get it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The room was clean but the bathroom was very cramped with a very small stand up shower. Our room had a small view of the Golden Gate Bridge, but the walls are very thin and the road noise is very loud.

review.title: Right Choice
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this hotel. The clerk at the front desk Mogie was VERY nice & helpful & all the hotel staff were Very polite. We arrived well before check-in and Mogie was very helpful accommodating me and my family with a room. It's very close to the wharf and the complimentary breakfast was a nice spread. The beds were very comfortable, but...(the comforter was shedding lint all over the room). I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends. THANKS DA VINCI VILLA for a wonderful stay:)

review.title: Great hotel and very good service
review.reviewText: The Da Vinci is a great place to stay and we'd recommend this hotel. The staff were always friendly and only too happy to help with any questions/requests. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the location is good and the bonus was the breakfast which was a great way to start the day with a variety of food and juices available. It's near Lombard Street and an easy walk to Fishermans' Wharf and the ferry to Alcatraz (20 - 30 minutes but its a great way to see some of the sites and burn off breakfast). Plenty of places to eat in the nearby areas such as Cow Hollow, Fishermans Wharf etc.
review.positiveRemarks: It was great value for money, clean and comfortable with great staff.
review.locationRemarks: It has good access to all the main sites and there's transport close by if neede to get around but walking if you're up for it is the way to go.

review.title: An OK hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The rooms were acceptable, clean and neat but nothing exceptional.  The hotel staff were very nice and helpful - the best thing about the hotel.  The hotel layout was more like a maze - was always getting lost.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very good - not exceptional but close to it.
review.negativeRemarks: I would use this hotel again IF they offered free parking.  They have the spaces but charge way too much.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near many attractions.

review.title: Good value for money with nice location .
review.reviewText: Well situated hotel with friendly staff and clean pool area and other facilities

review.title: Interesting
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice.  The hotel itself is old but that is understandable in San Francisco.  The room was freezing cold so I called the front desk and the engineer came up and he informed me that the heaters run off of water so it would bring moisture into the room, so he brought me a portable heater, which was very thoughtful and definitely warmed up the room.  The light on the ceiling fan kept turning on and off on its own which was weirding me out.  The hotel room was very clean.  The hotel breakfast is all carbs, no eggs or anything for the healthy customer so I passed on that.  Overall the hotel is descent if your looking for a place to stay thats reasonable.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Our family of 5 were really pleased with the hotel. The family suite was huge and the complimentary continental breakfast had a good variety and filled us up each morning. Hotel staff very warm, friendly and helpful. Hotel was within walking distance to Lombard Street, Fisherman's Wharf and plenty of places to eat, making it easy to see the sights without the need of public transport. Definitely recommend

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
heated swimming pool a plus 
own self service laundry facilities
review.positiveRemarks: decent size rooms
review.locationRemarks: good chinese restaurant in building

review.title: Great location, Great Value
review.reviewText: The location was quiet.  The staff were helpful and friendly.  The room was a nice size and clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  The complementary breakfast exceeded my expectations.  It was a great stay overall.  I would stay there again.  Parking was $30 per night, but that is typical of any hotel in the city.  At least i didn't have to drive around looking for street parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean room, wonderful bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little dark, would like to have more light.
review.locationRemarks: Nice central location halfway between SFO Airport and Oakland.  Very walkable area, close to Golden Gate Bridge.

review.reviewText: This hotel had the feel and amenities of an average motel. First we were assigned a room on the ground level next to the pool. It was small, dark and very loud. The floor was vibrating from the pool pump and the pump noise didn't let us sleep at night. The next morning we complained and received a room on a higher floor. There was no more noise from the pump, but from partying college students in the adjacent rooms instead. We noticed that this hotel was very popular with larger groups of college students. If you are a regular traveler with some need of basic comfort and a good night sleep, then this is definitely not the right place for you! We felt very uncomfortable in this hotel. While the first room had a portable air conditioning unit, the second one had only fans. No matter what the temperature was outside, our inside temperature was always around 80F. It felt so hot and stuffy the entire time (we stayed 4 nights) that we had to leave the room door open frequently in order to let in some fresh and cool air (rooms go directly to the outside). For the same amount of money I have stayed in much better places in San Francisco. They charged us an extra fee of $20/night for the friend my daughter brought with her, while not providing any extra towels etc. and we paid $30/night for parking. So the $50 in addition to the room fee did not make this hotel a very good deal and I wish that I had never booked it in first place. Needless to say that we will not return.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, close to Polk street, Union street and the Marina.

review.title: OK and close to the Warf
review.reviewText: Old converted motel. Clean and close to Fisherman's Warf ( 10 minute walk). Breakfast included, super nice staff. Free wi-fi, computer room with printer. No central AC but portable unit. One of those where people walk by your picture windows and stare in your room.

review.title: Great place for a large family.
review.reviewText: It is hard to find hotels large enough to accommodate a family of six, but this hotel was perfect.  There was a large (but very hard) couch and three queen size beds, so no fighting over who would get stuck with the pull-out bed.  It was within walking distance to both Fisherman's Warf and China Town, however, it is not across the street so if walking up and down the hills in San Francisco are difficult for you, it might be a bit far.  It is a no-frills hotel, so don't expect room service or a bellhop but it was clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was large and the facility was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was okay.  It was not great, but I have had worse.  They did had things like toast, bagels, cereal, juice, yogurt and oatmeal packets.
review.locationRemarks: It is near Fisherman's Warf in San Francisco- more to do than I could begin to mention.  Note, however, it is a bit of a walk but not a bad one.

review.title: Clean. Good value.
review.reviewText: Clean room. Nice staff.  Slow elevators.  Good location.

review.title: Long weekend
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near Van Ness and Union which is a great central location without being in too touristy of an area. The staff is friendly and helpful. My only gripe is the weak continental breakfast and the one elevator that is very slow and has seen better days.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator is slow and continental breakfast is very plain with too few choices.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Our favorite thing about this hotel was it's location.  We walked to many great restaurants and pubs.  We walked down to the wharf.  The room was fine.  It was clean and pretty quiet.  It had a nice fitness room with a sauna (that we didn't have time to enjoy, but seemed nice).  All of the staff were very friendly.

review.title: Close to pier 39, walking distance.
review.reviewText: Only 1 elevator and it takes forever... Room was spacious and I had a great view room 410.

review.title: Smells room
review.reviewText: Room is smelly. And noisy, could not sleep. Room is close to street. It's very old motel

review.title: Decent Hotel Near Fishermans Wharf/ the pier
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to Lombard St. and 10-15min away from fishermans wharf/ the pier, which is what we wanted. Wasn't bad for a night, don't think I would stay here longer than that. The front desk staff were very courteous, and the housekeeping staff too, showing us where to go.
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfastl. The parking seemed safe enough behind lockable gates. Rooms are not a far walk away.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel could be updated a little.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty much downtown. Lombard St. is two streets over. Fishermans Wharf/ the pier is 10-15 min away using a cab or lyft. Restaurants all over.

review.title: A weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the cheapest found on Expedia and yet for the price it offered a lot. It was in a great location and only 15-20 minutes by foot to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, the ferry terminals and the cable car terminals to Union Square. Just walk down Van Ness and turn right. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and breakfast, although only continental, was more than sufficient with a good choice. It's not the Ritz but but for the budget conscious traveler it it more than sufficient.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the price and the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Even Buckingham Palace can be improved but for the price its just fine.
review.locationRemarks: Not buried in the middle of downtown San Francisco but just around the corner. Close enough for anybody with two feet and able to walk

review.reviewText: It was a decent facility in a good location. We will probably stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: room kept overheating with thermostat turned all the way down

review.title: Room with a million $$ View.
review.reviewText:
Rooms Arent fancy, not to be reveled in but the view we had was a million $$ view.  The woman who checked us in had more personality than anyone I have ever encountered.  Good thing!!  I thought maybe we were on a reality show.  She left us with every question answered and more.. Very nice touch lobby had water and fresh fruit.

Will be back......
review.locationRemarks: The location was great.  Centrally located between Russian hill and Marina.  Never used our car.  Ate and drank and ate and drank..  Wonderful !

review.title: Good hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff.  Breakfast is good.  Hotel is close to locations that we intended to visit.  Had to pay $30 for the overnight stay, but worth it since parking sucks in SF.  Room is tiny and needs a little bit of upgrading, but good overall.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for three days and had a nice time.We were two adults and two children. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great at this hotel. Parking was convenient and the location was good. The room was large (2 Queens) The beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was a bit weak, but it will feed the kids.
review.locationRemarks: About a 4 block walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Polk St has many things that might be of interest or convenience within walking distance.

review.title: Clean and convenient
review.reviewText: Great location clean and  comfortable at a great price. Staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was awsome.... It's in a good location... It is walk able to the wharf and ghiradelli but it's not like it's around the corner. But over all for the price in the big city I think it was fine

review.title: LOVED THE CITY SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: I fell in love with this city and the location of this hotel to everything was awesome from food, to the waterfront form the big city feel! perfect weekend.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: maybe a central kitchen area,
review.locationRemarks: so close to everything, the wharf, china town, but just behind the hotel there was a street that came alive at night it was great

review.title: Comfortable hotel and close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and comfortable beds.  Could see the Goden Gate Bridge from our window.  Fishermans Wharf was in walking distance.  The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful.  They also provide a buffet breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: The courteous staff and comfortable beds.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge is bus ride away, Fisherman's Wharf is in walking distance, and also plenty of eating places within walking distance.

review.title: Quality hotel within walking distance of sites
review.reviewText: Staff was attentive and helpful. Breakfast buffet was very good.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: Small boutique hotel.  I had a little trouble finding the front entrance but the hotel itself is very nice.  Good location and I was able to get a good price.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Customer service was great. A perfect location. A corner room has a view of Golden Gate Bridge. Fair price and nice clean room
Exactly what we needed

review.title: our favorite hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I travel to San Frnaciso quite a lot. It's our favorite city. We got engaged and married here. Every time we visit from Austin, which is once or twice a year, we always stay at Da Vinci. The hotel is clean, the staff is incredibly helpful, friendly and accommodating and the location can't be beat. We'll be back over and over again.

review.title: loud, noisy, no air, window loud, cold shower
review.reviewText: cold shower, loud, noisy, had to argue to get room clean, smelled and had to pay for parking
review.positiveRemarks: nothing
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: hard to find parking

review.title: Clean hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This is a very clean and comfortable hotel.  My only complaint was that the toilet was too close to the wall so it was a little difficult getting the toilet paper.  Everything else was excellent.  Staff was nice and courteous and the rooms were very quiet and comfortable.  Great views from the top of the hotel too!  Hotel is about 3 blocks from the curvy Lombard St. Parking was much lower at this hotel than most others in the same area.  I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms are just a tad bit too small.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of dining nearby as well as local transportation.  If you have a car, parking is much cheaper here that other hotels nearby.

review.title: Convenient and Affordable
review.reviewText: If you're looking for an affordable place to stay in the heart of San Francisco's Russian Hill, you can't beat this place. For the money I was actually very pleased with the experience. It's not the Four Seasons, but that isn't what we were looking for. Convenient location, decent rooms, a great view at the top floor, and plenty of parking. No complaints whatsoever.

review.title: Good if u r not looking for bg hotel amenities
review.reviewText: Clean but smallish rooms. Decent dim sum restaurant on premise. Easy access to most things. Decent neighborhood. Great staff

review.title: Average stay
review.reviewText: Its was an average room, with average service, and average meals nothing strikeing about of this hotel what so ever

review.title: Central location with fabulous staff.
review.reviewText: We asked for a quiet room and got it.  The room was very comfortable with everything we needed.  Coming from the west coast of Canada it was really nice to swim in the heated outdoor pool.  The breakfast was sufficient and when it became the dim sum restaurant for lunch we enjoyed our meal very much.  The wonton soup is to die for!  We feel we were very lucky to have chosen the da Vinci Villa for our first trip to San Fransisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were the best of anywhere we have stayed.  Also the bed was really comfortable and clean.
review.locationRemarks: The location on Van Ness was perfect.  We walked to the waterfront the first day.  After walking uphill back we checked out the public transportation.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: I just wish the parking had been included in the price up front. It's $30 per night

review.title: Perfect location,,walking to town, harbor,,
review.reviewText: Very friendly, and comfortable, clean Hotel, will go back again,,
review.positiveRemarks: Location,,perfect walking distance to all interesting places,,
review.negativeRemarks: Would prefer to be able to book a spot at the hotel garage, at the same time, when booking the room,,!!
review.locationRemarks: Great French Bakery close buy,, to go for breakfast,,,,,close to harbor, and walking distance to China town,,,,,

review.title: Great staff and great price for the family
review.reviewText: The staff was very polite and helpful.  The room was great for the price. It is difficult to find a room that accommodate 3 adults and 3 kids. This fit our family great! Close to Muni and War and lots more!

review.title: Great Stay.
review.reviewText: Great staffs and services. Security is good and room and bed comfortable and clean. Only issues is the wooden flooring which we have a upper floor tenant walking around 3am and we have to call the reception to quiet them down. Really in the safe neighbourhood and strategic convenient area to move around. Parking is expensive US30.
review.positiveRemarks: Unique in way. Have never stay in such set up hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Flooring need to addressed
review.locationRemarks: Location is good and strategic for tourists. 15 ins walks to most of the star attractions or to all transportion's.

review.title: DaVinci Reveiw
review.reviewText: Beds were VERY comfortable. Continental breakfast was large. But the front desk staff made our stay great. They were exceptional in every way and went beyond the service level we expected.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was as comfortable as the one we have at home
review.negativeRemarks: room needs a light to shine on closet

review.reviewText: Very nice place, the only down fall was our neighbors.  They made noise till midnight but other than that good place to stay!
Front end staff was amazing!  She let us know exactly where we needed to go to see the sights.  Hotel was in a prime location for sightseeing.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: elevator speed
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Great location, comfortable bed, nice bathroom
review.reviewText:
The first room I was assigned to on the pool level stank terribly.  I was then moved to the 4th floor, where it smelled better but there was still a hint of moldy stink.  I kept my balcony door open throughout my stay.
The location was fantastic, walking distance to the marina, the wharf, north beach, even downtown.  Keep in mind, the hills are almost vertical so bring good walking shoes.  You will basically be hiking around.
The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean.
The dim sum restaurant downstairs had very pleasant and clean tasting food.
The pool was small.
All in all, it was a nice stay.

review.title: da Vinci Villa rocks!
review.reviewText: Except for their policy of taking a $50 deposit for each day one stays, which we never experienced in any other SF hotel, and we have stayed in many...this was a centrally located and friendly place to stay. it was our first time. and btw, there is a terrific Chinese restaurant on the premises which is well worth trying.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendliness of lobby persons, location and great Chinese restaurant (gourmet)
review.negativeRemarks: no deposit necessary...we are trustful travelers
review.locationRemarks: Fort Mason Center (where we attended a conference)

review.title: In the thick of it.you can get anywhere from there
review.reviewText:
After arguing with the front desk we got the room we reserved.Thereafter it was terrific.
The free continental breakfast was excellent. Loved being on the main public transportation line.

review.title: Nice hotel close to pier 39
review.reviewText: Hotel was close walking distance to the warf and piers.  Bed was comfy, shower was a pain to maintain a steady temp and had very little pressure.  (Although california does have a water shortage).  I would probably stay there again if back in San Fran.

review.title: My trip to SF
review.reviewText: Very good!!  Room was very well maintained, clean, and comfortable.  Did not use the pool, but was nice that it was inside the courtyard away from the general public.  Staff was most helpful and very nice.  Resturant on site was good.  Breakfast in the morning was great and very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to things to see and do.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and downtown.  Public bus transportation was close by as well as tour busses stopping for pickup.

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText: We were there to participate in the US Half Marathon and the staff was very accomodating with providing us pastries for our early morning and a late checkout so we could return after the event.  We will defininely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: There were 5 adults in our group, so the family suite was perfect!  I didn't even know one could find a room with 3 beds!
review.negativeRemarks: The couch was rock hard, but since no one needed it for sleeping it worked for us.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Wharf area!

review.title: Rude staff have to request A/C???
review.reviewText: Wasted half the morning switching rooms for a room with air condition!! Would not recommend this hotel!

review.title: In a good location on a Main Street.
review.reviewText: My stay was pleasant and comfortable. Staff were pleasant and close to a few sights on decent walking distance.

review.title: San Francisco get away.
review.reviewText: Location of hotel was great -  close to Fisherman's Wharf, China town and transit.  We arrived in early morning and were allowed to check in.  Staff were very courteous and knowledgable of area. There was no air  conditioning in our room and quite a bit of traffic noise when window was open,  however we enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and helpful staff.  Free breakfast in lobby was a bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: Older hotel .  Room was updated but halls and elevators could use some updating. It was a bit confusing as various stairs came out at different places
review.locationRemarks: Spent lots of time at Fisherman's Wharf and walking the area. Also ate dinner in China town . Bike rentals and hop on hop off bus conveniently located

review.title: Nice walk to Fisherman's Wharf but the view is ok.
review.reviewText: The room seemed bare and not too welcoming. The size was very large and our view was "the best they had available" of the pool. The view was less than pleasing but the staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was just far enough away from the Wharf to be quiet but close enough to walk or take a convenient bus ride.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Golden Gate Bridge
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, close to the water. On a very steep hill but worth it. Yummy free breakfast!

review.title: Great hotel in Russian Hill
review.reviewText: I was blown away by the size of our room, definitely pleasantly surprised. The location was great and within walking distance to lots of restaurants, shops, etc in the Russian Hill and Marina districts. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Good View of Bridge on West Side
review.reviewText: Our stay was very nice. The hotel staff was friendly and our room was comfortable. Only issue I had was the entrance to the rooms was also an entrance for a Dim Sum restaurant and there wasn't a ramp for large luggage, you had to use a handicap elevator if you didnt want to carry your large suitcase up a couple stairs. .
review.positiveRemarks: View of Golden Gate Bridge in the morning was awesome
review.locationRemarks: The Dim Sum Restaurant downstairs is very good, albeit busy.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Rooms are a good size, and the best continental breakfast I've ever had.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, very accommodating. Good wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator needs to be upgraded.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located right in the middle of the best spots in San Francisco. Close to fisherman's wharf, golden gate bridge, lombard st., north beach, etc

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
Bon accueil
Parking prevu
L'htel dispose d'un restaurant et le petit djeuner est trs correct

review.title: Good location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: An older hotel that has made efforts at remodeling, especially the rooms.  The fitness center was very nice, the pool seemed well-maintained, and the staff was helpful.  The location in close to the wharf, Ghiradelli, and lots of restaurants nearby.  The continental breakfast, which appears to be provided by a restaurant next door unaffiliated with the hotel, left something to be desired.  The only protein provided was hard boiled eggs and peanut butter.  There were waffle makers but other than that, uncut fruit, breads (not local sourdoughs, either!) and cereal.  So, if that is an important selling point, be aware.  Otherwise there are coffee shops within walking distance and I would especially recommend Saint Franks Coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, great fitness center
review.negativeRemarks: Do not disturb hang tags instead of the cards for the keyslots, too easy to forget to re-insert after unlocking door.  Also elevator is SO slow.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, lots of nearby attractions, coffee, restaurants, Ghiridelli, Wharf, pubs, bus stops.

review.title: Excellent location, very good staff, rooms ok
review.reviewText: Horrible elevator and breakfast, excellent location and professional staff... ,good experience considering the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and very helpful and professional staff
review.negativeRemarks: Walls in hallways are dirty, very slow elevator, bad breakfast, crosaints not edible...
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the ocean and fisherman warf, excellent location, very good access to public transportation.

review.title: 15 minutes to the wharf area, close to many ameni.
review.reviewText: Would stay here again, comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast was very convenient.

review.title: Well priced motel style accommodation
review.reviewText: At first glance at night the hotel/motel looks a little unwelcoming with a small but modern reception. The style is very 60's motel but has been recently spruced up  the rooms are very big and beds comfortable   Bathrooms have new fitments. Large flat screen TV mounted on wall with film channels at an extra cost. Pool area looked good though not sure how much sun it gets as enclosed on all sides. Single lift is slow but gets the job done. Breakfast an added bonus and plenty of choice although no hot food other than waffle machine which was fantastic ! A 15 minute walk to fisherman's wharf or $7 taxi ride. San Francisco is a wonderful city and you will not be disappointed if you get this hotel at the right price

review.title: Really nice hotel
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful. Everything we needed they immediately delivered to our room. Hotel was spotless, location excellent in Fisherman Wharf area. 4 couples went and all would stay again in hotel. Pool and Sauna perfect
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, large rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: In the location close to fisherman's wharf. We did hop on hop off and walked also. We did and saw a lot and restaurants close by

review.title: Great location! Clean rooms!
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying at this hotel. It is a great location, only a short walk to the ocean. Staff is very helpful and accommodating. Comfy beds and clean rooms! The delicious breakfast in the morning is an awesome bonus!

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Stay here with my family. We had a great time. Close to everything. Friendly helpful staff. Highly recommended.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Nice staff, clean rooms, all that is needed for a good stay.

Pleasant but getting what you pay for basically. Double room was a little too warm and stuffy. Bathroom door wouldn't open all the way as entrance was right next to one of the beds. Otherwise, clean and the staff were very courteous. On-site in/out parking privilege worthwhile to tack on to booking.
Positive Experience. Staff was super and the location was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was helpful, nice, and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Price.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location.

review.title: Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my family on vacation for 8 nights. I thought the hotel and staff were superb. You can't beat the location and is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown but if you prefer a bus, the bus stop is a block away.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location. For the price, you can't beat it.

review.reviewText:
SF in August is expensive, but spending this much for so little was really disappointing. As soon as one enters the room one is greeted bu an unpleasant odor. The room was cold (65F), so I let the front desk know on my way to work. I came back to 90F!!! absolutely crazy.
If your room faces the street be prepared for noise all night long. The walls are paper thin so if your neighbors are v. active in the sack you will hear all about it.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff are nice and helpful. There's a pool, great if traveling with kids.
review.locationRemarks: The neighborhood is very nice, not so touristic but lively

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, clean and comfortable hotel! The Continental breakfast was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and easy on the pocket.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators are slow.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of bars and restaurants near by.

review.title: Good walking distance to the pier and wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed here during my first trip to SF. Nice hotel with clean rooms. Only a walk away from the Wharf and Pier 39 (if you don't mind walking on an incline). About a 2.5 mile walk from the bridge, not a bad walk if you walk along the water. Only cons with the hotel are the incredibly slow elevator (take the stairs if you aren't too tired) and the lack of curtains in the room. The blinds did a poor job of keeping the street lights out from my room.

review.title: secure environment in middle of city.....
review.reviewText: we got their late, and were told no place to park, didn,t remember being told $30.00 day charge for parking. Frustrated by unknown parking   charge..   parked  overnight in handicap area....  good choice of breakfast items, goes with room.  Later in day chinese food served in same dining area, best sweet and sour soup I,ve ever eaten anywhere. excellent service by young waitor......recommend more hooks for hanging items and towels in bathroom......Floor could be hazardous walking for anyone with more problems ambulating than I.  Overa   I,d  recommend villa for anyone who wants to be close to downtown sights.  we both loved convenience of body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. otel should market or tell how they can purchase product.
review.positiveRemarks: Felt safe in middle of large metropolitan city, easy acess to local sights. excellent chinese gourmet food on site,...met a lot of people from world .
review.negativeRemarks: more hooks in bathroom, maybe check out way to correct slipper bathroom for aged, be sure travelers know they have a $30.00 day parking bill.
review.locationRemarks: 2550 van ness drive.....Muir woods, beach, stinson beach, san fran bridge and park, wharf, chinatown........

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The Villa was a great! It might look old but the design and facility is styled modern. Comfy bed, heated pool, great location and awesome breakfast. Location is close to Lombard St. Most rooms don't have air-condition but, I guess you don't need it because it's cool and breezy. 

My complaint was since the location is great, having the windows open most of the time it gets quite noisy. Our key card works half the time and parking is not guaranteed if you're coming back late. The elevator is quite slow and wasn't working when we got there. Quite a pain hauling luggages and coolers. Other than that, we still love it there! Not a deal breaker!

We won't hesitate booking there again on our next visit to San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the customer service. It's one of their strongest traits aside from the well maintained facility. Really nice rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: Key card, elevator
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to a lot of amenities and sight seeing locations including Lombard St., Union Square, etc...Everything is within walking distance.

review.title: SF Trip
review.reviewText: Overall my stay was OK. Extremely noisy almost as the window was wide open all night. Not conducive for a good night sleep. Most likely the only way I would return to this property, is if I were guaranteed a room away from Van Ness, an extremely busy street.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Sound, noise control
review.locationRemarks: Business trip

review.title: Excellent hotel in a good location.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a good location, very convenient for down town San Francisco. Very good continental breakfast provided. Swimming pool. Good DIY laundry facilities. Car parking provided but at $30 per night extra. No air conditioning. Our room had no bath tub but had a double shower.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, great location
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for down town San Francisco

review.title: Terrible hotel
review.reviewText: First off the hotel seems more like a cheap motel. There was no air conditioner and the staff was pretty rude. They have free breakfast and all they have is coffee and bread. Pretty much this hotel was a big disappointment considering the price paid.

review.title: Not a far walk to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Didn't expect a room without air conditioning. Turns out there are only 7 rooms in the whole complex with A/C. Our room was on the street so there residual noise while trying to sleep and had a ceiling fan that didn't move the air around.  To their credit, they brought up a box fan the first night and were able to move us to a room w/ A/C on our second day.   San Francisco was having a heatwave.  Close to MUNI stops and walkable to Fisherman's Wharf.  Breakfast choices were good and staff very attentive.
Great stay. Room was clean and the location was great for the price if you're looking to do anything near the wharf.

review.title: Comfortable hotel, ideal location. breakfast great
review.reviewText:
Comfortable hotel, ideal location, walking distance to both Golden Gate bridge and Pier 39 for cablecar to Union Square. 
Breakfast was plentifull and well presented. Rooms were cleaned regular along with fresh towels and bedding.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location was good, rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpfull.
review.negativeRemarks: A fridge would have been usefull.
review.locationRemarks: Location good. Golden Gate bridge and Pier 39 walking distance, cablecar was near for Union square. Walk up hill you have local bars coffee houses etc

review.title: Don't recommend
review.reviewText: Although the hotel staff was helpful and pleasant to deal with, our room was not great. The bathroom was tiny with no counter space at all, there are no blinds so our room was very bright, no a/c, and very loud! You could hear everything being said outside our room. We only stayed one night and checked out early.

review.title: Hotel was ok
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was ok.  The staff was very good and helpful.  The facilities were crowded and small.  The parking was not good at all.  I had to park in a lot about 5 blocks from the hotel the first night.  Overall I probably would not book this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, room decor
review.locationRemarks: Location was ok, restaurants near by and tour bus stop close by.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The hotel is odd.  The small office/lobby is not connected to the part of the building with rooms.  You have to go back out on the street and use a key to get in.  My room was small (which I expected) but also dark (the only window is on the corridor) and hot -- no AC, and the small window opening, being on the hallway, is both noisy and needs to have the shade downs for privacy.  It is also impossible to turn the baseboard heater all the way off, which makes the room hotter.  The beds and linens were nice quality, but I wouldn't go back.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco and I was looking for a reasonably priced room close to fisherman's wharf.  I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel.  The staff was great!! Very accommodating and helpful.  Initially got the wrong sized room but they fixed it right away.  They were quick to get us cabs and helpful with nearby attractions. Nice rooms with great finishes.  Only thing that was lacking was the breakfast.  Thought they could have had some hit food instead of just the usual.   All in all I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to visit, great value!!!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in an excellent location. Staff were lovely. A lovely pool area and all clean and well kept. A more than adequate breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: staff and location
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Great hotel & location.
review.reviewText: Great hotel & location, even with some construction on the outside.

review.title: Friendly staff, clean with a good breakfast
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, the GGB & Union Street.
review.positiveRemarks: location, breakfast, friendly staff, clean

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: The room was clean, but the hotel condition in general was below average. Breakfast was included in the room fare, but it was just ok, not excellent. Also, we wanted to change hotels several days prior to our stay, but the hotel had a non-refundable policy, which meant we were stuck with it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the Warf and Pier 39
review.reviewText: The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The service was excellent. The construction across the street was a little sight unseen.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the view of the bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: Better elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Within minutes, the bus stops around the corner that will take you to China town and the Warf.

review.title: Bang for your Buck
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Da Vinci villa. It is relatively close to the Wharf, but remember - you are in San Francisco- lots of hills!!!  So the first day, the walk was tough.  We had a room that was on Van Ness, so traffic is non stop and loud.  Not the hotel's fault! Staff did assure us that they are renovating many rooms. My one complaint, which they said they are addressing is the bathroom. There is just one small sink with no vanity table or counter. There is only one small mirror in the bathroom, that's it! There is a desk, but no vanity lighting and no mirror.  We traveled with our 2 small children. Someone is always in the bathroom, so getting hair/make up set was a challenge. There is a nice pool area. Too bad SF is on the cooler side, we could not use it. Morning continental breakfast was nice, big selection. My young children liked making their own waffles.  Unless you plan on living in the hotel, the accommodations are great. I would not hesitate to stay at the Da Vinci when visiting SF again. There is also laundry facility available.
review.positiveRemarks: The layout of the room was nice. Everything is very clean and orderly.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom.  A counter or vanity table is needed.  I could forego the closet area and replace it with a vanity table, mirror and lighting
review.locationRemarks: One must walk to the Wharf, or take public transportation or have a car rental. While the Wharf is not that far, remember it's SF and there are hills!

review.reviewText: Nice staff. Clean. Squeaky floors. I could hear the person on the floor above me walking around until 12 am. Nice ceiling fans, but the lights attached came on by themselves twice in the night?? Breakfast was simply fruit, toast, bagels, hardboiled eggs, cold cereal.

review.title: Really nice hotel, close to the the beach
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay, really liked how it was close to the beach and didn't have to walk far  to see the fireworks. Definitely would stay there again.

review.title: Neat hotel 15 min. walk to Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: This is an updated, comfortable boutique-style hotel in a good location. With just five floors it feels a little more intimate than a giant hotel, but it also has amenities like a pool and sauna, plus clothes washing machines in the vending area. The bed was excellent, the bathroom was bright and clean. Service was prompt and friendly and the building was reasonably quiet. A light breakfast, including everything from boiled eggs to bagels, cereal, waffles and fruit, is included in the room rate.
review.positiveRemarks: It's in an excellent location, near major bus routes and easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The included breakfast is a major bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: The single main elevator is very slow. The rooms could use better lighting...they are dull at night.
review.locationRemarks: In Russian Hill area near Lombard St., Hyde-Powell cable car line, Union St. shops with quick bus links elsewhere on Van Ness and Union streets

review.reviewText: It was fine minus the slow elevator service. Would recommend to anyone

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall I would say the accommodations are perfect if you're just staying for a few days. But more important, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful to a foreigner trying to get around the town efficiently.  They were always pleasant and cooperative and eager to help! We really enjoyed our stay!!

review.title: Da Vinci Villas, San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff was very helpful and anxious to ensure our comfort and take care of our needs.  The closet and bathroom doors didn't fit or function smoothly, but the room appeared to be clean. The biggest problem was noise.  There is very little in the way of sound insulation in the walls, and raised levels of conversation in adjoining rooms was clearly audible.
The decor is dated, the lighting dim.  The blinds are aluminum Venetian type.  The bed was comfortable.     With a little upkeep and care this would be a very nice choice for a place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, friendly helpful staff, nice swimming pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room needed work on the bathroom door -- it couldn't be closed completely.  Ditto with the closet doors.  Decor and interior looks dated.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to the wharf, easy access to transportation to all parts of the city.

review.title: walk to fisherman's warf is 20  minutes
review.reviewText: Staff was great, nice job on remodel.  Had to take 2 elevators to 5th floor rooms, a little disappointing, but not a big deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff could not have been better
review.negativeRemarks: faster elevators
review.locationRemarks: somewhat long walk to Fisherman's Warf.  Very long walk to Ferry Building.

review.reviewText: Nice Hotel with breakfast included (not many hotels offer this at such a low rate). The extra $35 for parking was disappointing, but expected given the area.

review.title: Disapointing
review.reviewText: Too expensive for what you get, it is not located as close to Fisherman's Wharf as you might think. Nothing to do in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby, nothing else.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything could be improve, I mean, it is not the worst hotel in the world, but it is TOO expensive for what they can give to you.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is at least 20 minutes walking away from the hotel.

review.reviewText: Had to move to another room as no air conditioning in our room.  It is an old hotel and the AC was a free standing unit on the floor with a vent hose (looks like the kind on the back of a clothes dryer) running out to a vent cut in the wall.  Elevators are not accessible from all entries, some only go to certain floors.  Two of the elevators were out of working order.  Free breakfast was OK, but it is sit in only, you can not bring any food to the room from there.  Laundry was OK, some machines out of order, but there were more than enough to do multiple loads.  Parking was secure and liked the idea that at night gates are closed and locked and the only way into parking garages was by security guard. No bathtub, shower only but bath room was very clean. Nice pool area with modern pool furniture.

review.title: Walking distance to the Pier but not many frills
review.reviewText: 7 day stay checking in on Saturday. 4pm check in with no early check in available. $30 a night parking but I was informed at check in that they didn't have parking available until Monday. I had to park 4 1\2 blocks down at an over night lot. No spa but a heated pool. Hotel looks like it was remodeled in the last year, flat screen tv , in room AC that takes up way too much room, shower only and no counter space in the bathroom. Walls are paper thin combined with foreign travelers thinking 2am is 2pm and your up all night. Continental breakfast is minimal and staff chases you down for you ticket. Not a 5 star hotel, adequate but over priced for what you get. You may want to go with a National chain for the same price.

review.title: The hotel is closed to Fisherman Wharf.
review.reviewText: The staffs are nice and helpful and the room is clean with good working air-conditioner.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location of this hotel and the room services
review.locationRemarks: It is closed to Fisherman Wharf and is a very nice site seeing spot.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very spacious suite. Friendly staff. Great full breakfast. Water pressure was a bit low and no microwave in the room but other than that it was great!!!  I would definitely stay again

review.title: Great Location and Very Comfortable --Excellent
review.reviewText: We were winding up a 4 week trip in Europe before heading home to Hawaii and this was an excellent place to decompress and get our "legs" back after 15 hour flight. The hotel staff was very gracious, the breakfast buffet was pretty good (we got really spoiled in Europe with lots more variety of foods to choose from for breakfast) and the location, for us, was perfect. Glad we chose this place.

review.title: Great family hotel or even to just relax by the po
review.reviewText: Very nice and helpful staff. The bathroom was small, no problem except a free standing sink gives you no where to put your toiletries. A ledge shelf would solve the problem. House keeping was great. Breakfast was good. Bus line right outside, can get you any where. I would stay again.

review.title: Visiting San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Our granddaughter and great granddaughter were visiting us in Sacramento.  Neither of them had been to San Francisco, so we decided to take them.  We wanted a Hotel within walking distance to the WARF, cable cars and other points of interest.  The da Vince Villas was perfect!  There were other hotels much nearer the WARF but were much more expensive.  We stayed in a Suite which was very nice.  Very large room, comfortable beds and linens, large flat screen TV, couch & desk and a small room with sink, refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.  The coffee was excellent!

review.title: Worst hotel i ever been to
review.reviewText: For the price i paid, i think hotel should at least have nice water stream in the shower! The walls are too thin also! Too bad - never going to stay there again!

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful experience. Had a very good night's sleep and enjoyed the free breakfast of waffles, oj, cereal, yogurt, and fresh fruit.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean, beds very comfortable, and it was peaceful and quiet. Located close to the Wharf, the hotel was close and convenient to north S
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Ghiardelli square and Pier 39 are close by.

review.title: Great location for the price and friendly helpful
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great price. The staff was friendly and helpful. The noise from the street was constant. I found it hard to sleep even though the beds were excellent because of street noise. The bathroom curtain had a terrible smell every time we showered but they replaced it for us when we asked. Overall it was a good hotel and I wouldn't have paid $160-$200 more for one on the Wharf.

review.title: da Vinci Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Well located, clean hotel, rooms a bit outdated though.
Staff was great.  Location is fine, but a long walk from places to see for tourist.
review.negativeRemarks: Notification regarding limited parking available and the nearest public garage is 5 blocks away.

review.title: Convenient location. Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: If you are not looking for luxury and just a place to sleep, this hotel is perfect. Very bare bones. No art on the wall, small rooms. Very clean and they had on site parking which is handy in a big city.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText:
I guess you pay almost 200 dollars a night (expedia offer) for the location.
The website pictures are misleading this hotel basically looks and feels like a glorified motel 8. The walls are dirty, there is only one entrance to the hotel room, there was what looked like a air purifier in the room for air conditioning that never worked, we slept with the sliding glass window open, the elevator takes forever and the parking!!! Check in time is 4 o'clock - super late, I get there about 3 to find out that all their parking is taken. I think she said they only have like 35 spots. They told me to park one street down and 4 blocks over in a garage. "It is a nice walk back"... Im a team player so, fine. It is a managed garage however it opens at 8 am. Since I was leaving at 6 am this did not work. They accommodated me by allowing me to park in one of two spots in the front of the hotel (funnily I thought there were no more spots). When we came back from dinner that night a van had parked terribly over the line so my spot was unreachable to my suv. There again dealing with parking. They suddenly had another spot not one street down and four streets over but in their garage... Needless to say thank goodness my wife is an easy pleaser otherwise this would have been hell.
review.positiveRemarks: The location.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, built in air-conditioning, clean the walls, add refrigerators to the rooms, add a safe to the room.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is not far from pier, Gharadelli square, cable car access.

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: Great hotel amazing staff. We are returning later this summer and will certainly stay again

review.title: Overall
review.reviewText:
The front desk people were so wonderful!!! We arrived early and they allowed us to park and walk to the wharf. They helped us find things in the city and helped us figure out the best way to get there.

In order to get to our room we had to take two elevators, but one seemed broken as it never arrived and we had to take the stairs to the 5th floor.

review.title: Great location, family friendly.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our 2 nights here, all facilities were excellent! Room was slightly noisy from road noise. The only let down was the local area information the staff supplied us was incorrect, ie locations of trade mark restaurants and the tourist bus pickup. But aside from that I would stay there again!!

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Elevators didn't work the entire time. Being on the 3rd floor without working elevators was something else. Their system was down when we cheked in and declined my card, even though there was money on it, so I had to spend 2 hours waiting for their system to work before I could check in. Room looked nothing like the pictures, and place was very bland. Best thing about the stay was the free breakfast. Overall it was a horrible experience and not worth my money or hassle.

review.title: So-so Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was friendly and room was clean and comfortable, but there is not enough parking spaces and we were sent to they're overflow lot about 5 blocks away. Wish we were informed of this  possibility ahead of time. We also booked two "deluxe" rooms, but one was definitely a lot smaller and not as nice. The rooms lacked sufficient shades on the windows. The vertical blinds let too much outside light in at night. The layout of the hotel is also very confusing and a pain to navigate. Enjoyed the in room Keurig coffee maker and complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Spent five days at the hotel. It's an older building but has been updated. Furnishings are uptodate and the room we stayed in was comfortable, although the walls were pretty thin and we could hear traffic noise as well as people in the hallways and in the adjoining rooms.
The staff were great - friendly, efficient, and courteous. Internet was good. The pool was beautiful. Breakfast was included (Continental style - but very plush)

All in all it was a great hotel experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Great bed. Plush towels. Clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower was pretty anemic. (Calif. wants to conserve water and hotels do their part)
review.locationRemarks: Lot's of things to do in the area - Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Italy town among other things. Bring sturdy walking shoes and be prepared for hills.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff, perfect for vacati
review.reviewText: All of the staff were super friendly, even when we had to check out a bit late. The accommodations were nice and clean. There isn't a/c which is weird to Florida people, but it was only warm (mid sixties) one night. The location is a mild walk to the bay, and near bus stops. The breakfast is beyond adequate for a continental breakfast. There's a waffle station and the coffee and pastries were perfect for us. We had a great time, and we would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, amenities, staff
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little loud with the window open because Van Ness is a very busy street, but it sounds like you're in a big city
review.locationRemarks: Bus stops, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, tour busses

review.title: Don't have a car or plan on parking on site
review.reviewText: Hotel advertises self parking at $30 with in and out privileges. Only 30 spots for 150 rooms and nearest was 5 blocks away with no in and out. People were trying to book for the next night in advance with no luck.

review.title: Staff was very very accomodating
review.reviewText: Nice Stay and great breakfast and awesome staff. Not much more to say
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: hot tub and kinda confusing to get around the hotel and elveator
review.locationRemarks: close to shops and parking was nice

review.title: Good base, but nothing special.
review.reviewText: The Da Vinci Villas are in a good location, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Polk Street, which has some decent restaurants. The hotel was a little disappointing, felt like more like a hostel. The hotel really could do with a major refurbishment, the lift was very old and slow. The rooms had a really strange musty smell. The blinds in the room didn't open and the bathroom door didn't shut. The rooms were clean however. Breakfast was included, just a basic continental, which was ok. The staff in the hotel were really friendly and helpful. Overall Da Vinci Villas are a basic and clean place to stay, and if you're just looking for a base this would suit. I expected a little more considering the price, and if I was to return to San Francisco I would probably spend a bit more money on a hotel to get that better standard of accommodation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need updating Decor in corridors
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf Polk street Street car route

review.title: wonderful position
review.reviewText: Public transportation right outside the door.. 10 minutes from Fisherman's Wharf and from everything else. Get a MUNI pass from Walgreen's, and you can use trains, buses, and cable cars as much as you want. Wireless included, good breakfast, courteous staff, ideal hotel for a tourist. Maybe just don't get a room on the street side, because there is traffic noise as Van Ness is one of the main streets. But you can oversleep and they will do your room later! Also a nice swimming pool in a good position away from the strong wind. Good price/quality. Will book again.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise! At least in my room that was on the street side!
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful!!

review.title: Great hotel nicely situated to Pier 39, Lombard St
review.reviewText: This was our favorite hotel in our 10 day stay in California. We stayed here 2 nights. Room was very clean, bed & bedding super comfortable and front desk staff very friendly. Also the continental breakfast was superior to other hotels breakfasts. Plenty to pick from and plenty of seating. When I return to San Francisco in October I will stay here again. Easy walking distance to many attractions.
review.locationRemarks: Russian Hill/ North Beach area. Near Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard St, Ghiradelli Square, Italian area, Chinatown

review.title: Great Hotel and staff. They are very accomidating
review.reviewText: A very close hotel to the wharf. Nice heated pool and a wonderful breakfast. I will definatly stay here again when we come back. It was my 2 kids and wife and I. we were on the top floor and other than a slow elevator there is nothing I would change about this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location!!

review.title: Too expensive for what you get.
review.reviewText: It's comparable to a cheap motel, except they charged a lot. Two nights stay with parking was $755.00. It looked great on the photo because only their small lobby was updated.
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Major renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Okay location, 7 block to the pier.

review.title: Expected Better
review.reviewText: I was disappointed. My wife and three kids arrived at the hotel late due to a delayed flight. I was told there was no one to help with bags and parking is six blocks away (no valet). Got my family to the room and it was a very pungent smell. I went and parked the car (30 mins round trip). Not my expectation of a fair rated hotel (motel realistically). Not my choice and won't ever do it again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Close to many tourist attractions

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: All the staff were very friendly and super helpful. They gave us lots of information about San Francisco and made suggestions on what to see and do. Good continental breakfast and cute, updated modern rooms.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Overall great hotel. We were there for 2 nights, booked online the day before as we were travelling around. We got a reduced price and free breakfast which was ideal. Parking was an additional cost which was 30dollars per night which I thought was quite steep but was worth it in the end as onstreet parking is only 2hrs at a time.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool, location, cleanliness, modern, breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioning could be quieter and elevator is very slow. Parking is additional too.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - close to Chinatown and Fishermans Wharf (Alcatraz landing)

review.reviewText:
i have really bad experience here. extra charge for more than two guest
and breakfest is disappointing

review.title: Really ?
review.reviewText: We arrived early to the hotel. Check 4 pm ? Kinda of late in my book. Anyway, our room was not ready so we requested to go to the pool. We were told NO because we needed a key and we couldn't get a key yet because we hadn't checked-in. REALLY ? So when we did check in we were told we had to pay $30 for parking. REALLY ? I just spent over $200 for my room. The pool was blocked by the building, so no sun by the time we could swim. We checked out at 6:30 am. Free breakfast didn't start til 7 am. Most hotels start at 6 am. Not very accomodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are big and roomy and comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: To be more accomodating to your customers.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Near Fishermans wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Good location but poor facilities
review.reviewText: I didn't like the hotel because we had to use two elevators to reach our 5th floor room. We stayed there for 4 nights and the breakfast was the same everyday. We were told that we can order eggs before going for breakfast and we were lucky to get 2 eggs on the first day for my family of 3. All other days they were out of stock of eggs!!!

review.title: Reasonable middle of the range
review.reviewText:
Reasonable distance from downtown SFO. Close to bus routes and tour bus.
Eating places fairly close.
review.positiveRemarks: And older hotel, but clean and tidy
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: Need to be able to walk as rather hilly around this area.

review.title: Never stay at this hotel during a heat wave
review.reviewText: Unfortunately for the hotel, we happened to stay during a heat wave in San Francisco. The hotel has only a limited number of rooms with a/c and ours was not one of them. Fortunately, we did have a sliding door which we had to keep open all night. Others were not as lucky and had to keep their doors open which was hazardous as they were vulnerable to passers by.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff tried hard to accommodate us, but there was little they good do.
review.negativeRemarks: Spend some money and install a/c in all rooms
review.locationRemarks: It was advertised as being close to Fisherman's Wharf which is not exactly true. It was at least 12 + blocks away.

review.title: Good location nice breakfast & staff
review.reviewText: San Francisco has very cool weather, but this hotel had no inside air conditioning so had to open window a little (only allowed a small crack) and city noise very bad. Management nice and helpful. Good breakfast. Location good near Lombard street and not far from fisherman's wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, good management, beds very nice, good breakfast, good housekeeping.
review.negativeRemarks: Need air conditioning,
review.locationRemarks: Near Lombard street. Not too far from downtown , fisherman's wharf

review.title: good place to stay in san francisco
review.reviewText:
The staff are pleasant and helpful. The continental breakfast has plenty of choice.The swimming pool and lounging area got a lot of use, particularly on the very hot days! The location is quite convenient for Fishermans Wharf and the Piers; and the main retail centre of Union Square and Market Street.
The room was quite spacious, and the beds are very comfortable.
The only slight downside was that the elevator (lift) was really slow; and, as our room overlooked Van Ness Avenue, a main traffic thoroughfare, we got a lot of traffic noise. Overall, we would happily stay there again and would recommend to others.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. The swimming pool. The breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator (lift) could do with upgrading. The room lighting was quite poor, no lighting in the wardrobes.
review.locationRemarks: Within easy distance of all the "tourist" locations of The City. Frequent bus service from outside the hotel, to all major locations.

review.title: An option that has detractors
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Warf, reasonably priced and a friendly staff. The walls were thin, a gaggle of folks argued until late at night, the phone didn't work to complain to the front desk and the air conditioner died. I was given free parking for all my troubles.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to Fisherman's Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix issues detailed in narrative.

review.title: Return to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We required a hotel within walking distance of various tourist venues and also to feel safe in walking in the neighbourhood. The staff gave us good suggestions for restaurants and overall were very helpful. While there only one night we met three persons who worked on the front desk and all three were very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. We definitely would stay at this hotel again. The breakfast was also ample and varied.
review.positiveRemarks: yes, I believe that was obvious from my comments above. The only issue was we arrived on a very hot day and there was no air conditioning in our room
review.negativeRemarks: Airconditioning, and I understand they are working on this. Air Conditioning in each room, however, we understand this is being addressed.
review.locationRemarks: The location was close to Fisherman's wharf, the trolley cars and some very nice restaurants.

review.title: Hotel has a good location, pleasant rooms.
review.reviewText: Room was a little stuffy, but otherwise OK. Breakfasts were only OK. Almost no choice if someone can't eat gluten. We ate there 2 days, and went elsewhere for breakfast after that.
Stayed here with my daughter & husband for one night. Location was great and parking was a huge plus.

review.title: Well kept older property.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed taking a bunch of public transit while in sf. Polk and Van Ness and even 3 blocks up hill, Hyde st, offer easy bus access to the city sites. Use sfmta web site to view realtime data on all the routes ... the 19 for examplearound the corner is the smallest bar west of the mississippi. Cool, locals beer only joint. 6 bar stools ..thats it.
We greatly enjoyed the room decor, the mattresses, the bed linens, the shower, the room layout, the view of the Golden Gate Bridge!
review.positiveRemarks: We greatly enjoyed the room decor, the mattresses, the bed linens, the shower, the room layout, the view of the Golden Gate Bridge!
review.negativeRemarks: da Vinci should add some protein, preferably eggs, to the breakfast buffet.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard, Swenson's Ice Cream

review.title: Nice hotel. Would stay again.
review.reviewText:
Staff was awesome. Hotel
Was nice. Just needs a good breakfast. Not just tea and crumpits. All in all good close to the warf. Parking high price. Cheaper on the warf.

review.title: Cheap, but very dated & noisey.
review.reviewText:
We made the booking last minute so were happy to just find somewhere. Told we had been 'upgraded' to a room with a view of the golden gate bridge, however the bridge could only be seen by stepping outside the door into the cold and straining your neck to see it.
Also, our room seemed to back onto a long stay guest room or similar. The girl staying there was easily heard through the paper thin walls & door. It didn't help that she never left her room and was always taking super loud on the phone, late into the night.
We didn't bother with the comp breakfast as it wasn't worthwhile.
The location is fairly handy if keen to visit Alcatraz & wander down to the pier etc. however I would not stay here again.
Great staff. Great experience. Very nice location to fisherman's warf.
Overpriced...conveniently located, but still a cab ride from all the action in Marina District. Breakfast is terrible, stale bagels, moody staff. Would not return.

review.title: Good view from our doom if the Golden Gate Bridge.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff!! Loved our room!! Loved making our own waffles at breakfast. Close to the wharf. Would stay again!!

review.title: Nice and noisy
review.reviewText:
Do not take a room closed by the elevator
Elevator is very slow and there is only one
Continental breakfast does not offer warm food
review.positiveRemarks: Room was cleaned and comfy
review.locationRemarks: Very noisy

review.title: Comfortable room for a family of five
review.reviewText: Staff at reception was helpful with everyday travel tips around San Francisco, we able to book transfers to SFO in a limo at good rate and efficient in servicing us with towels in the room and pool.
review.positiveRemarks: large family room for five with views of the Golden Gate Bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: Continent Breakfast - improve variety of foods
review.locationRemarks: close to buses, walking distances to Union Street and Chestnut Street shops and restaurants, Fisherman's Wharf short stroll down the hill

review.title: Great staff, convenient location, would stay again
review.reviewText: We were able to check in early, check out late, and they let us keep our car parked there for a few extra hours while we went and had lunch at Fisherman's Wharf. Definitely will stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location. near to lombard street and great small shops nearby

review.title: Nice clean hotel close to transit line
review.reviewText: The staff were awesome at helping us find our way around the city and accommodating our requests! It is an older building but has been redone tastefully!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were really friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast was great!
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms were a little noisy is our only complaint.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is on one of the major bus lines and we had only steps to go to catch the transit anywhere! We were a five minute ride to Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Good Value, Nice Place, Nice Neighborhood
review.reviewText: This city is one of the most expensive that I travel to. Finding a good value with more than adequate facilities is not always easy. This hotel has a good location with buses directly in front and the cake car 3 blocks away. In this city, a car is not always an asset. Fisherman's Wharf is not far send the neighborhood has a wide variety of interesting restaurants. Breakfast included waffles, bagels, pastries; but no eggs, bacon or sausage. I spent 4 nights and enjoyed them all.

review.title: With-in walking distance to downtown
review.reviewText: We were here for 4 days! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a nice bonus as well as free wifi. Cleaning staff was very nice and checked with us to see if we needed anything.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, breakfast,wifi and location
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location, plenty to see and do, all within walking. Great exercise! We went to the farmers market, restaurants, the pier area.

review.title: Trip to SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok. The bed was comfortable. The floor plan was odd, It required two different elevator rides to get from the 5th floor to the bottom for breakfast. This is probably due to the steep hill.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed, free waffles for breakfast

review.title: Nice, but worth the price?
review.reviewText:
I had a very lovely, comfortable stay here when I had to come to San Francisco for a night recently. The room was modern with a large flat-screen TV with basic cable (but no high-def cable) and a very comfortable, clean appearance. The ceiling fan started acting up in the night, though. It decided to turn on on its own, and then the light started turning itself on and off. (I reported this to the receptionist and we agreed it could just be the batteries in the fan's remote going bad.)

I saw a few reviews saying to request a room with air conditioning because not all have it; this is true. It is a retrofitted building, so not all the rooms have a unit in them. BUT, I don't think it's ever been so warm in San Francisco that you would need it; I only used it for some white noise and air circulation when I went to sleep (since the ceiling fan was acting up). Traffic noise from outside is minimal with the window closed.

I would stay here again; my only problem is the price. I have to ask, is it worth it to pay this much per night? Perhaps I just suffered from sticker shock and a lot of hotels in the area, in fact, were even more expensive. It is probably more worth the price if you stay with more than 1 person per room!
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi and continental breakfast? Um, YES, thank you! Also relatively close to Ghirardelli Square and convenient bus routes.
review.negativeRemarks: Ceiling fans that are not possessed would be nice! (I think this is a rare problem, though. See above.)
review.locationRemarks: Near Ghirardelli Square and close-ish to Fisherman's Wharf (~15 minutes walking). Conveniently on Van Ness and near Lombard, so it is easy to find.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: It was a good spot for me to be near the Marina and get a decent night's sleep. Room is fine, exterior looks rundown and unrenovated. nice staff, comfortable bed. Pool area feels kind of retro, should be upgraded.

review.title: Proximity to transportation was great.
review.reviewText: The continental breakfast helped make it a better stay. It was OK.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very pleasant and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: They could improve the scent of the rooms. What we saw on the web site was so much nicer than what we experienced.
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf, North Beach, the Embarcadero and good restaurants were nice to have nearby.

review.title: Upper mid level with character
review.reviewText: Good value. Clean and nice staff. Pool courtyard is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: More room, more on the breakfast menu.
review.locationRemarks: Fair, not a real strongpoint for walking distance.

review.title: Excellent vacations.
review.reviewText: San Francisco was my frist trip ever, i have always dream of that place and it was just as good as i hope it was. The hotel was perfect, people were great, helped us with direction and everything. We got a water leak in our room the second day and 5 min later they transfer us to a suite with a view on the Golden Gate. Breakfast with lots of diffrent food, bed very confy. I have nothing bad to say about this place and i would go back anytime.

review.title: Ok for near the Marina.
review.reviewText: It's really a motel in style, wit all rooms facing an interior courtyard with a pool. I was there 3 days.

review.title: It's a motel
review.reviewText: It's a motel, the pictures are deceptive. The rooms themselves aren't bad.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and beds were comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel, but a little far from the Warf
