review.reviewText: Very nice experience. Hotel is very nice, rooms are clean, nice pool area. Very easy to get a taxi cab. distance to the Warf is a little long to walk, but getting a taxi is easy.
review.locationRemarks: nice location to walk a short distance to a few bars and restaurants. Nice pool and complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Looks CAN be deceiving
review.reviewText: WAY overpriced. The heat in the room did not function properly. It was 55 degrees when we arrived and took all night to get up to 62! The rooms were more shabby than chic and the neighborhood sketchy.

review.title: Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had an enjoyable stay at the Da Vinci hotel. When you book your room be sure to request a room with A.C. As all rooms do not have it. It is located in a nice neighborhood convenient to mass transit. I would not get a rent car while you are in town as parking is expensive and difficult. I would stay there again as they are priced competitively.
review.positiveRemarks: Price and location.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator is an antique.
review.locationRemarks: Trendy Cow Hollow is a short walk and pier 39 is a short bus ride as wells Chinatown and Golden gate park.

review.title: The hotel was okay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was sufficient but not worth the price. There are numerous other hotels close by for about the same price, or even cheaper, with better quality. The room was way smaller than I thought even though it was a deluxe and the staff was not as welcoming as I hoped for.

review.title: Tidy Hotel relatively close to Fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText:
All staff was super friendly and helpful. Ambiance was great. Room was clean, beds very comfortable.

The only room negative was that there was only one handy electrical outlet (near sink in the small bathroom) but no ledge or place to lay curling iron or shaver. It would be nicer to have another mirror and electrical outlet by the dresser in the main room.

Continental breakfast very tasty and the fresh fruit was wonderful. However, there was no protein except for milk and small packet of peanut butter; otherwise all carbs.

If you get a room on the 5th floor, it's a great view, but there is a funky system of VERY slow elevators. There is no direct stair route either.

We would still stay there again if we return to San Francisco!!
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the staff, the cleanliness, the "living room" on the lobby floor, courtyard, and the location and proximity to bus lines.
review.negativeRemarks: More electrical outlets for curling irons, phone chargers
review.locationRemarks: There are restaurants and shops on Polk. Both Van Ness and Union have relatively close conveniences. Best is on to Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Nice hotel centrally located in the city.
review.reviewText: Great amenities. Newly remodeled. Helpful staff. Walking distance to many touristy areas. Good for kids. Convenient parking.
review.positiveRemarks: We were given a roomy, corner room for our family of 5. It was newly renovated and comfortable. We had a view of the Golden Gate, which was awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise-insulating windows. The hotel is on a busy road and the noise is pronounced.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the wharf, Coit Tower, Chinatown, Little Italy and more from this location.

review.title: Great hotel, its a must try.
review.reviewText: Picked this hotel from other positive reviews, dont let the negative ones keep you from trying it out. Its location was great to fisherman's warf, Lombard street was near and a fun experience. Rooms were clean, staff nice and freindly. The breakfast was good. All in all a great experience we will be back.

review.title: excellent price for good quality.
review.reviewText: excellent price for good quality. Excellent location. nice staff
review.positiveRemarks: location , breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: insonorisation

review.title: No customer service
review.reviewText: Never did stay the night due to date mess up and hotel unwilling to refund the money. What a way to do poor business. I wouldnt recomend anyone stay where they are unwilling to please the customer.

review.title: Hotel is on its downhill slide
review.reviewText:
This hotel was definitely a motel in its former life. It had gone through a renovation. But the wear and tear from the renovation is now visible.
1) The blinds don't work. We had a semi-private room as people can still see into part of our room from the outside.
2) The combination lock box in the dresser doesn't work.
3) There's no refrigerator in the room. This was unfortunate because we bought some macarons.
4) Some hotel staff may or may not be intentionally mislead us in term of airport transportation. We were going to get a taxi, but they suggested a limo service that the hotel uses. The limo driver insisted that he didn't carry change when we gave him more money than the quoted price. So he helped himself to a hefty tip.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk up to Lombard street to see the winding road. Coit Tower is up the Telegraph Hill. Bus 49 is useful to get to Market street.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText: My fianc and I only stayed here one night, but it was absolutely horrible. The location was pretty convenient, and that was about it. Our room was outdated and extremely small, not to mention they charge $30/day for parking! We came in late, and woke up to bed bugs under our pillow!! Needless to say we called management to make out complaint. After seeing pictures and seeing the bugs, management treated us horribly. He began by saying it was bugs from outside that came in the room to accusing us of bringing in the bugs. It was only until we complained to Expedia that we received a refund for our room. Not the service I would expect for $126 a night! Would not recommend.

review.title: We rented three rooms.
review.reviewText: One was quite good, and the other two lacked air conditioning and were noisy. One because it faced Van Ness, the other because it was next to a hallway with a lot of traffic. The location was great.

review.title: Plain and Simple - Nice accomodations!
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant to us. They answered all of our questions and were very eager to help us when we needed it. The rooms were neat and modest ,which accomodated our needs. Not only did we feel comfortable we also felt very safe.
review.positiveRemarks: The towels! Big bath towels! It is always a lovely surprise when they are used in hotels. The breakfast was also very filling and wonderful!
review.locationRemarks: Only a short walk away there are many shops, restuarants and bars. We took many of them in!

review.title: very good access to surrounding points of interest
review.reviewText: very nice and helpful staff, interested in pleasing the guest, and the continental breakfast was better than most.
review.positiveRemarks: i liked the concern for the security of hotel guests, and my off-street parking was important to me as a person with a few disabilities, and newer mbz
review.negativeRemarks: a little more-interesting breakfast would be nice, but not all that important.
review.locationRemarks: the hotel is centrally located to the gourmet restaurants i was seeking, and the flamenco consert i came to see at the palace of fine arts.

review.title: Nice staff but its a motel at best.
review.reviewText: We booked this villa for just one night before flying out early the following day. Staff couldnt have been more helpful but this place is just a drive up motel without the drive up.we had to change rooms as we would never have slept on the first floor due to the noise from pool area. reception staff moved us no problem and we finally managed to get our 8 month old to sleep.i would recommend this place if you dont mind noise and to be fair its kitted out well.just not for us at this time and wished we'd stayed elsewhere.

review.title: Perfect for the occasion!
review.reviewText: The hotel served the purpose for our 3-day in and out trip to SF. Came to see a rock concert with a buddy, and needed a nice, convenient place to stay that was safe, affordable, not too swanky, and had the basic amentities.
review.positiveRemarks: Had a weight gym, pool, continental breakfast, fairly modern rooms, friendly staff and nice convenience to downtown SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room's A/C wasn't working. However, the ceiling fan combined with leaving the sliding door open kept the room cool - temp was 60 outside.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf, Coit Tower, Polk and Union (young area), City Hall, Bill Graham Auditorium, and surrounding areas.

review.title: Smelly dirty room
review.reviewText: The room smells I mean it smell! Room never get clean properly.

review.title: The hotel room was nice for the price.
review.reviewText: Nice room, parking lot But like others before me have said: the A/C doesn't work

managementResponses.response:
The customers satisfaction at our Hotel is the first priority. I apologize for not meeting your expectation. Nevertheless, I disagree regarding being staff unhelpful. We had two managers, security staff and a police officer helping you when you had your personal issue. We were there all the time providing support you need.

The police officer himself said that we should you charge for smoking in the room and he also mentioned it in his report.

We also have great breakfast. If you look at our previous reviews, most of our guest enjoyed our breakfast.

Thank you so much for your feedback.

review.title: Worst hotel experience of my life
review.reviewText: Staff was unhelpful. They tried to charge me $300 for smoking in my room, which I never did. They refused to let me speak to a manager about the charge. The breakfast is worthless and they have ads on their TVs that play over whatever you are watching. All in all, this hotel completely failed to live up to its description and I will never go back and never recommend it to snyone. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: nothing
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Called the front desk to get directions and the staff was great as well as patient with me. once I arrived very speedy check in, room was nicely up graded.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Can not think of anything

managementResponses.response:
Dear Scott,

Thank you so much for your feedback.

Rooms are inspected three times all the time before released to the guests. A call from you during your stay would have met your cleanliness standard.

We informed our guest about parking fee in our website, third parties' website and at the check in which all states that parking is $30.00 tax included.

Recently, pictures on our website has been updated by a professional photographer and without any photo-shop.

Thank you again for staying with us. We hope to see you in near future.

review.title: Nice upgrades, but was very dirty.
review.reviewText: There was hair in the bathroom shower, the bathroom overall wasn't very clean. At check in we were told parking was $3/day but at checkout they tried to charge us $30. The pictures showed interior rooms, which were only on one side, we ended up with exterior rooms. We wouldn't have reserved the hotel knowing that. Walls were paper thin, you can hear everyone outside and in the rooms next door. We do not recommend it.

review.title: Great staff, comfortable rooms, decent facilities
review.reviewText: The staff here are great. Yassar and the guys at the front desk were great and very helpful for my group. Water pressure and limited gym hours left a bit to be desired but the location more than makes up for it. Only thing that really knocks the place down from 5 to 4 for me is the steep parking rates (35 dollars per day) for a garage spot.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Okay place, new carpet but few convieneiences in room. House keeping was rough.

review.title: Hidden Gem on Van Ness!
review.reviewText:
It was a real pleasure to stay at the Da Vinci Villa for my "staycation" in SF from Marin County. My friend and I were very happy with the location and were willing to sacrifice on the actual hotel for said location. HOWEVER, we were surprised at how very nice this location's rooms and facilities were.

The room is spacious and appointed with a modern and comfortable look. The shower was very nice and the entire room was comfy, including the bed. I asked for a room with a view and early check-in, they gave me both!

The fitness center and sauna was a huge surprise! The sauna is new and clean and the fitness center had everything and more, it had gear you would usually only see at higher-end gyms. Amazing! And they also have a heated pool that is very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rooms, great fitness center, friendly and accommodating staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Very little, everything about this place impressed!
review.locationRemarks: Right on Van Ness near the Marina. My friend and I went to the Plant Cafe on Steiner and Chestnut. There is also Real Foods nearby on Polk.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We truly appreciate you letting us know about your stay and sincerely apologize if all was not to your liking. Our staff strives for excellence and wish we have known about your dissatisfaction which is already reported to our department managers. Thank you so much for staying with us.

review.title: Maybe if things worked
review.reviewText: I called early to make sure my room was ready.they said it a was and I could come check in.after I got to the room I found no hot water and no heat.that was three in the after noon.they brought me room heaters at eight that night.when I came home at one in the morning there was still no hot water.there was hot water in the morning and the rest of my stay.had room heaters the whole time heat did not work.manager did take fifty percent of that nights stay and parking for two night.so once the heat was in I was pretty ok with the room.the, what they call continental breakfast is stale bagel, dry box pastries, dry stale bread, dry scones.very unimpressed.not worth it.if you can get a really good price and the amenities are working out would be a decent place but not at full price.don't think I would go back.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Super nice staff. Generous facilities. Great loaction.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for choosing our hotel during your trip to San Francisco. We always appreciate honest feedback from our guests to ensure our hotel is staying on track with our high level of service standards. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you encountered during your stay.

Please know that your comfort and security is our top priority. We take your concerns very seriously. We want you to know that your comments have been shared with our management team. It is our constant goal for each of our guests to enjoy their stay and be completely satisfied. Your comments will help us work to achieve this goal. We truly appreciate your business and hope you will give us additional opportunities to serve your lodging needs.

review.reviewText: Our room was too hot, so we had to open the window which is on a busy street. We all had a poor sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The lay out of it. The bed sheets.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for choosing our hotel. We appreciate hearing from our guests and are happy to hear that you enjoyed our comfortable beds and shower.

We are sorry to hear, though, about the AC/Heater issues you encountered in your room. Your comments have been passed along to our maintenance department. It is very helpful for us to hear from our guests because it helps us to identify any concerns with our team and make the appropriate changes for upcoming stays.

Thanks for your feedback and we hope to see you again soon!

review.title: This is a good hotel for service and convenience.
review.reviewText:
Needs improvement in temperature control. We moved to a second room with a portable air conditioner because our first room's window faced the afternoon sun and it became very warm (outside temp about 70). The second room with a.c., which worked weakly, also heated up a lot (not as much as the previous room).

Otherwise, comfortable beds, good shower, and not too noisy.

review.title: Good value for money and good location
review.reviewText: Pleasant and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, good location
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfortable beds and continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to Lombard Street, Union Street (lots of restaurants) and a downhill walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Piers

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write about your visit with da Vinci Villa Hotel. We take great pride in the service we provide our guests. Your experience is not typical of the standard of service we provide and I want to apologize for your unfortunate experience.

However, you were charged $150 due to the damage of the "leg make up spray" that bled red and pink on all our towel, the bathroom walls and floor, and the sink. We had to throw the damaged towels. We use high quality, industrial strength cleaning supplies to remove the stains.

I would like to know what customer service situation had you experienced in our property.

Please contact me when you have other concerns or questions.

Thank you.

review.title: broken air conditioning
review.reviewText: air conditioning was broken and wouldn't move us to another room... also was charged $150 for using leg makeup spray in shower... Cleans out with windex!
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: terrible customer service.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for choosing the da Vinci Villa Hotel for your visit to San Francisco and for sharing your comments. I am very sorry the facility was not to your liking. We strive to provide every guest with an exceptional experience; however, it appears that we have fallen short of that goal in your case. We take all comments very seriously and will use your feedback to ensure that we are delivering on our promise.

review.title: Price gouging motel room over 101
review.reviewText: I spent $400 for a room at this motel with fancy name! The room was noisy, overlooking the 101 highway where it comes through the city. The lights turn on with a fan that I was unable to turn off, so cold windy night (coming down with a cold now). Shower was a trickle and moved from warm to cold. The TV remote was missing a battery. This room could not have been worse and it is an outrage that they can get away with the hefty price tag.
review.positiveRemarks: Past the construction site across the street you have a view of the Golden Gate bridge (will be gone when the construction is done).
review.negativeRemarks: Should price the rooms for less than $100 and be honest about what they are.
review.locationRemarks: Other than the 101 outside, the location is not too bad.

review.title: Amazing Location
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly Staff, Condition of Hotel facilities was excellent, Pet Friendly. Great complimentary breakfast & wifi. Rooms now have full length mirrors.
review.negativeRemarks: If they could add hard boiled eggs to the Complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from Union St - lined with Botiques & Eaterys. 1 block from Polk St - Pubs & a Walgreens. 10 minute walk to Pier 39 - Fishermans Warf!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Gracie

Thank you for providing us with feedback about your stay. I am happy to hear that your stay was enjoyable from beginning to end. We hope to see you again soon.

review.title: Last munute mini family vacation
review.reviewText:
The staff was great and took care of any issues in a timely manner.
Will book again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest

Thank you very much for your compliments of our staff. We all take great pride in the level of service we are able to provide. We hope to see you again soon.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service..............clean room great location in Russian hill near Lombard street

review.title: nice hotel close to Pier 39 & great food
review.reviewText: They have the cleanest rooms I have every stayed in, the noise level was very low especially being on the 4th floor facing Van Ness which is one of the busiest streets. The staff was very kind and helpful
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the clean smelling room it made us feel comfortable and at home
review.negativeRemarks: a better selection of breakfast foods. I would have liked to have eggs with my coffee instead of toast with is much healthier for you
review.locationRemarks: this location is near shops, local eateries, interesting people, great entertainment, nice walks

review.title: Satisfied Guest
review.reviewText:
I agree with the review about how it looks like/most likely is a remodeled motel from the outside. Although the layout of the hotel is very motel-ish, our room was great. I booked one queen bed and ended up getting upgraded to a 2 Queen Bed room. Only complaint is that we had the corner room next to the elevator & stairwell, so it was noisy at times. I didn't mind the noise, but I know some guests expect total silence. The rooms are poorly lit but nothing that affected my ability to see or enjoy the room. The bathroom was spacious, although the shower head was fairly low for my 6-foot-something boyfriend.

They charge for parking and parking is not first-come-first-serve, so when we came back late one night there were no spaces left in the "garage" so we had to park outside toward the street. (Something to consider)

Continental breakfast is good. Variety of breakfast drinks, waffles, bagels, pastries, cereal/oatmeals and fruit.

Location was convenient for trips to the Wharf and less than 20 min to AT&T park or Union Square.

I recommend trying the restaurants off Union St. If you stay here!

Overall I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a nice room, willing to sacrifice the usual hotel building environment, at a decent rate with a good location.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Thought the day time staff was not very friendly - but the night time staff was very friendly and pleasing. Over priced for what we got. The room was clean but lacked mirrors and lighting.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: More mirrors and better lighting.
review.locationRemarks: Marina District (Chestnut Street, Marina Green, Fort Mason), Russian Hill (Polk Street)

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf/Golden Gate Bridge
review.reviewText:
Short walk to Fisherman's wharf and Lombard Street with lots of buses available, close to trolley connections as well. Longer but doable (4.5 miles) walk to Golden Gate Bridge.

Great View if you get a Golden Gate Bridge view room!
review.positiveRemarks: View and continental breakfast

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: HORRIBLE bathroom, water pressure made it nearly impossible to thoroughly shower, pull-out sofa was horribly dirty & stained, only one tiny mirror inside entire hotel room, bathroom can only fit 1 person at a time, hotel staff were not helpful at all and questioned/interrogated all of my reservations. Did not feel welcome, comfortable or safe. Hotel needs serious renovations. Elevator barely works.

review.title: Nice location and reasonable price for the city.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very convenient location right in the center of everything an few mile away from all important attractions. However, I t would be great if they add curtains to their rooms. The blinds seemed to not give us full privacy in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and complimentary breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Add curtains to the rooms. blinds are outdated

review.title: Not impressed. Checked out early.
review.reviewText: Staff was wonderful. Did not like the location or the room itself. Room as way too small for three people.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very pleasant and accommodating.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't stay long enough to find out.

review.reviewText: Very nice and very comfortable!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: TV in guest room

review.title: Does the Job
review.reviewText: Da Vinci was a perfect place to stay for a weekend getaway to SF...close to cool areas, bar hopping down the street, and facility well taken care.
No A/C just ceiling fan. Not a problem in winter but maybe a problem in summer. Overall very clean room and good breakfast. Request a room away from the street as it can be noisy.

review.title: Nice hotel, clean and awesome customer service.
It was one of the most beautiful hotels
review.reviewText: the location was great the staff went way and above to help it was a terrific experience would highly recommend it
review.positiveRemarks: the views/location/the staff
review.locationRemarks: walk to fishermans wharf and all attractions

review.title: Great part of SF to stay, but find another hotel close by instead.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here because of the price, and I LOVED the stuff in walking distance, but I stayed here for 5 days, and the things that stuck out to me were:

1) As others have mentioned, the smell..no escaping it. Also there is NO a/c in your room, heads up there. I opened the window a lot to air it out.

2) Outside street noise was very loud in my room, I didn't get much deep sleep that week because of trucks driving by, etc

3) Fire alarm went off while we were there, because a guy burnt popcorn in his room! Not the hotel staff's fault of course. But, I think the lack of a/c and proper ventilation is what caused the entire building to evacuate late at night that night, because of the EAR PIERCING fire alarms INSIDE your room going off - that said, I felt safe at least

4) There were drunk people staying next door to me the last night, and because of the paper thin walls and noise levels I mentioned above, I could hear them yelling, fighting, stumbling around the hallway, they would knock on my door, etc...it was a mess, and made the night miserable. The hotel staff I can say was very quick to respond with security more than once though, so I'll give them that.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: the room conditions - no a\c, and so much noise I couldn't sleep some nights
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Great curb appeal. Very clean.
review.reviewText: Everyone was friendly and accommodating. It is close to Fisherman's Wharf and the Hyde St. Cable car. Busses run down Van Ness and the hotel offered a coupon for the Hop-on Hop-off bus.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location. I liked the view of the Golden Gate Bridge. I liked the accommodating staff. I liked the complimentary breakfast with good coffe
review.negativeRemarks: The street noise was loud at times. There should be double paned glass. The room did not have a full length mirror. And the room lighting was dim.
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf and not far from other attractions.

review.title: Not for business or romance
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean but with poor lighting, no place near sink for toiletries, room temperature was not able to be adjusted, the breakfast area served stale bagels, my fruit was spoiled. Hotel near a major traffic-way so lots of road noise. Few restaurants in walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, road noise
review.locationRemarks: Few restaurants near by

review.title: Hard to get a cab!
review.reviewText:
Last minute trip to SF with some friends. There was a huge conference and most of the big name hotels were already booked. This was the first time I had stayed at this hotel. The rate was good the room and bathroom were small but it worked for a weekend trip. The downfall was that it was so hard to catch a cab in that area - if your use to having the hotel pull a cab for you I would not recommend this place.

Otherthan that i didnt have any other issues. Oh btw....great free breakfast!!!

review.title: Clean but not at all worth what I paid !
review.reviewText: The shower was so horrible it was a trickle of water. It was loud with a bunch of college students living there. Will never stay there again.

review.title: Absolutely amazing
review.reviewText: The hotel was superb nearby to fisherman's wharf( nice stroll of 10-15 min walk), pier 33 (alcatraz trip) approx 35min stroll. Great facilities. We couldn't fault it in any shape or form

review.title: Nice hotel, close to shopping and dining
Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived early a.m. and the staff helped us to get into our room early. The bed felt great after along flight. Breakfast was good with some healthy items. Would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the park at Ft. Mason. Bus line in front of the door to take you downtown. One block away you have access to all sorts of restaurants.

review.title: A very pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco with my son and daughter-in-law for a family visit. We had two rooms and were very pleased with the hotel, and all the staff. The location was very convenient for sight seeing, there was even a server in at breakfast who gave us some suggestions and directions. Family members who live in the area were impressed as well by the hotel. I would definitely stay here again on future visits as well as recommend da Vinci Villa to friends planning on visiting San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Personality and helpfulness of all staff.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, and many restaurants, as well as walking tours.

review.title: Good price for a nice part of San Fran
review.reviewText: The entire experience was very pleasing. Nice rooms and a 10-15 minute walk to fisherman's wharf
review.positiveRemarks: The price is right, comfortable stay in a safe area of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: The continental breakfast is ok, but some eggs or meat would be nice. Otherwise it's all bread.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText:
Really clean, very nice staff. Free Wi-Fi in the room. Great television and channel choices. Good free breakfast. Linens were awesome! Great bed, sheets and towels! Bring a bathing suit to swim in beautiful heated pool.

Highly recommend!!

review.title: Amazing view of the golden gate bridge
review.positiveRemarks: The amazing view and the friendly, professional staff
review.locationRemarks: North beach - healthy walking distance to fisherman's wharf. Amazing views from room 412.

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent and the location was most convenient for taking buses all over San Francisco. My advice to guests is to bring a book light! The lights in the room were all rather dim and the only place with enough light to read was the bathroom.

review.title: Great hotel all around for price location everythi
review.reviewText: This was the second time I stayed here. Not much had changed. Great hotel for the price location and everything in San Francisco. The hotel staff was again the best. Friendly and hospitable. Close to everything yet far enough if you wanted some quiet time as well.

review.title: Great location and helpful staff
review.reviewText: Overall we were very pleased with our stay. It is walking distance to many attractions in the area and the staff was helpful and courteous. Breakfast was well done. We were not able to control the temperature in the room with the thermostat, but the weather was pleasant and it was not much of an issue. The main flaw was that the coffee maker was on the desk without an outlet nearby. We had to move it to the nightstand or to the floor to use it. Loved the bathroom and toiletries!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, bed, bath.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker could be better placed and could be a better model. Main light is turned on by a remote....make this more explicit.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Close to trolley.

review.title: 3 nights in a convenient location.
review.reviewText:
Convenient to everywhere (Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach, Embarcadero, Financial District, etc....)
Hotel was a plain jane for us; room and a bathroom.
Access and the staff were both great.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Decor. A few more creature comfort items in the room.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: The whole experience was terrible. Do not recommend to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Leaving
review.negativeRemarks: Staying at this hotel
review.locationRemarks: Close to transport

review.title: convenient for all the sights.
review.reviewText: arrived using the bart and bus from SF airport. upgraded without request. shuttle back to airport arranged. front desk manned by alex who was more than helpful. suite was roomy,clean,quiet and comfortable. the beds are great. overhead light not working, fixed within 5 mins.bathroom had really lovely comp toiletries. nice pool. breakfast included was very good. always plenty of room. diy waffles a must for a brit!! plenty of choice. all the staff very helpful and pleasant. SF is great. did all the tourist things. lombard street-walked up&down,the cable car was great.our driver was very amusing. pier 39,alcatraz a must. eating at fishermans warfe was sooo good. walked over the Golden Gate bridge. trolley bus ride. coit tower, what a climb. people very helpful. would love to go again and would definitely stay at the da vinci. nothing was too much trouble for them.
review.positiveRemarks: upgraded to junior suite without asking. no complaints at all.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: central to all the sights. fishermans warfe,cable cars,union square,golden gate bridge,pier 39, alcatraz. everything.

review.title: A Lot Of Benefits
review.reviewText:
Great complementary breakfast which was really good. Beds were very comfortable. Walking distance to alot of attractions.
The con was noise at night in the wall...water pipes have no idea.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf and Lombard street very close. Bus stop at corner.

review.title: was very dissapointing for the price of the rooms
review.reviewText: Hard to find as sign was way up on outside and covered by trees. . It seemed most rooms were rented monthly and lots of younger students ect. Being old it was not very soundproof and people walk right past your door talking loudly. The elevator took forever to come so we used the stairs most times
review.positiveRemarks: It had breakfast from 7 to 10 with a good assortment of items to choose from, coffee was excellent and staff friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some brightening up , and a vanity in the bathroom to do makeup ect, there was room to do this. The elevator needed updating badly, also.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to crookedest street in the world and reasonably close to tourist area, tours beach ect.

review.title: Practical sightseeing base

review.positiveRemarks: location. good free breakfast. wifi. clean.

review.title: Good hotel excellent position
review.reviewText: We had rooms on the top floor at the back of the hotel, they were comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Hotel is in a great position to reach many of the main sights. Enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great location, room with a fantastic view
review.reviewText: After reading the reviews on the hotel, we were pleasantly suprised how great the hotel was. Great location, fantastic view from our room of the bridge and bay, close to Cow Hollow etc. No noise from neighbours, great pool area and sun trap. Great staff, breakfast is continental but with lots of choices.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator could be faster

review.title: good location
