review.positiveRemarks: The management staff were very pleasant & most helpful wheneve we had any questions.
review.negativeRemarks: The location of the elevators are not accomodating for guests and were very slow.
review.locationRemarks: locations in the heart of san francisco - very good location

review.title: An expensive unhappy night
review.reviewText: Although the weather was cool and pleasant the room was hot and stuffy. Only one elevator worked and it stopped halfway up. I know San Francisco is expensive but This was ridiculous.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly
review.locationRemarks: The location was on a busy street with nothing pleasant nearby

review.title: Decent Place in a Nice Location
review.reviewText: Da Vinci Villa is a converted 1950s motor lodge, so it is a funky, quirky property with a wonderful, convenient location and a nice pool and workout room. The sleeping rooms are spacious, with a nice couch for family lounging as well as good linens on the bed. However, the space is not really put to good use, and the room feels almost empty, while the bathroom is extremely cramped. In addition, it was the darkest hotel room I had ever experienced--more lighting is needed for reading and general comfort. My biggest complaint was that the breakfasts provided are way too carb-heavy. The only other protein provided than yogurt is in the form of hard-boiled eggs; staff would not scramble them for us. However, overall, it was a good place for my family to stay in and one of the only affordable options we could find in the vicinity of Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, breakfast provided, spacious room
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast offerings need more protein, more lighting is needed in rooms, and the bathrooms should be enlarged to better fill the room space.
review.locationRemarks: FIsherman's Wharf and Russian Hill are close-by. There are many nice restaurants, bus lines, and cable car lines within walking distance.

review.title: service slow, room noisy, loud street noise
review.reviewText: close to wharf, but loud street noise, try and stay on the pool side or the opposite side of Van Ness
review.positiveRemarks: nice towels, breakfeast
review.negativeRemarks: carpets in hall, new windows
review.locationRemarks: very close to every thing

review.title: very helpful staff
review.reviewText: the hotel rooms were ok they were very clean but could use a little updating,the breakfast that was included was great. the staff was great and extremely helpful
review.positiveRemarks: very convenient to get almost anywhere by bus and the service was excellent
review.negativeRemarks: unfortunately we were on the 5th floor which we had to take 2 elevators to get to our room and one elevator was out of service for 2 says

review.title: Great Location , very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Great location for Fishermans Wharf , short 10 minute walk away. All the Staff , from the desk , to the cleaners , and even the parking attendants were very friendly and super helpful especially Jeffrey. Rooms were clean and comfortable , BUT , be prepared for noise as it is located on one of the busiest streets in San Fran. Ear plugs are recommended ( and are provided). Continental breakfast was plentiful , with friendly helpful wait staff. The pool was very clean and heated. A great little oasis in the city. Overall , for value for money , I would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location , Staff , pool , breakfast , parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe better soundproofing or windows for the noise. Sleeping with earplugs helps.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf , Lombard Street , Cable cars , restaurants , bars , etc.

review.title: Clean, kids enjoyed the pool, but rooms noisy
review.reviewText: Nuff said. Nice hotel, staff friendly, rooms clean, kids enjoyed the pool, but sound insulation is not great.

review.title: Great place to stay for travellers!
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, easy to reach by shuttle from the airport. Staff was excellent, beds were comfy and large. Breakfast was included and was a great feast, never minded if you grabbed something extra to eat on your way out. There was only a shower, but it was large and spacious. The pool was a great way to end your day, the suana was nice and the work out facitly was top notch. The rooms were cool, I had no issues with noise, and it was central to everything I wanted to see in the city, right next to public transit.
review.positiveRemarks: The look of the room and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe offer rooms with bath tubs
review.locationRemarks: Great locaiton, shopping, eating, fisherman wharfs and gierdelli square

review.title: Good location, short walk to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was disappointing after having just stayed at excellent hotels "near" Napa and Monterey. Be prepared to stay in an old hotel, but clean, the breakfast was great as was the staff. The location was great and it IS a city hotel....so unless you are prepared to pay top dollar, deal with the dcor. The manager was excellent, night staff not too good.
review.positiveRemarks: Went with the best price...SF is expensive. Breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Dcor.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, buses and cable car.

review.title: Affordable but unspectacular
review.reviewText: I'd put this hotel in the same league as a Days Inn or Comfort Inn, clean but old and not particularly appealing. No counter space in the bathroom is a bummer, just a sink bowl. If you get a room in the back of the hotel, like we did, you have to walk up and down a very steep sidewalk the equivalent of two floors to get to and from the lobby and breakfast facility, so you better be in good shape. Parking is convenient, at $25 per day. Not a bad location, walkable to the wharf area if you're in good shape and not in a hurry.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a vanity or counter space in the bathrooms, rooms were a little warm and stuffy, either didn't have air conditioning or it didn't work.

review.title: Don't trust the bad reviews
review.reviewText: Staff was great! Room was great! A really good value in San Francisco... Located in the middle oh everything!
review.positiveRemarks: Location Staff
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the place a few times, the location is great, the staff are nice, and the rooms are always clean. The beds are super comfortable and the pool is nice & hot.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, the Marina, Fort Mason is close by too, a great place to check out a slew of food trucks on Friday nights.

review.title: On Van Ness, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beds are good, rooms are old and dated, furniture old and dated, windows can not be blacked out.
review.positiveRemarks: Morning breakfast is fairly good, mostly bread products, no hot breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need up dating and repairs

review.title: Ideal hotel for all
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 5 nights at Da Vinci Villa. Breakfast was very nice. Choice of cereal, porridge, boiled eggs, muffins, toast, fresh fruit and you can make your own waffles. Coffee and fruit juice. All served buffet style in the restaurant. Only dissapointment is restaurant now closed in the evening.
Rooms were adequit and clean. Location good for walking to many sights, though some streets a bit steep but we mastered meandering the least inclines. It is to be expected in San Francisco.
Staff were very helpful and friendly.
Really nice swimming pool, patio area.
Highly recommend Alcatraz tour. We were surprised to meet Al Capone's niece Dierdre on our visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, swimming pool, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant being closed
review.locationRemarks: Very good location

review.title: Fine but avoid the noise
review.reviewText: Hotel is fine, as is breakfast- don't believe the moaners on other reviews! Our room was fine and large, BUT noisy as by ice machine (why do Ameticans need so much ice 24 hrs a day?) so avoid room 344 if you can. Also o r of the fan lights just kept randomly coming on in the night an d flashing- reported it but didn't get fixed.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfadt, v friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Be careful about noise

review.title: Walls were thin as paper, Terrible views
review.reviewText: Would not go back. Terrible views, walls were paper thin, kids in the pool all the time even after pool was supposed to be closed for the evening.

review.title: Convenient central hotel
review.reviewText:
Our stay didn't get off to a good start as the receptionist took exception to our booking and the age of our child booked into the same room. As far as we were concerned this was a matter for the hotel to take up with Expedia. We were on the 1st floor overlooking the swimming pool in the courtyard. This was quite noisy but would be useful if your kids were wanting to go intro the pool all the time. Although the pool was heated we didn't want to hang around because by the time we got to the pool in the late afternoon the courtyard was in shade and pretty chilly! Breakfasts were manic as too many people for such a small room. The staff did a great job of trying to accommodate people though. We tried arriving at a different time each morning and there was invariably a queue.
The power went out in our room on several occasions during our stay. We had to have the air conditioning on as the room was really hot even though the weather outside was not that hot.
The location was good however for accessing the sight. It was a fairly short walk to the California st cable car and we walked along Filbert st to the Coit Tower.

review.title: Poor service and breakfast
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice enough, it's clean etc and in a good location. However, the staff at the reception give the impression that they don't really care and there is only usually one of them on the desk. The executive room we had was next to the main road and even though we were on the 3rd floor it was very noisy. We got back to the room one day at 4.30pm and it still hadn't been cleaned. However, the biggest criticism is the breakfast. They cannot cope with the volume of people when the hotel is full. You have to queue for a table, then there is no food, no coffee, no plates etc. Although the staff work hard to try and keep up with the demand it's a disaster. Totally unnaceptable. They also charge $25 per day for car parking. It was the worst hotel out of the 9 we stayed in during our trip to the USA.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, very poor service
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Proximity to the wharf the only good thing.
review.reviewText:
The only redeeming features of this hotel are it's proximity to the wharf and its cleanliness.

The walls are so paper thin you are bombarded with noise from the other rooms and outside and hear every footstep from above. The shower had no water pressure, it was a weak dribble. You also couldn't adjust the temperature, it ran freezing cold alternating with boiling hot.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText:
Happy with the location, close to everything.
Parking a plus and the pool was a nice touch
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean, we arrived early and staff worked very hard to get us in early.
review.negativeRemarks: A little outdated , perfect for the price
review.locationRemarks: Close to all major attractions

review.title: Very pleasant place to stay
review.reviewText:
The lobby/reception area had been redone recently and looked fantastic, it actually made it look more like a 4/5 star hotel so initial impressions were good. My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights on the first stop of our honeymoon and we were both very pleased with the choice. We managed to get one of the few rooms with an actual balcony that overlooked the city to the west and had an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge, so we felt very lucky in that respect.
The room itself was fairly small but had everything you needed including an iron and ironing board, a hairdryer, Large HD TV, dressing gowns, towels, wall mounted dispensers for shampoo and shower gel in the shower, leaflets for attractions of the city, and a table and chair set for the balcony.
One thing we had seen mentioned in previous reviews was that the noise from the swimming pool carried up and into the rooms fairly easily, even with the door shut. Unfortunately this was the case but the pool had sensible opening hours and they even provided ear plugs incase you needed them. The windows were double glazed so minimal noise from Van Ness Avenue could be heard at night.
As well as an outdoor heated swimming pool, they had a well equipped onsite gym, along with a sauna, which were both up to date and well maintained.
review.positiveRemarks: Room, facilities, staff, breakfast, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Out of date elevator (however they were 'in line for refurbishment') and the noise carrying up to the rooms but we were not bothered out it.
review.locationRemarks: Decent location within 10-15min walk to Fisherman's Warf, and very close to the cable car line.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Walls were paper thin and the noise from the pool and adjacent rooms was very loud.

review.title: Very European experience
review.reviewText: Great location - close to Lombard Street & 3 blocks from trolley rails although tough to get a spot at that location in summer. Easy to get a taxi or bus too. Pool heated but SF can have cool air in summer. Staff very helpful. Continental breakfast in AM a plus but gets crowded around 8am so seating is an issue. Great lounge for gathering large groups. Make sure you have air conditioning in your room during summer. We were in one room without and had to move (which they did with no issue).
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, breakfast, location, cost.
review.negativeRemarks: Air condition in room in summer, some rooms a little small for 3 or 4.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard Street

review.title: European hotel style with friendly staff
review.reviewText:
We had a group of 12 for this 6 day visit. Half of the group were from Venezuela and the rest from the U.S.

The rooms were unexpectedly spacious and clean for an old hotel. The staff are all helpful and handle multi-language guests and multicultural expectations very well. They also were good at answering questions about San Francisco. You will need to get used to walking up the stairs since the elevators are VERY SLOW. The hotel is kind of a maze.

The breakfast is a little better than continental with hard boiled eggs and waffles. This is all self serve but seems to work. In general, the hotel staff did a good job of keeping the serving tables filled and there seemed to be no shortage of food.

We asked to use the Lounge so we could bring in pizza (The staff recommended a very good pizzeria) for our group. Other guests were nice enough not to intrude and we had a very nice time.

We were also pool side. Other guests had children using the pool but the area accommodates multiple groups so it worked for us to have wine, beer and chips poolside. There is a convenience store on the other side of Van Ness so you can purchase what you want at reasonable prices.

Location on Russian Hill was good for tourist activities yet not a noisy hotel with a lot of street noise at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast Knowledgeable and accommodating staff Extra "common areas" to use if you have a larger group
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators need to be worked on
review.locationRemarks: Location on Russian Hill was good for tourist activities Easy drive to Golden Gate Bridge and Wharf

review.title: Meh...
review.reviewText:
Front desk staff didnt know anything about the area, when asked.
Elevator was broken outside my room.
Room smelled musty.
Breakfast was over hyped and consisted of mainly toast.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Lombard St.
review.negativeRemarks: the smell.

review.title: Great customerservice
review.reviewText: pleased with the arrival, they called the room after we settled if we are pleased and if we have any question or concern
review.positiveRemarks: cozy place, friendly staff, great pastry
review.negativeRemarks: noise, thin walls
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is definitely older - but they have done a good job remodeling the most important areas. The rooms are small but very well put together. the beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are nicely finished. Overall we would stay at this hotel again. We stayed at the da Vinci Villa the first night and the Westin the second night in San Fransisco - definitely slept better at the da Vinci.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very helpful; hotel was very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is pretty close to the Fisherman's Warf - easy to access the tour buses from the area.

review.title: Not what we expected
review.reviewText: Advertised as recently-remodeled, it wasn't anything special. The water-heating system needs to be upgraded; shower water temperature went from cool to scalding frequently. Noise on any of the walkways is amplified so it was necessary to keep windows closed.
review.positiveRemarks: The Russian Hill location is good.
review.negativeRemarks: Increased staff at check-out. Fix the water heating system. Indoor/outdoor carpeting on the walkways.
review.locationRemarks: Polk Street restaurants are great.

review.title: UNfriendly counter guy
review.reviewText: Why does it take one person to ruin your stay? The counter guy the first night we checked in was grumpy and rude. He was also that way with a person who didn't understand English. The parking garage is difficult at first to understand. He was very impatient with giving instructions. They didn't have a refrigerator after asking for one 2 weeks in advance. I had to explain to them it was for medicine and then he found one. The room staff and the engineers etc. were very friendly. But the desk staff seemed a little above themselves. The small opened bar of soap was the only amenity we were given. The shower soap dispensers were fine. There needs to be more staff at the continental breakfast. Those people work their bums off. And they were very willing to assist. BUT FIX THE TOASTER!!!! Maybe add another one. It seemed to get crowded at that area. The food was okay. They just kept running out.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast waiters. The friendly people assisting you in you hallways. The swimming pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Watch that husky guy at the desk's attitude. It's the first person who gives the hotel it's reputation.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks to the cable cars.

review.title: A California Weekend
review.reviewText: Cozy room for four adults and two beds. Clean and safe area.
review.positiveRemarks: Distance to public transportation such as a cable car route and the number 47 bus which crosses many other bus routes.
review.negativeRemarks: The building is clean, but looking a little tired. We had the A/C cranked in the room to combat the heat that was running and could not be shut off.
review.locationRemarks: Near the warf, walking distance if you do not mind a few hills.

review.title: Rooms and bathrooms are very small. Overpriced!
review.reviewText:
The complimentary continental breakfast was a joke, loaded with carbs. We went out for a healthier breakfast instead. The hotel is located on the corner of 2 busy streets, ANYONE, can access the guests rooms, parking garage, etc... the entrance and elevators were not secured. I did not feel safe staying here.

Although the staff was friendly, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. For the same price, I could have stayed a a nicer hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING ELSE!
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, near Ghirardelli Square.

review.title: Great hotel with walking distance to wharf!
review.reviewText: I was a little sketchy at first but when we pulled up to hotel I was impressed. Location was great. Staff was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect.

review.title: wouldn't go back
review.reviewText:
the staff: no help with language, or holding doors open
the room: ooold no picutres on wall, tiny old rooms,
bathroom aweful. old showers, my handicapped son couldn't take a shower at all
since there are no handles anywhere, you could barly open the door into the toilet
cause the bed is next to it
the elevator is so slow everybody takes the stairs
breakfast: glasses , cups etc out of the way to get juice or coffe, it doesn't make any sense
the batter for waffles was spiled and nobody cleaned it up. no hot water , no sirup
very poor breakfast, also tiny room overcrowded when you try to get something
no parking at all, the staff is so lazy and rude. we aksed for parking and he said it would cost
$25 but they don't have any available. we parked 5 blocks down for $60 a night!!!!!!!!!!
we left a day early , since it was that shabby . bummer!
review.positiveRemarks: the location is the only thing that is good about it
review.negativeRemarks: a lotttt. the staff sucks big time, no service what so ever, add some love the rooms, they are empty and plain , renew those terrible bathrooms...

review.title: A great disappointment...
review.reviewText: It was not what I expected. They double booked and had to get a diff room. Parking was very scarce. Super crowded at breakfast time. Will not be going back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was trying their best...
review.negativeRemarks: Too many things to list.
review.locationRemarks: The location itself is great but for the price it's better to stay at a more reputable hotel.

review.title: Cheap and close, but noisy
review.reviewText: Noisy and old facilities (especially the elevator). No parking and low quality breakfast. Only good for a cheap stay near fisherman's warf.

review.title: Horrible,,,don't stay here:/
review.reviewText: Over priced, no air conditioning, no water pressure! Would not advise anyone to stay here!
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing
review.negativeRemarks: Price, customer service, rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Long hike to everything!

review.title: 4th of July in SF
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel at about 3:30 in the afternoon, having a guaranteed room. The hotel parking lot was full. Parking options offered were some fairly nearby parking garages, all of which were closed due to the holiday (July 4th). We ended up having to park in a metered, two hour space, several blocks from the hotel. Yes, I got a parking ticket. Very inconvenient but that wasn't the worst part.; The original room offered to us had no A/C. Apparently the hotel is upgrading their A/C. We were moved to another room with a wall mounted A/C unit but the evaporator coils were covered in ice which impacted the unit's efficiency. Further, as the ice melted over the evening/nigth there was constant annoying dripping that soaked several towels. Not much sleep that night.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is good - a 15 minute walk down to Fisherman's Wharf and 3 blocks from the trolley line. The bed was quite comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Giving guests the option to reserve a parking space would be very helpful. And of course, fix the **** A/C.
review.locationRemarks: There's a pool in the center of the hotel grounds which looked nice and a number of families were enjoying it.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was clean and it was very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and other popular San Francisco locations. The only concern we had is the room itself had poor lighting. There were two ceiling fans, each with one very weakly lit light, and one desk lamp that only lit a portion of the desk, and a light on the wall over each side of the bed. We did not have enough light to see into our suitcases which were sitting in the corner on the couch. The bathroom was well lit and we either had to use that light to go through our suitcases or take the suitcase to the desk. We did ask hotel staff for more light and they tried to be helpful by sending another desk lamp. Still not enough. Pool was nice, we did not use it because we thought it was chilly however a lot of the other residents used it, and there was a nice exercise room. Decent breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Soft bed, clean room and bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to add a floor lamp over by the couches.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Tour Bus Departure location, Lombard Street, Chinatown. Close to everything, might need to drive to some.

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to all the attractions especially fishermans warf. Saved money on breakfast everyday which was very helpfull. I would stay again
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: Location very convinient to Lombard street, fishermans warf

review.title: Close to piers, hotel ok
review.reviewText: Loud noise through walls. Could here everything inside rooms.. No ac, and elevators took forever to go up and down

review.title: Nice hotel near to San Francisco Bay
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and close to the attractions, but what I didn't like about it is the poor lightening in the room and there was a problem in the internet, I couldn't connect to it from my room and the hotel staff didn't do anything about it.
review.positiveRemarks: It's closeness to the most attractions
review.negativeRemarks: The lightening in the room and the wireless connection !
review.locationRemarks: It's close to Pier 39, it took like 15 minutes to get there walking..

review.title: no refrigerator or microwave
review.reviewText: very dusty, took two days to get a refrigerator, I loved the soap, shampoo dispenser
review.negativeRemarks: I opened the door and window and I thought it was snowing and then realized it was dust

review.title: I will go there again
review.reviewText:
I went there with little information; however, I was very pleased. This is remote enough to be quiet and near enough to the action to be fun.

I loved the room- it was comfortable and clean.

There were lots of families there and everyone I spoke to was having a great time seeing the city or using the patio and pool at the hotel.

My one comment would be that there is little variety at the complimentary breakfast; other than that, it was all around a good stay. (the coffee in the room coffee-maker was even good!)
review.positiveRemarks: You can catch a bus or street car to any of the main sights. I was there on business and got to my office quickly while still catching some great view

review.title: Definitely not worth the money.
review.reviewText: Upon check in the front desk clerk said they moved us to there number two best suite With two living rooms and a separate room with a king size bed. They said it would accommodate our party of four. When we went to the room it was very disappointing the room was empty with one sofa which was not a pull out bed no air conditioning. Two big rooms filled with barely any furniture. If you like minimalistic rooms with a lot of space this is ideal. The bedroom had plush bedding but was extremely hot because the sky roof let in much heat but nothing to cool the room temp down. The skyllight roof kept the room lit thru the night and The early morning sun was too bright for anyone to get some shut eye. We didn't get much sleep because the cleaning crew worked in the middle of the night and all you can hear word doors banging and laundry carts rolling around. The only good side to staying at this hotel was the walking distance to Pier 39 which was about a mile and a half downhill. I would not recommend this for a family with young children. Definitely not worth the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Looks nice on the pictures and profiles.

review.title: Old hotel
review.reviewText: Little parking, noisy, you can hear everything from the room above. Room was overall pretty nice but the sofa was very uncomfortable and had stains.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy and far from restaurants

review.title: Ok hotel without air/conditionar and bagles in AM
review.reviewText: Rooms are ok, no air conditioner AND no windows to open for air. So if you take a shower your roomies all sticky. The breakfast is bagles and coffee. Location is great. The parking area gets full but you get a spot for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Ventilation. I think that SanFrancisco it's not use to need a/c but its nice to have it available. mainly if your room only has a tiny little window.
review.locationRemarks: Near if you like walking, the port is close and its where all the social activity is.

review.title: Rip-off catering to foreigners
review.reviewText: THIS HOTEL SHOULD NEVER HAVE THREE AND ONE HALF STARS AS RATING! On the corner of VanNess and Filbert, this noisy place has many rooms looking onto an interior patio and pool, with a catwalk joining the sliding windows of the rooms (like a 1950s movie) for a fire escape, making impossible to open blinds or leave open the windows for security reasons and privacy. (Very European) The building is old and crummy with patched on renovations. The breakfast room is like a hospital cafeteria (without any warm food), and serves as the evening "restaurant" which is really non-existent. One elevator didn't work one day. You can hardly turn around in the bathroom. It was full of foreigners who probably got a cheaper rate. It charged us California folks over fifty dollars more for the weekend with the marathon that it normally charges. Bad news all the way around. We should have gone with a known US chain.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a fan in the bathroom. Free internet in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything. Especially a little management involvement and oversight. A jacuzzi. A real bar and restaurant. Expensive parking charge.
review.locationRemarks: You can't really walk to Fisherman's Wharf--have to drive. There is a fabulous steak house around the corner on Lombard, called Bobo's Steaks.

review.title: Near fisherman warf
review.reviewText: Close enough walk to fisherman warf. Good area to stay
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Nice walk to fisherman warf

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: Don't mind taking two lifts to access the bedroom but room was smelly and bathroom very dirty. Also, this is not close to the wharf as suggested on Expedia. A good 30 min walk. Cable car two very steep blocks away. Breakfast was horrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty
review.locationRemarks: Near Lombard street but long walks to anything else.

review.title: Great location if you are a walker!
review.reviewText: Visiting San Francisco for vacation. Very convenient for us since we were interested in walking and using the MUNI system. Bus stop within the block. Not convenient to BART system, but we were not using that. Had a few problems...strange smell in first room. We were changed literally within minutes. Some noise from upstairs neighbors and again was taken care of within minutes. Having breakfast available was an awesome way to start the day. Nice heated pool and sauna a nice perk for the end of day.
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff, breakfast and sauna
review.negativeRemarks: slow elevator

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice remodeled hotel, close to Fishermans Warf, Lombard Street, Union Square, and many other streets that can take you everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was deliciously comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: The Mexican Restaurant should be open for Dinner.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located, close to many of the SF main attractions.

review.title: Good hotel for the money and family.
review.reviewText: For the overall cost this hotel was better than I had anticipated. The room was average size but was kept nice. The staff were able to accommodate our needs. When asked for something they did there best to get it for us. The sights were not that far of a walk. Being on Van Ness Street was the best (relatively flat road) it was only a ten minute walk to the bay. The continental breakfast was the best I have ever had.
review.positiveRemarks: The area was close to the bay
review.negativeRemarks: People in the pool after 9:00 pm
review.locationRemarks: 10 min walk from the bay. 20 min walk from pier 39 good for people who like to walk

review.title: Good family hotel.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed staying here. Nice warm pool for the kids. Room was nice. I had read about problems with noise from the main street, and rooms that were too hot. No problem. They have rooms that face the main street with a view of the bridge. If you want a view, and don't mind the noise, call ahead and ask for a room on that side. The also have rooms that face the interior courtyard which are quiet and don't have a view. If you want quiet ask for one of them. Like your room a little cooler? Ther have some rooms with a/c and some without. Just call ahead and ask for one with A/C. They were very accomodating. Had a problem with our first room, and they moved us immediately. Location is very convenient. Would be better if they had hot breakfast, but was fine. Would stay there again in a minute.

review.title: Disappointed guest
review.reviewText: Great location but the rooms are dreary and old. The AC does not work and they are missing simple things like a luggage rack.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Whar

review.title: Not all amenities available!?
review.reviewText: When booking this we decided to take a chance and "book cheap it & get the name later" there was a list of amenities listed, and one of my few requirements was a pool. Although there was a pool it was being remodeled and off limits(very disappointing to my husband and kids). I have to say the rooms were comfortable and the location was fantastic! The staff was friendly, but some much more helpful and knowledgeable than others. I'm not sure if my issue was with Expedia or with the hotel in regards to disclosing accurate information regarding amenities. I would have not booked this hotel if I had known there would be NO pool available.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Awkward layout to enter and exit hotel(like a maze).
review.locationRemarks: Prime location

review.title: was o.k. but I would not stay there again.
review.reviewText: The beds were great. We stayed 4 nights and had hot water to shower in 1 time. The food was set out on a long table and serveral children went down the table picking up the food with there hands and putting the rolls and different breads back. It would have been nice to have a choice to order from the kitchen. There was no hair dryer in the room but there was a empty bag that said hair dryer. Ever one at the front desk was very nice and tryed to help but we ask 3 times about the hot water. It was only hot one time. We did not take pictures. The hotel was not dirty but I did not want to eat there after seeing the kids finger the food.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Onlly one mirrow in the room . The way the food was put on a table in the mornings and kids fingering it. No hot water in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: I think it was on Van Ness in S.F. Cal.

review.title: Revamped Super 8
review.reviewText: This hotel is like a Super 8 with a new coat of paint and a nice TV.
review.positiveRemarks: The pillows were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls were paper thin. We could hear normal conversations from every room around us.
review.locationRemarks: It's fairly close to the water, which explains why it's so expensive. It's located next to a really bad Mexican restaurant.

review.title: Super Thin Walls
review.reviewText:
Location great! Staff Great!
The walls are paper thin, woken up every morning with people walking down the hall.... I'm a super heavy sleeper I'm quiet surprised I had an issue with the noise. It's a shame because other than that a nice place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location
review.negativeRemarks: Thin Walls

review.title: Nice Hotel to Stay at in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I were in San Francisco for vacation (her first time in San Francisco) and we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. It was a perfect location for us because we were going to tour Fisherman's Wharf and our tour left from there and the hotel was in a perfect location. We were just a few blocks from the Wharf and the view was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the San Francisco Bay Area.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location and the huge bathroom space.
review.negativeRemarks: The vehicle parking area could use a little improvement but I have no complaints because I know parking is a premium in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: This was my girlfriend's fist time visiting San Francisco and she enjoyed every minute of the tour and the city. She loved the city.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Limited available parking for available rooms. Had to park approximately one mile away on the street and spent 45 minutes locating the spot to park. The continental breakfast had limited coffee and no hot food. Baked goods and fruit were available. Hotel is not very secure. The hotel is accessible by any person from the street through side entrances, and balconies are connected. Elevators need some maintenance.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel is ideal, middle of the city close to the wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was clean and comfortable enough.
review.negativeRemarks: Improvement would include parking, security and breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Location is in the heart of San Francisco this allowing for activities in the city.

review.title: Everyone raved about this family vacation
review.reviewText: Good price and location. Could walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square and use public transportion to easily get everywhere around the city. Could see the Golden Gate Bridge from our hotel window. Hotel was not fancy but was clean and comfortable. All staff we encountered were helpful and friendly.

review.title: So so hotel, if there are no other options
review.reviewText:
While the room was clean it was small, and the hotel was simply dated. I was on the 2nd floor and even with the windows closed the traffic kept me awake until midnight. The room was considerably warmer than the outside air, by maybe 10 to 15 degrees, but there was no air conditioning, only a ceiling fan. So I had to keep the window open for a while, and then the traffic was REALLY loud.

Dated hotel with a fast paint job. Kinda crappy area. I would give this hotel a solid 2.5 stars. That they have over 3 stars currently is inappropriate.

review.title: Minor annoyances - nice place over all
review.reviewText: We couldn't use the pool one of the days because of painting. I thought it was strange that they would choose to do that on the Friday of a busy weekend but I suppose it needs to be done sometime. The water pressure in the showers was pretty poor. And the receptionist took quite a while to find my reservation - got a bit worried that the lost it. But other than those things it was nice. The bed was really comfy.
review.positiveRemarks: the beds!
review.negativeRemarks: the elevator
review.locationRemarks: not right in the heart of things but can walk to the waterfront in about 15 min.

review.title: Da Vinci Villa
review.reviewText: Only one of the washing machines on the 3rd floor was working and we had to go down to the garage. The lift is the slowest we have ever seen! The restaurant was limited in providing only Mexican food, when the name had implied Italian cuisine. Good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Lift

review.title: Great value.
review.reviewText: Conveniently located on Russian Hill with easy access to many parts of San Francisco. I'll book here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: No business center providing a public computer. Bring your own device or you are out of touch.

review.title: davinci
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel however I had requested a hotel within a 2 block radius of Fisherman's Wharf and this hotel was about 8 blocks away. It was a little further away from the action than I wanted

review.title: If you a like a small walk to the Wharf...
review.reviewText: Okay. About 7 minute walk down Van Ness to the Wharf. Very quiet but I was in the inner part of the hotel. The quality of the bed was excellent. Best thing about the hotel.

review.title: Noising and hot.
review.reviewText: The room was hot at night and we could not open the single window more than a small amount. The walls were thin and we had to suffer noise at night.

review.title: We'd stay here for the location, we are tourists!
review.reviewText:
A great location, moderately priced(for San Francisco). On the corner of Filbert and VanNess, a bus line going to Fisherman's Wharf to the north, and Market Street on SF well connected transit system, in the Russian hill neighborhood, makes getting to cable cars, the F line with it's electric vintage street cars, and Muni hybrids a snap. Extremely friendly and helpful desk crew, business access to printer(for printing boarding passes, etc.). In many hotels we've stayed at you pay for amenities like this... Other than street noise, which we are used to in a four story hotel, where you are not above traffic, and is a given, and some "Saturday night party people", most overnights it's quiet. Facilities are surrounded by residential apts, and overall, a safe neighborhood.
Walking up Filbert street is a steep grade, so, take the bus, if you aren't in good shape!!

We liked the light breakfast offering(no meat), and, as we came to eat in high end restaurants later in the day, it did the trick.
We will return next time we come for exploring the sights of this area. Pillow top mattresses--we slept very well every night. Good water pressure in shower, and SF tap water is even drinkable!! You can pay more in the Wharf 's "name" hotels,and it's your choice, but I'll spend less on rooms , and more on restaurants on our trips! WiFi speeds not super fast , but ok.

Harris' SteakHouse and Ruth's are both on VanNess to the south, and we like that,what can I say, I like meat!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Soft beds,great location,relatively safe neighborhood, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a light in the clothes armoire area
review.locationRemarks: On a bus line in the Russian hill district

review.title: Great as long as you don't need a shower
review.reviewText:
We actually liked this place quite a bit until we took showers in the morning. The shower was horrible! It had the worst water pressure ever! I could not even wash my hair because I didn't think I would be able to wash any of it out. And also the water was always either burning hot or ice cold. It was so hard to keep it warm. So I spent half the time jumping in and out of the dribbling water.

Otherwise the place was quite nice. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms had plenty of space. The free breakfast wasn't half bad. Lots to chose from. It was at the restaurant that is next door.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds
review.negativeRemarks: Shower
review.locationRemarks: Not bad locarion

review.title: not to bad
review.reviewText: It is a good hotel for the price. You get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: the restaurant needs much help and branding. Is it mexican or italian??
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great hotel to relax.
review.reviewText: The staff were very nice and very helpful. They also helped us book our winery tour which was a very nice experience. The house cleaning staff were also polite and kept our room clean. This hotel would be nicer if it was a little more upgrade. Its a really nice hotel and its location is perfect to all attractions. I would definetly book my stay at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Location is awsome, close to a lot of attraction you c an either walk or catch the bus, trolley or taxi.

review.title: Good - if you bring earplugs
review.reviewText:
The location couldn't have been better, close to Fisherman's warf, the exciting streets of Union and Polk. The small gym and the pool were quite inviting.
The continental breakfast was just that - continental, lots of pastries, no egg, no yoghurt, no cereal.
AND; don't forget to bring earplugs - we could actually hear what the couple on the other side of the wall was fighting about.
All in all, it was worth the buck.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the gym and the small pool
review.negativeRemarks: A Leonard Cohen quote comes in handy: The walls of this hotel are paper thin

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText:
This was absolutely the worst stay ever. A complete waste if a lot of $$$$
Expedia should take this off your list if hotels.

review.title: good hotel with good breakfast
review.reviewText:
THE ROOM was clean , and they have a good breakfast (fruit,bread and cake)
not cheap but its good .

review.title: Great week in San Franscisco
review.reviewText: I was there with my three teenagers for a San Franscisco week of tourist fun. The location was quite walkable to the waterfront and some great restaurants. It wasn't easy to get there on the BART however. The breakfast was fun every morning and at night a new restaurant is opening up (as of 4/13). The owner is a sweet Mexican family who makes the most amazing chili rellano ever. We found it comforting to come back to the hotel and have some tea and snack before bed. What would've been nice: to have the desk personnel be more knowledgable and helpful with the city itself, to have parking available (it was full for us--no fault of theirs), and to have the pool working--or a hottub. The rooms were clean and ours was quite large. The internet worked well and the staff was nice.
review.locationRemarks: define

review.title: Alright
review.reviewText: Parking was limited and $25/day. The outside and halls look like a rundown apartment complex but the rooms were surprisingly updated at least. The fitness center isn't bad. The walls are thin and so are the ceilings because I can hear people walking around upstairs and everything that is going on nextdoor including people talking and screaming along with dogs barking. Its a close drive to shops and tourist attractions though.
review.positiveRemarks: The amenities and updated room/bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Stuffy and noisy. The hallways and hotel in general look sketchy. Limited parking

review.title: Hotel was ok
review.reviewText: The rooms where a little small but workble! It was clean hotel, price was not bad in the city...
review.positiveRemarks: Staff...
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms too small...
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to lots of things...

review.title: Casual & easy-going hotel stay
review.reviewText:
Nice enough for a casual get-away for an easy-going couple. Staff was nice and helpful. Easy walk to the warf and up the hill to get views. Would say this place is perfect for students, couples that are not on a romantic trip, and those that don't spend a lot of time in their room.
Bedding was clean and comfortable. Shower pressure was minimal at night and full in the morning. Bare bones, but decent, and we felt safe & comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: value, location, & parking was easy
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls & windows

review.title: Great - if Noise & Partying is Not a Concern
review.reviewText:
There is more to a hotel stay than just cleanliness, service, comfort/amenities and upkeep. The QUIETNESS needs to be a consideration. After all, most families on vacation want SLEEP! Be aware, this is not a quiet hotel. Parties can erupt above your head or in the courtyard area at any time of the night (and did on 2 of the 3 nights). The first night the joy seekers were so bad they were kicked out the next morning!

The hotel is nicely refurbished. It is conveniently located. And the staff tries to be nice. I just won't go back or recommend da Vinci Villa hotel because sleep is even more important to me and my family.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly refurbished. Free breakfast. Clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise. Thin walls and floors. Open pool/courtyard area for noise to be carried to all rooms. Partying at all times of the night.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Short walk to Wharf.

review.title: Too much noise
review.reviewText:
The pictures looked way better than the real thing.
Not horrible, but it was not that great either...cheap looking. You can hear absolutely everything outside of your room, you can hear people talking, the tv on, the doors, people walking outside, kids in the pool...very disturbing.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was pretty nice
review.negativeRemarks: Noise was terrible and it looked cheap
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to bars and nice restaurants

review.title: Average traveler
review.reviewText: There are taxes charged on parking it is not $25 dollars. The rooms are clean and the staff was friendly. For the price of the hotel in the city of S.F. was great. The "breakfast buffet" is hardly a buffet at all. It is more of your run of the mill hotel continental breakfast. Also, there is a cook on hand if you want eggs and bacon but of course you have to pay. Furthermore, they were installing beds in other rooms so there was some banging but stopped before like 6pm or 7pm for people to sleep. Not too far of a cab ride from fisherman's wharf I believe it was like a $15 cab ride including tip.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Sleepless in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Could not sleep at all! No sound insulation between rooms and floor/ceiling. Loud voices, not so loud voices, and any TV all sounded as if they were in my room! Staff tried to quiet down loud voices and TV but the building is hopelessly inadequate to block sounds. PLUS, sounds from machines coming on and droning on and on were amazingly loud. Must come with sleeping pills and noise canceling head phones if you want to sleep.

Location is excellent and I found a fabulous restaurant on Union, Capannini's, that I would strongly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near to Fort Mason
review.negativeRemarks: VERY NOISY

review.title: great place for couple or single person

review.negativeRemarks: nothing...maybe surcharge for parking,$28.50

review.title: Make sure your room doesn't face Van Ness
review.reviewText: I requested 2 rooms close together. They noted the age of my daughter and her friends (14) and put us in rooms located facing the main thorough fare (Van Ness). The rooms were uncomfortably warm so with no heat on we had to open windows and have fan operating to cool the room. Needless to say, the noise from the street was horrendous. Unable to sleep!

The hotel is clean ,the bed comfortable,the window opens and the noise is minimal - traffic but no loud partying in the street. I also liked that we could self park our car. The staff were very nice. We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: I wish you mentioned the hidden fees upfront

review.title: It's nice, but a few things to think about.
review.reviewText: Close to the wharf and Ghirardelli's. You can walk there. The room is nice as a general comment. Beds comfortable, TV is nice and desk area is ok for working if needed. Parking was good though. Always had some available, but it is $25 more per night. Nice gym and pool area! Staff is pleasant, but kinda hands off. Free breakfast is bread and drink and minimal fruit, Thats it! Purchase if you want more. Lighting in room is pretty dim (good for a romantic getaway though) But the entry has no lighting, which is where the closets are. They are made of dark wood so it is difficult to see in them. Dont drop anything small in there, you will lose it. Access to the bathroom is kind of difficult and there is no place in sink area to put your stuff. They need to install small sink cabinets to provide a place to set your personals. In an effort to save water, the hotel does not provide a full set of towels unless you request it. Have a handicap son. The wheel chair access through out the hotel is quite difficult. Entry on and off elevators is very challenging. There are bumps throughout hotel where the outside cement areas meet the inside carpet areas. Hard for wheel chair access. The lift in front of the hotel did not work without the help of the staff. Needs to be ready at all times. It's San Francisco, what can one expect. They are limited in what they can do, but a change in the things mentioned would make this hotel very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice beds, pool and gym. Parking easy.
review.negativeRemarks: Handicap access, darkness and lack of surface area in bathroom. Bad free breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Wharf and Ghirardellis. Walking distance. Safe Neighborhood. Stores and services close by. 3 min to Lombard crooked street.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The Da Vinci Villa is a good value for the money. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, remote for the fan was nice. Bathroom was a little small but the shower was large. Lots of storage in the room. Layout of the hotel is a little odd. Parts of it are like a motel and parts are like a hotel. Really nice area to wait for people or sit together that is not attached to the lobby. The restaurant attached has really good food. The continental breakfast offerings are not impressive ( lots of bread and muffins and a fruit bowl with honeydew melon, cantaloupe and pineapple chunks) so we ordered from the menu also. Bus stop is very near and cabs are plentiful. Would definitely recommend this place.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel did not meet my expectations in regards to ambiance. My room was very bland and lacked coziness. I guess I got what I paid for. So if you are looking for somewhere decent and cheap than this will be a good place for you. The parking was cheaper than other hotels and the staff was friendly.

review.title: Clean, but bad night's sleep
review.reviewText:
Elevators were extremely slow and there was major maintenance in both stairwells, so you had to take the elevator. Lots of noise heard from the room. Room was way too warm and it wasn't possible to cool because the windows opened to a high-traffic hallway, not outside. Everything was clean. Wake-up call service didn't change their clocks with the time change so that was pretty annoying. Free continental breakfast was enh.

It's a step up in cleanliness from the motels on Lombard, but if you're going to spend this kind of money you'd be better off going with one of the major chains, unless you have a pet.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL FOR YOUNG TRAVELERS WITH $$$$$$
review.reviewText:
Visually, the hotel was amazing. I could tell that the remodel to the Building good. Downside was that musky smell. But if you get there at check in and open your window all the way and turn the dual ceiling fans on high it will air out. We arrived around 3:38pm, got our room early, and walked down to Fisherman's Wharf. The walk was 20 mins top. ( and we lagged serious butt!!!). All and all, I would stay here again. However next time i will ask for a room on the top floor facing towards the Golden Gate. The room we had was on the bottom floor closest to the pool...... O.o. The room was amazing! only down side was the size. If i was staying with 5 people it would have been great. Definately needed a couch or table in which to eat at.

If you are young (20-25) this hotel is great!!!! eveything is a 20 min walk away and you cant get any closer to the center of SAN FRANCISCO!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious, Clean!!!, Free Breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Musky Smell

There's free breakfast, but it's just bread and coffee, and for some reason the same breakfast is served in two different rooms to two different sets of customers -- if you try to eat in the wrong one, they ask you to change. Confusing and pointless.

They had free internet and a lovely big lounge to sit in. Breakfast was included and was continental with all sorts of wonderful cereals, fruits, yoghurts, muffins, bagels, pastries, and toast. Great to start the day.

So in the middle of the night I spent 20 minutes trying to keep my fan on and my lights off. Someone in another room was trying to adjust theirs and kept turning my lights on and my fan off. The noise is also very bad. From the streets and the adjoining rooms. You can hear every conversation in the adjoining room. I complained to the front desk and they just said they would check it out.

review.title: Great Budget hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful and friendly. We had a room which looked out toward Golden Gate Bridge and although on the Van Ness Avenue it didn't cause any problem. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast in the attached restaurant was also very good although complimentary was continental there was also a selection of cooked items. Service good here also and friendly. The overall location was perfect for local restaurants although steep road climbs, many popular places are walkable. We had a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: Room, staff and breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Slow lift
