review.title: Good value for money Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I used this hotel in september 2012. We arrived several hours early to be happily greeted and were able to book in early without any fuss or hesitation. Our bags were taken to the room and everything explained. Good sized room which was clean and comfortable. the bathroom was spacious and had good quality toiletries. The reception staff were always more than happy to give advice and help whenever we asked and the general atmosphere was relaxed, efficient and always available to help without being ingratiating. The hotel is in a good position away from the tourist trap of Fisherman's wharf but central enough to take advantage of the city. However be aware that it is in a very hilly part of the city. If you are on the fifth floor you have to take two lifts from different parts of the hotel because of the hill the hotel is on. The pool area was very well presented with towels on the sun beds although we were not able to use it. Breakfast is taken in the restaurant next door who provide a very substantial meal. No hesitation in recommending the hotel to anybody who is considering it. Lombard Street, the crookedest street in the world is in walking distance, but, is tough going because of the hills. Although all part of the charm in my opinion. Good value for money.
review.positiveRemarks: The pool area was well presented. the staff were always happy to help
review.negativeRemarks: Some rooms were on a long external corridor.
review.locationRemarks: Central position but very hilly. But you are in San Francisco, what do you expect.

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText: Essential when travelling with Children and requiring an extra bed to contact the hotel. Nice location near to the beach.
review.locationRemarks: Near to the beach. Short walk from Rustys - greatest pizza parlour in the world

review.title: A decent place to stay with great towels and linen
review.reviewText:
Clean and tidy compact rooms with comfy beds and really lovely towels and linen. Reasonably priced parking for the area, good location and very helpful and friendly staff. Pool great for kids too and breakfast was decent.
The room lacked a fridge but there is an ice machine. Rooms do not have A/C but it wasn't too hot during my stay.
My only criticism is that the doors are noisy when they close nearby and the rooms aren't very sound proof but overall a decent place to stay and would definitely consider staying again.
review.positiveRemarks: Reception, staff, lovely towels and linen, comfy beds and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy neighbours and closing doors...
review.locationRemarks: Great location, nice street, two blocks from Lombard Street, an easy walk to the Pier and the Bay.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was a bit farther from other areas we wanted to see than I thought, but we got a lot of great exercise.
review.positiveRemarks: The kids enjoyed the pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Room were adequate but small.
review.locationRemarks: It was farther to the Wharf that I expected.

review.title: Great for the budgeted traveler
review.reviewText: this hotel is everything you need and nothing you don't. Clean simple rooms that are very comfortable. Accommodating for whatever you might need. Nothing fancy though. great breakfast.

review.title: Da Vinci Hotel, Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We stayed for 5 nights and overall we were pleased with this hotel. We did ask to change rooms after the first night because of traffic noise and were relocated to a room overlooking the pool. This room was much quieter and very spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The free breakfast buffet was very good, but it did get busy if you went down later. The hotel is located a short walk from the Fisherman's Wharf area in a pleasant neighbourhood. Overall we were very pleased with our choice of hotel. and would be happy to stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds and free breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: Traffic noise in room facing road
review.locationRemarks: Good location close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: location location location
review.reviewText: comfy beds, responsive staff, nice bathrooms. very well locview from our roomated for walking everywhere. nice restaurants very near.
review.positiveRemarks: view and location
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: perfect- near to anything but not in the middle of everything

review.title: Not worth it..
review.reviewText: For the price you would think that this hotel would offer more than your standard motel. We did checkout the local motels and better price, better rooms. Don't waste your time here. They charge for parking - that was doubled on my credit card at checkout. I'm still fighting this charge with the hotel. Paper thin walls, they brag about view... no view. They are walking distance to a few bars, but nothing compared to other motels in the area. We paid double the price for nothing.. huge mistake.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Great to have the pool, good location for the $$. Continental Breakfast was ok, tired of begals
review.positiveRemarks: Pool, location to resturants and POI
review.negativeRemarks: The hills , LOL

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Very large room with only a bed, desk and desk chair and then a huge open space with no couch or chair. Lights on ceiling fans went on and off all night. Coffee maker but only plugs available required sitting the maker on the floor. But over priced for the quality of room!
review.positiveRemarks: Location for bus was good and walking distance to waterfront.
review.negativeRemarks: Price too high for quality
review.locationRemarks: Location for bus was good and walking distance to waterfront.

review.title: Not bad but could be much better
review.reviewText:
On appearances this hotel looked nice and was in a convenient area to access the wharf/bay area by foot. The things that let th hotel down was the lack of parking spaces, the inability to change notes into quarters for their laundry and vending machines. The staff were aplogetic but were unable to meet these requests. Perhaps management should consider offering such services. Another example was that laundry powder was not avaIlable for sale within the hotel and we were told to go across the road to a convenience store. This was not a huge inconvenience, but it is a shame to not be able to provide better feedback because of something so easily provided by management.

Breakfast involved often standing in long queues, not a great selection at the buffet with some items running out too often and too early. I would have to rate the breakfast as one of the worst encountered on our five week trip around the southern states of the USA. I woud not even mention the coffee!! It came with residue on two occasions and o bitter that I felt it was made up of the nights before coffee leftovers.....
review.positiveRemarks: The reception staff - could not have been more friendlier
review.negativeRemarks: The Breakfast!!!
review.locationRemarks: Handy to many attractions

review.title: Great hotel, good location, would return again.
review.reviewText: The room was clean & beds were very comfy. The walk in shower was nice. The view of the Golden Gate Bridge out our door was great! The complimentary breakfast included cut up mixed fresh fruit, bagels, croissants, toast, & sweet rolls. Staff was very helpful. Great location.

review.title: Okay but I would go elsewhere for the money
review.reviewText: Good area but is not good for money. The place needs some tiling. It's all cement floors on the outside balconies and floors. Makes the place look like a dive. The room was clean enough, breakfast was nice if you like bagels and pastries and fruit salad. We had no working lights the first night we arrived and one of the light shades kept falling off. The gym didn't have a treadmill either. Otherwise the gym was okay. I think you could get better value elsewhere. It was okay but I wouldn't stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: The revolting cement floors and open balconies onto the rooms. It made it feel grubby and unsafe.
review.locationRemarks: okay. But I think you could get better for your money

review.title: Russian hill convienience, but not much else.
review.reviewText: Certainly an ageing establishment. While the location was beyond perfect for me, there is limited sights or activities for tourists nearby. However a convienient bus nearby will take you to the popular fishermans wharf. The rooms were comfortable, but not really value for money. No fridge means that it's not possible to keep even basic food in the room. Further, the breakfast provided is often over packed and the quality is lacking. If you're looking for a place in Russian Hill, this is perfect. If you're looking for a decent hotel in San Francisco, try something else.
review.positiveRemarks: Location for Russian Hill
review.negativeRemarks: Further away from most tourist spots

review.title: 1st time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall excellent. I would suggest each floor have ice and vending machines.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very nice
review.negativeRemarks: Layout was hard to get around
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to fishermabs wharf and bus route close

review.title: Great Family Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and room was just what I needed for myself and two children, 4 and 7 yrs old. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, the bathroom was functional. The time we spent in our room was minimal. The nice perk to staying here was their heated pool which my boys loved and the complimentay breakfast down stairs in the restaurant. Hotel staff was exetremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is a reasonable walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard street, etc. I also had a rental car for our stay. I found a perfect spot off of Van Ness and Broadway where I could park FREE from after 6PM Friday to 10AM Monday. I would have had to pay $28.50 a night, which I did for our last night there out of convenience for me traveling with two young children, but I did save a lot from parking on the street. Just make sure you READ the signs. Good luck!
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentay breakfast, heated pool, great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was little stuffy a times.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, reasonable walking distance to many areas.

review.title: Good hotel for short breaks
review.reviewText: Great location, added bonus of a heated pool, perfect for a short break. Breakfast room was a bit busy and service a bit slow but overall a great place.
review.positiveRemarks: pool
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast service
review.locationRemarks: fab

review.title: Don't waste your money!
review.reviewText:
There is little to no parking and the referral to the nearest parking garage didn't exist! Finally after another call to the hotel and three trips around the 10 block radius - I ended up 8.5 blocks from the hotel!

Although the rooms have been remodeled - they have obviously disguised a formerly dumpy hotel or dorm unit to a private university. I did not feel safe there and the staff seemed to know that their facility was less than stellar. I was upgraded to a room with a "view" which you could see once you blocked out your view of all the other "motel rooms" on the other floors. I had a two night reservation and left after one night to go to another hotel that was legitimately 4 stars for only a few more dollars.

review.title: Clean but hidden cost and no fridge.
review.reviewText:
THERE IS NO FREE PARKING!!! Even though I called ahead to be sure we would not have to pay for parking it cost us $28 a day. They blamed Expedia. We were not the only ones upset to discover this cost.
The hotel has been refurbished and is very clean, but spartan. There is only one chair in the room. We had to ask for another one so we could watch TV in comfort. There is a desk but not a small table to eat at. We were there 7 days and ate some meals in the room, but it was akward.
My husband is diabetic but there was no fridge for his insulin. We thought about asking for one, but he overheard another person say they had already waited several days and still didn't have one. We kept insulin on ice.
The staff is very friendly and helpful. However 2 days in a row they were cleaning our room when we returned from a day out at 6:00.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No table & chairs, fridge, or microwave in room.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great for using public buses. Close to Fisherman's Warf, we walked there.

review.title: san francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent location excellent service excellent hotel for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: No bath
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for a city break close to everywhere

review.title: Okay place to stay if you're on a budget.
review.reviewText:
Good things about this hotel: good location, near the bay and bus routes, not great but decent free continental breakfast, friendly staff and clean rooms.

Disappointing things about this hotel: no counter space in the bathroom, only mirror is inside the bathroom, thin walls/ceiling, we could hear the person upstairs walking around and neighbors slamming their doors.

review.title: Nice for the price!
review.reviewText: We were really happy with the size and cleanliness of the room. Breakfast was awesome! The only problem we ran into was finding parking. When we arrived it was around 10pm and all of the parking lots were full and they said parking is first come first serve. We were told to park on the street (which was impossible unless we wanting to walk a few blocks with all of our luggage in tow) We were lucky because the security guard was friendly allowed us to park in a non-parking space by the vending machine until his shift was over at 7am - we rushed out to move our car and found a spot about 2 blocks away the next morning. We would stay at this hotel again, but definately not as a late arrival.
review.positiveRemarks: Large rooms, heated pool
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of parking spaces - which is not noted when booking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location from Peir 39 and the Embarcadero - about a 5-8 minute drive

review.title: Recommended if you don't mind waiting & noise
review.reviewText: The hotel seems to be over-booked, since guests must wait for their rooms to be ready. I was not pleased with my original room, and was given another in a not great location. Guests in the adjoining room as well as street noises were easily heard. However,staff was friendly & helpful and the hotel is in a very safe neighborhood for walking at all times to Fisherman's Wharf and is easily accessible to public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: It is readily accessible to public transportation and within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise level was greater than expected.
review.locationRemarks: It is in a very safe neighborhood for walking even alone at night.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel compare to the price. Our room was noisy in the morning since it was facing the street. Clean room and good location.

review.title: da Vinci Villa - June
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a fairly good location, a 15 minute walking distance to Fishermans Wharf. The room was modern and spacious, as was the bathroom. It was noisy at night due to people walking passed the room with suitcases on a concrete floor. Breakfast was included which was nice, however it was very busy and we had to wait to be seated each morning. Parking there was limited and expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was very good and the rooms were clean and modern.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little noisy and parking was expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and handy for transport to Union Square.

review.title: Worth the money!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to everything. We walked to most of the tourist attractions. The rooms were very clean and updated.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and convenience to the local attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the other rooms and the room was small.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to China town, Fisherman's Wharf and great restaurants.

review.title: Good value Hotel
review.reviewText: Da Vinci Villa absolutely suited our stay perfectly - granted it was not 5 star but then we didn't pay 5 star prices either. The Hotel was in a great location and we could walk to any of the attractions from it. Staff were very helpful and rooms were spacious and clean with comfortable mattress making for a decent nights sleep. Breakfast was limited and some days there was nothing on the buffet - just depended when you went but if you waited long enough they would refill. We didnt find this a problem as there was always something just to get you by. I wouldnt hesitate to book this Hotel again should we be lucky enough to visit San Fransisco again.
review.positiveRemarks: Coffee maker in room, ice machine available and very comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was limited - no cereals and lack of organisation in breakfast room with staff.
review.locationRemarks: Location perfect for getting about - hilly depending on which direction you walk but this is San Fransisco!

review.title: Basic hotel
review.reviewText: Noisy and basic, but clean and friendly! Heard it recently got an uplift, so many of the negative comments may be pre uplift.

review.title: Two Night Tourist Stop
review.reviewText: The hotel was within walking distance to the north end of Fisherman's Wharf, the Hyde and Powell Street cable car and the "most crooked" part of Lombard Street. It's along Van Ness Street which is pretty busy most of the day. A safe neighborhood. Nothing particularly special about the room or hotel, but the room (and bathroom) was very clean and comfortable. The shower facet was a bit stingy (very low flow). The continental breakfast was sufficient and the staff was very friendly, but the restaurant service was a bit slow and disorganized. Overall, it was a good value and I'd stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Fisherman's Wharf; comfortable and clean room; friendliness of staff
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking ($28); disorganized restaurant service

review.title: Old but comfortable.
review.reviewText: Old hotel which has recently been renovated.Beautiful new bathrooms!!!Nice pool area.Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf , Cable Car & close to bus stops for Hop on -Hop off Bus.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Just enough- nothing too fancy or drabby
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for three nights. This hotel has done some renovations although they could still do more. The beds are new and very comfortable. We found the room to be just enough- nothing too fancy or drabby. The hotel is in a great location just steps away from the Fisherman's Wharf area. The hotel staff are nice, friendly, and attentive, especially Bernard at Cafe Como, the hotel restaurant.
One negative comment I have is that the rooms are not sound-proof, so that we were able to hear whenever the TV was on in our neighbor's room and when their alarm went off every morning.
Other than that, the hotel was decent. If you're lucky, you can get a room on the top floor with an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, great staff
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are not sound-proof
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard St., Ghirardelli Square

review.title: Very Bad
review.reviewText: This hotel is something else. At check in they charge you and extra 50.00 just in case you take something or break something in your room. I travel a lot and have never had to do this. Parking is a joke. Hotel staff says its first come first serve. That's is cap! Hotel customers should have a spot no matter what. Also at check in the man that helped US was Very Rude! If i would have had more time with my personal matter, i would have left and found another hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very dirty!!

review.title: San Fran is Amazing, this Hotel is ok.
review.reviewText:
The hotel looked Luke it was going to be super nice from the lobby. rooms were average. I felt like I was in nicer motel. hallways were difficult to get around. Restaurant was really good although the continental breakfast was a joke. not even cereal.

overall was a ok hotel. expected a little more for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant makes good food.
review.negativeRemarks: Difficult to get around and parking. $25 a night and not even a guaranteed spot.
review.locationRemarks: Location is central. good location but nothing great in walking distance.

review.title: Old Motel Made New
review.reviewText:
This hotel has no air conditioning, so if you plan to go when the weather is warm, you may want to consider staying somewhere else.
If they offer the room with a view, only take it if it is cold outside and you are hard of hearing. Although the view was nice the noise is deafening from the street below. You won't sleep a wink.
The location was very handy for tourist activities and the pool was nice, clean and great chairs.
The restaurant...go somewhere else. The free breakfast...I think you will enjoy it more if you spend a few dollars at the pastry shop a block away.
review.positiveRemarks:
Close to activities
Nice shower products
review.negativeRemarks:
No Air Conditioning
Noise
Slow Elevator
review.locationRemarks: Just a few blocks from the action

review.title: Pros and Cons
review.reviewText:
Positives: Location was central to most tourist destinations.

Negatives: 1) Upkeep of facilities not very good e.g Arrived to find room safe and telephone not working properly and the lift was extremely slow (we ended up walking the 5 floors to our room. 2) We arrived back to our room at 5pm one afternoon to freshen up and get ready to go out for the evening, and we found our room had still not been made up for the day.
3) The continental breakfast consisted of either toast or extremely sweet pastries.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Service and upkeep

review.title: da Vinci
review.reviewText: Walls were very thin. Nearby Polk Street neighborhood is great for restauraunts, bars, etc

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: The staff were nice and the rooms are good. The location is not to bad as the public transport system is very good. The lifts are very slow and the breakfast cafe is too small and the food was average and little of it. I could here the people in the room above me.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was good and the staff were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The Lift, breakfast and acoustics of the room.
review.locationRemarks: The location is ok - as the public transport is good

review.title: Davinci would be disappointed!
review.reviewText:
We will start with positives: very convenient to many SF attractions including fishermans
wharf, (5 blocks) only 2 blocks from the infamous Lombard, loved the shampoo, conditioner, and bath gel dispenser in shower, lots of storage in the room, nice blow dryer provided, clean and comfy beds, nice tv, great view of the bridge (we stayed on 4th floor) facing side street (filbert), beautiful pool furniture, decent breakfast which consisted of bagels, honey dew melon, bread with toasters , nice living room and business center on 1st floor

Negatives: noisy!!! Walls are thin as well as ceiling! Heard more than I cared to hear both nights, heard a man on street yelling for help in the middle of the night, very confusing layout, slow elevators sometimes not working, 28 dollar parking per day
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Acoustics
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Hotel with free leg workout!
review.reviewText: Be prepared to walk 7 blocks from the nearest parking to your hotel room. Also there was no working elevator so we got to drag all our luggage up 3 flights of stairs. No counters in the bathroom sucked. The breakfast was a joke, although the restaurant was delicious for dinner. This hotel is cheap for a reason! But be prepared to pay a $250 incidental coverage before you can check in, which took over a week to be returned!
review.positiveRemarks: Can walk to Fishermans warf and. Close to trolleys as well
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms, no parking, no elevator, no countertop space in bathroom, terrible lighting in room and view of neighbors parking.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Good experience. Hotel was clean. A little old, but overall had a good experience in a good location.

review.title: First time in SF
review.reviewText:
We got to the hotel to do a late check in and found two Italian couples arguing over rooms with the check in agent. They were very upset that even though they thought they had two rooms, only one was reserved. The agent got them the second room, but this caused a considerable waiting time on the rest of us. Only one person checking in people. The day of the checkout had two persons manning the post. During my checkout I was being charged for parking when I hadn't even asked for it. I didn't rent a car and after checking their parking log, they removed the charge, which was about 80 dollars for 3 nights.
The room was large for two persons, but the restroom was small. They also have a policy of not throwing paper waste in the toilet, making the trash can a priority to clean every day.Fortunately they were very good with removing trash every day. The shower was cold and we had to wait outside for it to warm up. We did not use the pool as it was cold, even in June. The restaurant offered breakfast every morning which we only went once, as it is only fruits and bread. My wife ended up ordering eggs, which was a very large plate for 10 dollars.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: A hassle to check in and checkout
review.locationRemarks: Very good place to stay if you're walking San Fransisco

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: great place to stay. walking distance to fisherman's wharf and union street

review.title: Good option in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Positive: Great location, 15-20 minutes walk to Fisherman Wharf. To go to Golden Gate bridge you need to walk 5 minutes to take a bus. There are good restaurants and coffees in the hotel area (5-10 min walk). The room was clean, warm and good size. Good cost/benefit
Negative: The wi-fi was not working proporly during the whole stay. The continental breakfast is served until 10 AM but if you arrive after 9 AM maybe couldn't find anything to eat.

review.title: About the da Vinci Villa
review.reviewText: Very much enjoyed our stay and location at da Vinci Villa, and with the price through expedia, it was a bargin for downtown san Fran. The breakfast was muffins/bagels/coffee/juice, but one could order off the menue. The breakfast was a good start till you got out and about. Most likely will return if it works out.

review.title: Great Location, but Noisy
review.reviewText:
I had a deluxe king room for myself and my boyfriend, and the room was fantastic. Spacious, super comfortable bed, great bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was average, simply an offering of fruit, bakery items, bagels, and bread for toasting. Waitstaff seemed constantly behind and overwhelmed. The hotel has a GREAT location, easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy and Chinatown, and right on the bus lines to basically everywhere else.

The huge drawback is the noise. A room facing out picks up every noise from the street, and a room facing in picks up all the noise from the pool. Every room hears every movement made by the person above. If you are a light sleeper, this may not be the place for you. I was lucky in that most people tended to be going to sleep before I was, so I managed to be alright, but when people are all up hours before you would like to be up, it's not so great.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Comfort of Room
review.negativeRemarks: NOISE

review.title: Very Dissapointing
review.reviewText: Very dissapointing, it is definitley not 'upscale' or 'boutique' as it was described. Very much like a old motel. Very noisy location too!

review.title: Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that it didn't have any available parking, and the parking on the streets was extremely expensive. Another thing was that my room was so unconfortable due to the fact that it was too close to the elevator, and we could hear all the noises from the people getting out it.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: Didn't have a problem with this hotel. Asked for a fridge, and they gave me a minifridge. The room was clean. Really only downfall was no A/C, but you could open a window pretty easy.

review.title: Little San Francisco Pocket
review.reviewText: It's not really in the hub of things but San Francisco is so accessible it was no issue at all. The rooms are quite roomy but i don't understand why Americans do not put kettles or fridges in their rooms. We had great views of the Golden Gate which was a bonus for us. If it was warmer the pool area was sensational. The continental breakfast was fine but would of liked some cereal rather than just pastries.
review.positiveRemarks: The views
review.negativeRemarks: Room didn't get cleaned for 2 days
review.locationRemarks: Location wasn't very central but it was easily accessible by cab or bus

review.title: Had a good time at da Vinci Villa.
review.reviewText: This hotel turned out to be what I had expected: A fairly economical place to stay in a decent location. The room was smallish, but clean and the beds were comfy. The bathroom had been modernized and, more importantly, was clean. The restaraunt was nothing special, but there are plenty of others good ones located near by. The location was only a few blocks from Aquatic Park and Ghiradelli Square with good public transportation near by. All in all, if you are staying in the city to sight see and need a hotel room just to hang your hat, then da Vinci Villa is the place for you.

review.title: stay here!
review.reviewText: The hotel room is small, nothing like other hotels in America, however for the price and location, it was great. This hotel was a short walk to Fisherman's Warf, Gheridelli, and 2-3 blocks away from the best restaurant I have ever been to (The house of prime rib). The staff were amazing and the receptionist was so helpful with helping us find our way around and finding restaurants. Stay here!
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: will not recommend
review.reviewText: Location is OK. Not too far from touristic trails, restaurants and grocery stores nearby. Cleaneness and the bed are OK. Didn't check the pool. Horrible parking situation - even if you pay for parking it doesn't guarantee you a parking space. O'k they say you won't pay for the day when you didn't find parking, but it doesn't make your stay more comfortable because overall situation in SF with parking is not good at all. It's ok Mo to Th, but Fr-Sa is tough. So you pay about $30/day for unguarranteed and unguarded parking lot. The elevator doesn't work at night. And this is not for safety reason, because staircase near it is open, accessible from the street and unguarded 24 hours. No facilities near the sink in the bathroom to put cosmetics and other stuff on. Shelves in the room are uncomfortable too. Wi-Fi is complementary, but it worked for 1 day. Next day we had to call to IT support to make it work - they have to help you to connect each device separately, not like your laptop, iphone and ipad will be automatically connected once you're given the passcode! You have to be cautious about bathroom curtain because "shower tube" wall is about 1 inch tall and curtain easily gets out and water spills on the floor. Complimentary breakfast is the joke, we didn't go there after second day. There is almost nothing to eat and you cannot help yourself with coffee, need to wait for help. Overall - it wasn't too bad, but I wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: Great Place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was well located, being close to the Wharf and easy driving distance to everything else. The hotel was very clean, a little bit unusual floor plan, but managible. The rooms were large and clean. The only thing missing was an extra mirror outside the bathroom, so one person could be in the bathroom and one out still getting ready for the day. Continental Breakfast provided was good and adequate, which was included in the room cost.
review.negativeRemarks: No extra mirror outside the bathroom. No room darkening shades.
review.locationRemarks: good location for the price. Easy access to the Wharf and other attractions.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText:
average size room, confortable, clean
rooms facing Van Ness Ave with view of Golden Gate Bridge (but noise due traffic)
decent breakfast

review.title: Be picky about room location
review.reviewText: My bf and I were in sf on Tuesday. Hotel was very clean and in a good location (close to restaurants, bars, shops) with nice views from top (fifth) floor. Down side, we didn't sleep at all! We stayed in a room on the top floor facing the side street, which was not a busy street but we could hear every car that drove by, people walking and talking from across the street, even the birds buzzing by...as if our bed was outside on the street! It was awful. We paid for parking $26 a day (I would try to find street parking). We told the front desk about how dreadfully loud it was and all we got was a "thanks for letting us know". If you stay there, make sure you don't get a room facing any of the two streets. You only get a nice view from a few of the rooms on the top floor anyway.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to restaurants, bars and shops

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
- Excellent staff
- Nice room
- Large workout room / great sauna
- Nice outdoor pool
- Perfect location
- Beware that parking is $25 a night
- Comp breakfast....VERY basic
review.positiveRemarks: Location!!!
review.negativeRemarks: $25 per night parking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, close to Lombard & Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: not bad, but not great.
review.reviewText: The staff were very nice and helpful. Our room was nice enough, comfy bed, but no AC. The free breakfast wasn't much to talk about. Some of the rooms are used as dorm rooms which was weird. The location wasn't too bad though. The street noise was a bit loud, especially in the morning.

review.title: Da Vinci Villa - Review of hotel
review.reviewText:
We decided upon the Da Vinci Villa because of its location and the deal we received for the stay. It's very convenient for those who choose not to rent a car because as everyone knows, SF is not car-friendly. Most of the public transportation stops within a few blocks from the hotel and your walk is downhill so, that's always a positive. You aren't too far from Fisherman's Wharf and Fort Mason which has views of the Golden Gate on a clear day. Lombard St. is a few blocks down but, be forewarned that its all uphill.

Anyway, we were greeted by Tony, an affable concierge, upon check-in. He was super friendly and was always ready to help with any inane touristy questions we had. We were also given complimentary continental breakfasts which, aren't much. Basically, you get fruit, muffins, sweet rolls, coffee cake, toast (toaster only toasts on one side!) and choice of beverage. If you eat like a bird, then you're sorted. If not, you can order off the menu but, I honestly didn't think the food was that great. There are plenty of quality restaurants around the corner that will delight your palette much more than this place. *coughLaBoulangecough*

Rooms are clean and spacious with super comfy beds. I wasn't expecting the Ritz and it exceeded my expectations. They had a cool Ipod/radio player and flat-screen t.v. Bathrooms are small but, clean which, is important to me. I would stay again especially now that I'm familiar with the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, spacious room, Ipod/radio player, fan with remote control, comfy bed and close to local attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast is fairly sparse. They need to add a few rashers (bacon) or cereal to fill the void of the selection.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location and loved our view. Public transport is close by and the trolley stops a few blocks up. Good eateries two blocks up: La Boulange!

review.title: It's not 3 and a half stars (
review.reviewText: Staff were nice, but I have no idea how did they get 3.5 stars. Old rooms, and hot water got turned of when I stayed up there. For this price it possible to get a better hotel.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed for 3 days and I wasn't expecting much since we got such a great deal online for our stay.
PROS:
The beds were GREAT. Seriously comfortable. The continental breakfast was the best. It's in the restaurant downstairs and there are lots of fruits and baked goods and toasted things and such. The pool area is pretty and nice. Internet access wireless worked good in the room. No bathtub but a really nice shower and bathroom.
CONS:
No airconditioning in the room. We were there in April so no big deal, but it could be a problem in the hot hot days. The decor of the hotel itself is kind of weird with the open air access. Wasn't a problem for us, just a strange new experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast and the bed were our favorites.
review.negativeRemarks: Decore of the hallways. Rooms were nicely decorated though. No airconditioning in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to a lot of things.

review.title: Clean, comfortable for a single traveller.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable for a single traveller. Good location for Fishermans Wharf, Russian Hill etc. Food a bit uninspiring. Staff very helpful.

review.title: Restaurant was awful
review.reviewText: The Hotel Restaurant was an embarrassment. 1st day breakfast there was no Orange Juice which was not so bad;2nd day Bagels but no cream cheese;3rd Day dinner - no Fish, chicken or beef so basically almost nothing on the menu - after that I gave up on it even although was a free buffet breakfast I ate elsewhere

review.title: Almost perfect for the price...
review.reviewText: This hotel has a lot of potential and I'm sure there are nicer rooms available but the main reason I can't give them more than 2 for room comfort is the lack of air condition. Luckily the night's cool off enough to be comfortable with the window open but during the day the ceiling fan just isn't enough. Also since the room get's really hot during the day it magnifies the humid old carpet odor. The bedding and bathroom were always kept very clean though so I can't complain too much. It's not terrible but I have to be honest. On the bright side this hotel is in an excellent location. It's away from the noisy busy area but close enough to walk everywhere. Polk street is right behind the hotel and has a very soho-like feel to it (more laid back though). Fisherman's Wharf is about 5 minutes north of the hotel and union square is about 15 minutes. We only took the bus once to get to the mission district ($2 and 15 min ride). The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful when asking for restaurant suggestions or directions. In closing, I think for the price it's worth it to be in this location but if they had new carpets and air condition it would perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: There was always refreshing citrus water in the lobby, which is the theme in their bathroom soaps and shampoos. It was a really nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: No air condition in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you're willing to walk. It's not in the heart of downtown but it's close enough to everything.

review.title: MelK
review.reviewText: The room was extremely clean. The front desk was very helpful and willing to help my friend and I who were new to the city. It is in a great location, walking distance to the wharf, and only a block away from happening bars. The only downside to the place is that the rooms have no air, which we were completely unaware of. The room stayed extremely hot, and the windows could not be opened. I would stay again, cannot beat the price.

review.title: Getaway at da vinci hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel room was very spacious and clean, however needs more lighting, far to dark.
Also needs a long mirror and maybe cupboards and drawers were a bit on the dark side.
Overall the room needs to be just that little bit brighter,. Corridoors were far to cold, considering it wasn't hot weather, the air conditioners needed to be a little lower.

The buffet breakfast I must admit was not very pleasing, needs to have a bit more savoury foods, far to much sugary products, was not to my taste, the variety needs to be changed.

However beautiful lobby, fantastic service, nicest staff and so very very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The Lobby
review.negativeRemarks: The darkness of the room and the breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Great location within walking distance

review.title: Beware of wet carpets and ignored booking requests
review.reviewText: The carpet was wet next to the bed and by the heater/air conditioner. I left a very lightweight item in my room. When I phoned the next night after my check-out the person who took the call confirmed that my item was in lost and found, but instead of taking my information he told me to call back when the housekeeping supervisor was working. They will only return it if I am willing to pay the more expensive flat rate box rate---for their convenience. My family stayed two nights in two rooms and I feel like we deserved better service. Additionally, although I had requested a room with two queen size beds (6 weeks in advance) I was given a room with a king. I had to rant and rave to get two beds.
review.positiveRemarks: The continental breakfast in the Italian restaurant was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of piers.

review.title: Not as per expectations.
review.reviewText: This is not per the reviews on the website. It is not near the Fisherman's Wharf and we cannot see the Golden Gate Bridge. Totally misleading information.

review.title: Yes, would stay again.
review.reviewText:
Stayed 3 nights with reservation for 2 queen beds. Checked in and room had one king size bed. Room on the 5th floor facing Filbert street. Room was a little small but cozy and comfortable. It was nice being on the 5th floor so the only noise we heard was the street and since it wasn't Van Ness St it wasn't as busy. Also, we could open the window for fresh air. Since we reserved 2 beds, the hotel was booked the first night so they moved us the second night to a jr suite while we were out and about. Be careful what you wish for (lol). The room was so big I don't think they know what to do with the extra space. However, it was on the 3rd floor facing the pool. Couldn't open the windows for air and our above neighbors we think we're actually doing cart wheels, little loud due to the thin walls. Continental breakfast was good. Its located in the cafe downstairs. Staff is attentive and friendly all around. Its basic bagels, muffins, bread and fruit. Great way to start your morning.
Couple of corks - bathroom in either room is very small, no place to set personal items down. No light in the closets so its hard to see even during the day due to the modern lighting in the room. Hotel has 2 elevators that get you to different floors of the building.
Parking you will pay for, however at $25pp we checked around and it was a better deal than most hotels. Pay for the parking and leave the car in their gated area. Take a cab or mass transit. Parking can really add up around the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds and sheets! Staff very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Good location on Van Ness. Once we figured out the mass transit, it was easy to get around. We used the bus, cable car, electric car and taxi.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: The pool was adorable. Bed was very comfy, the pillows were AMAZING. Our room was very clean, we heard no noise from the street and were in walking distance of some great restaurants and things to do. Parking was easy and pretty good price compared to the other parking lots we parked in in SF! The hotel staff was very friendly and the food at the restaurant had great food (but the free breakfast was kind of lame!)
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort, cleanliness, nice staff, restaurant had great food!
review.negativeRemarks: The free continental breakfast left much to be desired but hey, it's free.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good. You must try Leopold's for dinner and beer! It was delicious German food - we walked there in like 5 minutes from our room!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I was extremely happy to find a great deal on Expedia during in San Fran. When I arrived, I received an upgrade to my room. They gave me a villa located on the 5th floor. But to my disappointment, my 3rd guest had to sleep on an extremely hard sofabed, there was not heat, the bathroom door refuses to close, the shower leaked water and the light system was not manageable. It kept turning off and on in the bedroom and common room. There was not enough lighting in both rooms either. The only thing I really enjoyed was the view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the conditioner in the shower. I read comments that renovations were completed for the hotel earlier this year. I would hate to imagine what other issues there were before renovations.

review.title: Thin walls
review.reviewText: True what has been said. Location is fine, property ok. Thinness of walls, terrible.

review.title: Davinci
review.reviewText:
Nice clean hotel, central to most animates
Friendly staff fast wifi good breakfast would consider staying
Again
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText:
We loved the Female staff up front. She was very helpful and courteous. Our room was spacious and comfortable. HOWEVER......we literally got NO REST AT NIGHT. There was so much noise and ruckus from the employees moving who knows what....up and down the halls. Bumping and door's slamming all night long. I called the front desk to ask them to check on it and aparently the noise were employees working....with no regard to the hotel guests.
The free breakfast was a joke. The restaurant staff were rude. It might as well have been self serve. It probably would have been a better experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The Roomy Family Suite
review.negativeRemarks: The Noisy and disrespectful staff
review.locationRemarks: Not close enough to the Pier

review.title: da Vinci
review.reviewText:
Not sure why this hotel has poor ratings, probably just from people who like nothing more than to moan about things!

The hotel has clearly been going through a major refit/upgrade as other have said so therefore everything is brand new including bathroom and nicely decorated so no complaints there at all. Only one main fault.....there was no mirror in the room, just the bathroom mirror so a slight pain when two people are trying to make themselves look presentable and as tho they hadn't been climbing San Francisco's hills all day, maybe it is a common thing or maybe just our particular room.

All staff were always very friendly and helpful.

As for the hotels location, we spent a week there and although it is a 15 min walk from the main area of Fishermans Wharf we soon realised that this was a benefit rather than a drawback. If you want commercialised mass produced food etc then yes Fishermans Wharf is right there but the Da Vinci Villas are one block down from Polk Street which has some nice trendy and far better restaurants and bars and right opposite is Union Street which has more bars, nice restaurants and shops, although the shops are a little 'high end'.

After spending a week touring the whole of the 'downtown' area i can't think of a better location to have been.

Breakfast being included in the price is also a bonus, the continental self serve was fine, always a good selection too, but they could do with a new faster and bigger toaster, so timing is everything!
review.positiveRemarks: "newness"
review.locationRemarks: perfect, you can easily get to 3 different areas within minutes.

review.title: Expensive parking fee
review.reviewText:
Very expensive comparing the quality of Hotel
Breakfast is just bread and coffee, more charge to eat egg and ham
25 dollar parking fee per one night, it is crazy

review.title: Surprisingly nice hotel for a good price
review.reviewText: The room and view were breathtaking. We had a balcony with a fire pit and chairs that had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. The only downside was that the tv didn't work. That was a bit of a bummer but the upgrade to the suite made it worth it. The location was great too. It was a 3 block walk to Lombard's crooked street. The walk to the wharf was very pleasant and gave us the chance to get a feel for the town.
review.positiveRemarks: The view and decor
review.negativeRemarks: Broken television
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you want to be close to the tourist areas but want a better feel for the city

review.title: What a great motel!!
review.reviewText: Room was small but great. Hotel was a little weird to get around in and elevator was slow, but the stairs were not hard to take. Breakfast was good, hotel staff was super helpful and friendly. It was only about 6 blocks from the Warf and not up hill, deffinatly a plus. Oh ya.. the pool was outside but super warm so even on a cool day it was usable. We would love to stay there again. Did I mention the view it was magical.
review.positiveRemarks: The location
review.negativeRemarks: The slow elevator
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to the Warf!!!!

review.title: Great location and price but thin walls.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great, just about a 10 minute walk to Fisherman's Warf and it is convenient to two major Muni lines. The room was sparse but I expected that from earlier reviews. The staff was very helpful for the most part. Major complaints: we shared a door with the room to the back of ours and could hear EVERY WORD the other guests were saying. They were very loud and talking on the phone and we had to complain several times. Also, the television channels weren't functioning properly and after several complaints and requests to have the TV reset by the staff and never getting our request fulfilled, we gave up. Finally, the breakfast was simply fruit and pastries and most of the pastries were stale. Good effort but they need a little refinement.
review.positiveRemarks: Great pool area and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, small rooms, not so great breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union and Van Ness next to two major Muni lines.

review.title: No sleep hotel...
review.reviewText: It seems that a third to half of this hotel was students from local colleges living there. This should have been explained ahead of time!!!!!!!!!!! Very, very loud at night - paper thin walls and loud music. Forget about sleeping here!
review.positiveRemarks: Employees at the desk were helpful and courteous, nice bed
review.negativeRemarks: Live in students, very loud at night, paper thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great!

review.title: The place to stay to get the SF feel.
review.reviewText:
Great time. Wonderful location. Will stay there when we return for our future visits. Staff was
nice and very helpful.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for 8 nights in March 2012. Great location; excellent, easy access to Fisherman's Wharf, Cable Car, and bus lines. Complimentary continental breakfast was very good: cereal, breads, muffins, croissants, scones, bagels and lots of fresh fruit. Coffee was plentiful and strong; juices were available; eggs, etc. were offered at an additional cost. Dinner at the restaurant was reasonable and delicious (try the caprese salad mozzerella!) All staff members were helpful and friendly.
Room had a very comfortable bed and pillows and a very large shower (no tub). Lots of storage and complimentary in room wifi. Downsides to room: only one mirror, in bathroom over sink (could use a full length mirror near wardrobe); no vanity around sink for make up, toothpaste, etc; some noise is evident from room upstairs and when others talking in hallway.
Overall, however, this was a wonderful stay for us and we recommend it wholeheartedly to visitors to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Staff. Breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Not in Downtown, but at the bottom of Russian Hill. Bus lines on Van Ness run frequently. Walk down hill to cable car and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: The hotel is located outside of the Wharf area. However it only was a 15 min walk to get to the wharf area and the hotel cost was a little cheaper because of this. The rooms were clean and the beds were extremely comfy. The breakfeast consisted of pasteries, bread, bagels and fruit. It would have been nice to have a few different choices. I would definately recommend this hotel to others and we will stay here again when we visit in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: the beds
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast could have had a few additional choices
review.locationRemarks: approx. 15 min walk from Fishermans wharf. Close enough to walk

review.title: family trip
review.reviewText: the hotel staff was super friendly we asked for extra towles and they asked no questions and they rushed right up to deliver them.. the pool was warm and refreshing after a long day. we had a corner room with lots of room and a great view of the golden gate bridge.
review.positiveRemarks: the bed and the fluffy pillows and the bed was so comphy
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast . our family thought there could have been more of a varity other then fruit and toast.
review.locationRemarks: loved it not to far to drive to the warf but definatly a long walk

review.title: Two days in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel to stay in San Francisco and we had a great stay for two days at this hotel. This hotel is just recently renovated and therefore is very clean. The parking charges ($25 per day) are reasonably cheaper than other big hotels in San Frencisco. If you stay on the top floors (4th or 5th), there will be no noise disturbance in the middle of night. The public transportation is at the door and there are good restaurants in Marina (walkable 20 minutes). There was a complimentary breakfast at the restaurant in this hotel. Very limited items, but not bad. We took a tour of San Francisco after purchasing online tickets for City by the Bay Tours (a $220 value for only $90 through Groupon). Our stay was nice during rare sunny and warm days in San Francisco. Would like to visit SF again an stay at this hotel.

review.title: Fullfilled our basic needs
review.reviewText:
By request, our room in the back was well buffered from the street noise of VanNess St.. The rooms are very dark even with the blinds open. Timer on bathroom turned off lights after 2 minutes. Not long enough to have a shower without being in the dark. You'll need a shower buddy to keep the lights on.
Breakfast was a simple continental breakfast in the attached restuarant.
Good location on the MUNI bus system and just a downhill walk form the cable car line.
Strongly recommend buying the multiday MUNI pass for the buses, streetcars & cable cars.
review.positiveRemarks:
large room
Great view of Golden Gate Bridge from walkway in front of room
review.negativeRemarks:
dark room, with bathroom lights on 2 min timer.
Required 2 elevators and a walk to get to room on hillside.
review.locationRemarks: On easy bus route to anywhere in city, including the waterfront, Chinatown, Union Square.

review.title: Would Recommend To Any/All and Would Stay Again
review.reviewText:
Not the fanciest hotel, but for the price, you can't beat the location, the service, or the quality. The staff was helpful, the continental breakfast was better than expected, and the view of the Golden Gate Bridge was a great perk. The only complaint would be the slow elevator, but given the age of the building, it wasn't a complete surprise nor was it a dealbreaker. It was too chilly to enjoy the pool, but it looked clean and inviting.

The Fisherman's Wharf is a just a few (flat) blocks away and the proximity to Polk St. (various dining) and Union Street (boutique shopping and dining) was great. And if you can handle a short uphill climb, you are just a few blocks from "the crookedest street" on Lombard.

We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable (safe) location, the comfort of the room, and the updated features.
review.negativeRemarks: The slow elevator. :) Seriously wasn't a big deal, but it's the only thing I can think of that was "unpleasant".
review.locationRemarks: Location was great; proximity to diverse food options, boutique shopping, and Fisherman's Wharf were what made it for us. The area felt safe.

review.title: Good stay here!
review.reviewText:
This was a good hotel for a great price. It's location:
It is located in the Russian hill area, walking distance to fisherman's wharf while also being walking distance to Union square (if you don't mind walking a mile or two. We didn't.) It is also right on public transportation (bus). It has an awesome view of the water and Golden Gate bridge, if you ask for one of the bridge view rooms. It has some bars and a few restaurants very close by.
The hotel room/hotel itself:
The hotel room was OK. However, I can not complain since I paid such a low price. It is simple, a little small but comfortable. Not luxurious, but you shouldn't expect that for what you are paying. The bed was comfortable. One big negative: the walls were very thin! We could hear the people in the room next to us/music late at night and in the morning. This was my one and only complaint while staying here. The noise from the street did not bother us at all, just the people next door.
Another positive about this hotel: the complimentary breakfast! I love when hotels have free breakfast. It consisted of good bagels, pastries, and fruit. The coffee was not good. But, otherwise, a great breakfast.
The hotel staff was also very nice and helpful. Overall good stay!

review.title: Clean but Noisy
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very clean and well kept, and the staff was professional and courteous; however, noise traveled through everything. The beds are situated in the front of the rooms with the bathrooms in back. Most doors face outside and were not well sealed, so sound traveled right through them.

It also seemed that part of the hotel served as a dormitory since we saw several rooms with bunk beds and many college age kids around along with notices on some of the rooms for mandatory inspections.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent locations near Ghirardelli Square

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: The location was good. Parking reasonable for SF. Easy access to public transportation. Staff was very nice and helpful.

review.title: Would book again
review.reviewText:
Once you enter staff are extremely welcoming, helpful & willing to assist you with just about everything. Ask for coupons if you are doing any tourist activities at the front desk.

Rooms are newly renovated, very clean and maintained.
Great facilities included - free wifi in rooms, business centre, gym, pool.
We had complimentary continental breakfast which we redeemed once & then never again.

Remember to ask for a room not opposite the lift as it can get quite noisey at night.

Overall I would book this hotel again.
Very clean, walking distance from most sites & great staff attention!
review.positiveRemarks: Exceptional staff ready to assist
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are a bit thin, so if you're staying next to noisey people - not so good
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location - walking distance to fishermans wharf, crooked street, chinatown. Easy public transport too & cheap

review.title: ill return
review.reviewText: nice hotel for good money. good location, close to all place of interest

review.title: Da Vinci Villa Hotel SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice. On the downside, the rooms closer to the elevator are quite noisy and the rooms against the elevator shake.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was excellent, right in the center between the Wharf and Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise in the rooms from the elevator. Also the walls were quite thin.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent locatation. In the heart of the main disctricts.

review.title: Clean, but not up to our standards
review.reviewText: The windows in the room were filthy and you couldn't open the bathroom door all the way as it bumped into the bed. There was no place to put your tolietries in the bathroom. You could also hear every step the person upstairs took. There was no ice machine on the second or third floor, the maid had to go find ice for us.
review.positiveRemarks: The comforter was great
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the room above
review.locationRemarks: The staff at the hotel told us it was 5 blocks from fisherman's wharf - that was not true, it was more like a mile.

review.title: great location, clean hotel
review.reviewText: Clean and newly remodelled hotel with great location. Close to Russian Hill and the entertainment areas of the city. The location is really amazing. Tough for parking if with a car. Downside is the noise and the extremely slow internet. Otherwise I would definitley recommend the place.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: slow internet
review.locationRemarks: close to entertainment and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Could Not Ask For Better
review.reviewText: We will book there again. Great location, good view of the Golden Gate from the 5th floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to great shopping. Located in "safe" part of town.

review.title: A nice play to stay
review.reviewText:
The rooms were very well maintained and clean. Comfortable bed and pillows. Getting around was a bit difficult because not every elevator went to every floor. I had a 5th floor room with outside access.and the view of the Golden Gate bridge was lovely.
There was an on-site restaurant where I had dinner and enjoyed a decent Continental breakfast. Dinner was reasonably priced and delicious.
Just be aware there is a $25 cost for parking which was difficult to locate.
I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Down comfoters and pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: Logistically difficult to get around. Night staff had a hard time finding my reservation.
review.locationRemarks: On a very busy street. Seemd like a safe area.

review.title: the room is extra large than my expect
review.reviewText: The space of the room is extra large than my expect! The comfort are very nice!
review.positiveRemarks: space,comfort.
review.locationRemarks: very convenience for public transportation and walking to the sea.

review.title: Never even checked in
review.reviewText: Can't really recommend this hotel since I never got to actually stay in it. My flight was cancelled due to bad weather conditions in san francisco and the hotel only refunded me a small portion of my payment, I understand they have cancellation policies but I could not have foreseen bad weather and a flight cancellation.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price. We got a great deal on an expedia 24hr sale. Well worth it. Only minor complaint was there was no bathtub, shower only.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location; friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: room only had a shower, no bath

review.title: Place to stay in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Nice location good price. Decent size of the room. Be aware a separate charge for parking $25 per day + tax.
Overall it is a nice place to stay in SF
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Charge. It should be part of price.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find, Close to Lombard street, Golden Gate, South Sallito.

review.title: Great Place to stay!
review.reviewText: I read some horror stories on yelp about this hotel and I must say that they were all WRONG. Granted, this is not the Ritz however; I thought the hotel looked very nice, the beds were very comfortable and the staff was was top notch. Anytime we needed a thing, it was taken care of asap. I would recommended this hotel to anyone!

review.title: Can't go wrong here.
review.reviewText:
Clean, affordable considering the location. Our room had a superb view of the Golden
Gate, Marina district. Clean, wonder bathroom, complimentary bath robes. I'll stay there again.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Beds were comfortable, bathrooms are incredible!! Loved the tall shower heads. Parking sucks you have to pay extra. The staff was very nice and helpful. I can't give a great review for the upkeep and condition of the hotel because they were doing some remodeling. Overall I'd say it was a pretty easy comfortable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for visiting the wharf only 4 blocks away

review.title: I recommend DaVinci Hotel.
review.reviewText: Given that this hotel is in renovation, I would say it was excellent. I didn't use their parking facilities, I parked in the area which saved me a lot of money. Maybe the staff can give directions as to where to park and avoid paying the fee. The complimentary breakfast was good. I can't wait to return and use the swimming pool. Good work Da Vinci!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean hotel Room.
review.locationRemarks: Located near Marina district, Lombard street, and Greenwich; three cool places to visit. Close to public transportation.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Just OK. On the positive side the room had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and walking distance from some fun parts of town, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. On the negative side, the room smelled of stale smoke, road traffic on Van Ness makes a ton of noise, the fan remote was practically falling off the wall , the furnishings are cheap and the bathroom is small. All in all it was OK for the price and defintely gets the job done but to luxury by any stretch
review.positiveRemarks: The great view of the Golden Gate
review.negativeRemarks: The smell of stale smoke
review.locationRemarks: Just OK

review.title: Classy place
review.reviewText: The building is older but the rooms are nicely redone- very roomy and comfortable. The only problem was the bathroom light which was on a time and would go off in the middle of a shower. I discovered it was on a motion sensor so just wave your hand and it goes back on. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Very good continental breakfast included at the restaurant next door. They quoted me a price of $20/day for parking and then told me it was $25 when I got there but quickly reduced it to $20 when I produced the quote. Location is excellent- only 6 blocks from the marina area just a short walk from Fisherman's wharf. They also let us into the room 2 hours early.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable big room
review.negativeRemarks: expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: The only reason I have the condition a 3 was because when I was there they were working on the elevator, so we had to take a back elevator which was a hassle to get to. But the staff were very nice, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was great, Lombard street was one block over, the ocean front and wharf near. I would stay here again the next time I am in the city.

review.title: san fran in January 2012
review.reviewText: The rooms are nicely furnished and CLEAN. The rooms are small. The bathrooms even smaller. The beds, bedding, and towels are superb. However, the rooms have thin walls and we could hear the people above us walking around and their conversations.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, small rooms

review.title: friendly
review.reviewText: Great location and family freindly. Clean rooms great service, Iwould recommend to any families with kids.

review.title: Functionally basic
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel because of a special rate through Expedia. It's located within walking distance of all of the tourist attractions: Fishermans' wharf, Lombard Street, China Town, etc. The hotel itself is functionally basic. The main lobby, restaurants and rooms appear to be recently remodeled/ painted and are quite pleasant although the hotel itself is somewhat worn. The rooms are small but cute and nicely decorated. The most disspointing part of my stay is that walls are thin and sound from the streets and room next door carried through. At free continental breakfast is included. The price was right for this visit but I'm not sure if it's worth the full price.
review.positiveRemarks: close to Fisherman's wharf and other tourist places
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls with noise carrying through from other rooms and street noice.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Great,little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: I was a little nervous having read the less than positive reviews. However the renovations are complete and this hotel offers most things you need at a very good price. I had a large room with a very comfortable bed and excellent bathroom. It is in a great location, perfect for the short term visitor being a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars etc. Staff are helpful and friendly. It might get a bit noisy in peak season but that is balanced by the quality of what they are trying to do.

review.title: hotel review Jan 2012
review.reviewText: Front desk people were very great, very helpful and pleasant. Cleaning people were very efficient, maybe too efficient, as one threw away a sturdy plastic coffee cup I had bought and was using. Other than that, very nice. Location was in good proximity to the bay and the wharf and good food and Ghiradelli's and great strolls and cool architecture and local shops. I'd return to stay there.

review.title: Perfect!!
review.reviewText: I will definitely recommend this hotel!! Everything is perfect for travelers.

review.title: The Da Vinchi - San Francisco
review.reviewText: They were under construction and remodeling - the room was very pleasing - It did not get cleaned one day ( ooops) but the personnel were very nice - Upset we had to pay an xtra $20 a day for parking - you should have warned us or made it "part of the deal"
review.negativeRemarks: No maid service on day of the three

review.title: Overnight in SF.
review.reviewText: Nice price and nice hotel. Everything looked like it had been newly remodeled. Good location.

review.title: Enjoy in SF but could be better
review.reviewText:
The room is clean and the location is perfect. There are only two complaints.
The hotel only have 20 parking spaces. That means most of their guests cant't park inside the hotels. You have to either park on the street or find some other local parking lot. We were fortunate to find street space. It took us quite some time to find the space though. Hotel food was pretty nasty. The pasta we ordered were pretty nasty. They tangled together and not easy to swallow.
