review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Clean and hospitable with free glass of wine and appetizer in the evening. Complimentary continental breakfast in their restaurant was also a pleasant plus. They are doing a great job for the price! Would stay their again. Clean is always prime importance to me and pleasant staff which they had both.
review.locationRemarks: North Beach for night life. Union Square for shopping. Food everywhere.

review.title: Cute Hotel. Close to all.
review.reviewText: Cute hotel near everything. You can walk to Fishermans Wharf, Restaraunts, trendy bars. Our room even had a balcony with the view of the golden gate bridge. Very cool!

review.title: Great hotel close to attractions with an excellent view
review.reviewText:
Close to many sites in walking distance. Staff were very helpful providing maps and details about public transport.

The hotel's restaurant, Caffe Como has excellent food, it is a must.

We could see the Golden Gate Bridge from our hotel room.
review.locationRemarks:
Walk down the beach to the Golden Gate bridge, walk out on the bridge at least until the first pillar, then walk through the forest back into the city.

Another day, walk the opposite direction down the wharfs (you'll get good photos of the Bay Bridge towards the end), there is plenty to see.

The City Hall at night time is definitely worth seeing.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: I wanted to write this review because I rely on others reviews when selecting hotels. I did read where the hotel had changed hands, was under renovation and had no air conditioning. Consistent positive comments included excellent service, comfortable beds, and very clean. Because of the great location and reasonable rates (considering the price of other hotels located near), my husband and I decided to try the DaVinci Villa. I would agree with all the positive comments about cleanliness, great service, and comfortable beds. I'm glad I knew that things were under construction--they are making great upgrades and changes. We were fortunate enough to witness an artist painting a mural in the dining room while eating breakfast one morning. If there was a con it would be the size of the bathroom. An additional vanity outside the bathroom would be a great addition. There was always a nice breeze into our room so the temperature wasn't a problem; however, the street is a bit noisy. The view of the Golden Gate bridge outweighed this inconvenience. Overall, it was a great choice for us!
review.locationRemarks: Near fisherman's wharf. It's close to restaurants and entertainment.

review.title: view of the Golden Gate
review.reviewText: Your info on the net said that the hotel was newly renovated. However, it is really a work in progress. There were parts that were not finished. The fan and ceiling light in the room kept going on and off even when supposedly shut off. Continental breakfast started the day before we left and we were told about it when we returned from breakfast. The staff needs to explore the immediate area so they can answer questions as to where one can find services. They did know the bus number to take to get to and from Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly.

review.title: just fine if you are not to picky
review.reviewText: this is fine place, just if you are not to picky person ,i was on the fifth floor i had to go with one elevator to the fourth and walk through the outside corridor and than take the second elevator to the fifth floor, they change the bed sheets on the request only, every third day ,other than that bathroom its nice and clean, room is decent and service is good

review.title: A Very "meh" Hotel
review.reviewText:
Pros:
Nice neighborhood, extremely friendly staff, close to fishermans warf, lovely view of golden gate

Cons:
extremely overpriced for services offered, no sauna and pool is under construction (despite advertisement), housekeeping comes at 8AM and barge in even if you ask them to wait, no bathtub or vanity in bathroom, elevator is sketchy (safety permit expired in 2009), no mini-fridge or microwave, safes don't work, paper thin walls, no A/C, tiny window so little ventilation, rooms smell a bit moldy, wireless is expensive, slow and unreliable

Only go here if you get a REALLY good deal on the rooms. If you want this quality, you may as well stay at a Motel 6.

review.title: Not Impressed! Read this Review of the da Vinci Hotel before you Go!
review.reviewText: First off: I don't think this hotel can possibly be 4 star!? Where did that come from. I'd say 3 star personally. Good things: staff was excellent, friendly, happy and nice at all times. There is a new restaraunt at the hotel....perfect for breakfast....it's clean and staff is nice. The beds were awesome and comfy! Remodeling continues. Not such good things: Layout of the hotel makes it quite noisy. Between construction, and people walking the corridors, was loud. Tried to nap during the day....wasn't gonna happen. Lots of slamming doors. Was quiet at night, however. Room was hot...and they don't have A/C. Location isn't great. It is on the 47/49 bus line which quickly gets you to the subways, but.....there is NOTHING directly around the hotel. Thank goodness they had a place to eat for breakfast. The room remodel is ok. They are going more streamlined and modern. However, room lacks character. There are NO pictures on the wall. Upgrades were spotty. Some nice fixtures but then they went with cheaper fiberglass shower!? Need to dust on the top of closet area....yuck! Did a bedbug check...no bedbugs found! They have a pool under construction....but when is swimming weather in SF?! Anyway, it's an ok place....staff made it better. Beds were great! But, I think it's a 3 star hotel personally....and you might be better off paying a little more and staying exactly where you wanna be...in the action! BTW, cost of hotel is not really worth the price.

review.title: Hotel was still under construction not a 4 star Hotel
review.reviewText:
This property is not a 4 star hotel I live in las vegas and was very dissapointed . The hotel pool was under constructioon they were jack hammering in the middle if the day and I had to be moved 3 times just to find some piece and quiet bathroom was tiny and had no bathtub no were to put my emenities .

there was no black out on window had to call down stairs to get a blanket to put over window. the room had no air conditioner and we had to sleep with the window open and here the cars all night. there was not 1 mirror in the room . it was very over priced .

review.title: Good value and good location.
review.reviewText: The hotel recently (August 2011) reopened as the da Vinci Villa and amenities including the pool and sauna were not open. The hotel is on a busy street and bus line so it can be noisy well past midnight. But the location is convenient for visiting Fisherman's Wharf, the Presidio, and Golden Gate Park. And since this is a motor inn, onsite covered parking is available, convenient for travelers passing through the city. New refurbished rooms, friendly staff, and a good cafe. A great value.
